Reviews.Title: “Facelift needed”
Reviews.Author: ViajeroESQ
Reviews.Content: The staff greets you in French and that is tacky. The rooms are fine but need work. The bathrooms seem to have been fixed recently as is the lower lobby. The main lobby is small and feels tight and dark. It is well located if you are in town for a short business trip and need to go downtown or to Doral. Not a family resort. It is more than a typical airport hotel but can do a lot better with such a good brand like Sofitel. Good size rooms. Low ceilings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: binho_1973
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed just for one night to get an early flight the next day. Really close to the airport (5min by car), the room was not luxurious but nice and their staff were friendly. The shuttle service was very helpful and ponctual (every 20 min). Although it was near the airport I didn't hear the air traffic when I was sleeping. They have a nice French restaurant! I would recommend if you need a hotel near the airport for a short period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Oudated Hotel, with Good Service”
Reviews.Author: angm212
Reviews.Content: The customer service was great from the front desk to the restaurant staff and concierge. I ordered room service and the food was phenomenal. I enjoyed the ambience of the pool during the late afternoon and drinks outside in the evening. The property had great service, however it was somewhat lacking in other areas. I understand they were at full capacity this week it being during spring break, however, I was disappointed to receive a handicap room when checking in Sunday-Friday for such a long stay. By the time I got to my room late that evening I did not feel like moving my heavy bags to another room so did not approach the front desk. There was no counter space at all in my bathroom and no color of art on the far wall of my room making it for a dull experience. My colleague's bathroom was much better other than her hole in the shower ceiling. I spent many evenings in my room and this did not feel like a home away from home. I travel frequently for work and this is something I anticipate. The beds were very comfortable, but did not offer a sheet. I woke up many times very warm at night. The rooms were a little outdated and could use some work. I could also easily hear my neighbors next to my room. Would I stay at your hotel again? Yes, if the price was right and I needed to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Just another airport hotel, but what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pevast
Reviews.Content: Sofitel, close to Miami International Airport would normally be considered just another airporthotel, but not Sofitel. Pick up service from the airport, firendly, personal and fun. Checking in, speedy and effective. Nice lobby, very busy but what a lobby. Rooms, would need some attention and possibly renovation. Otherwise clean, great bed, quiet and with a cool AC. Pool side perfect, Hotel bar with nice service, friendly and observant. Generally tha staff was just great. Personal service without overdoing it. Dinner at the hotel was magnificent but hefty priced. If wether allows, sit in the garden, just perfect for a late dinner. Buffe brekfast was ok but not really up to full standard. In all a great hotel experince, airport hotel or not. Sofitel makes a true difference for its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Miami rocks!”
Reviews.Author: munich27032000
Reviews.Content: Our room was just fantastic with a great view and all necessary utilities included. Thanks to Ana Sotes Dagmara the room was kept clean daily on a very high level. All staff members did an amazing job, starting with Andres and Jermaine who helped us with a rental car and directions, restaurant recommendations and so much more. They and their team went above and beyond all expectations. The breakfast was just so enjoyable and Menelus, Michel, Jesus, Magdalena, Derling, Carlos and Pedro showed an excellent and very attentive service. We would like to point out, that we were amazed by the service at the bar. Alan, Pavlina, Jaime, Angelica and Daniel made us feel so welcome and provided us with superior and luxurious service. Yolaina, Kimberly, Martha and Myrna at the Petit Marche were just so sweet and helpful. Emma, Lazaro, Alicia and Carmen did an outstanding job fulfilling our special requests at the room service. While having dinner at La Riviera, we had the chance to thank The Chef, Matthias, personally for the amazing dinner, served by Carlos, Diego and Emilse. The restaurant manager MinJu was totally in control of the operations and you could see that she does her job with passion. Florence was very helpful with our reservations and made us feel like home. All in all it is the staff that makes a huge difference and we will always come back!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Henrique M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very beautiful and the rooms are good. But they don't even try to make you feel at home. With some exceptions, staff could even sound rude for my standards and one situation was actually hilarious. I took the transfer to the airport with two other people and it was really cold in the bus, but when I asked the driver if he could reduce the air-conditioning (and he speaks my language, so there was no possibility of missunderstanding), he said to me that he could only turn it off or on and turning it off would make him hot! That pretty much sumarizes it all.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe a good airport hotel, not good for Miami”
Reviews.Author: Aethelred
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by our hosts, and it always took someone to take us anywhere and back, or very expensive cabs ($ 40), to get anywhere at all. Miami is like that - but if one wants to explore it a little, then a better-located hotel would be good. There is literally nothing in walking distance, and the hotel restaurants and small shops are not really great. The hotel is nice, but what it is not is French in the least - some French phrases and marketing excepted. Nor are the beds, but the beds are very nice and a highlight. Free wifi is a plus, and not as common as one might think. I had a corner room with view of both lagoon/airport and city; the airport is practically inaudible. (Contrary to a Sweet Sixteen party at the pool the night we came, which really wrooomed through all the walls, but mercifully ended at a decent time - still, not nice if you would want to sleep after a long flight.) We did some work at the lobby and lounge, which as the entire hotel is a bit tired and worn, but still servicable. The pool was really disappointing; it's more a hanging than a swimming place, and I understand this to be Floridaesque - but for "a relaxing day at the pool", this is not too nice an ambiance either. Staff was good to very good. Altogether, globally speaking, the corporate rate we had ($ 150 without tax) seemed a bit on the steep side.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Sunnshine59
Reviews.Content: This is a nice place, a bit dated but very clean and nicely appointed. Poor service in the bar and the live music was way too loud. Best part is the frequent free shuttles to and from the airport. Our room was very nice and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Miami”
Reviews.Author: F_Brz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel Miami with my family for three days in january, before driving to Orlando. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and they have a friendly staff. It's located near the airport, but I couldn't hear any noise. Great sleep quality and L'Occitane hotel toiletries. There's also a shuttle to/from the airport available.

Reviews.Title: “Not The Sofitel I'm Used To”
Reviews.Author: pedidoc
Reviews.Content: After some issues with flight cancellations, I was offered a stay at the Sofitel Miami. Clearly, this is not the Sofitel that I am used to. This location is not as upscale and exclusive as the others. It does look like an old hotel that was upgraded with nice furniture and fixtures. The structures of the halls and rooms leaves much to be desired. Check in was efficient. Front desk and concierge staff were very helpful. Gym and pool were nice and well maintained. It is a good place to stay over if you are overnighting for a cruise, business, etc. Ordered out for authentic Cuban food Casa Juan Restaurant. They delivered. Had breakfast in the hotel the following morning. Breakfast was amazing. Would recommend for short overnight stay while in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Airport (Shuttl) very friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: GrisVoyageurs
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly; but the hotel as such need a refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “WAY BELOW SOFITEL STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: Peter_R_Smith
Reviews.Content: This is not the Sofitel New York, Sofitel Chicago or like any other Sofitel I have stayed in previously. It is a long way from being typical of the Sofitel brand. Feels like it used to be a Hilton that Sofitel have tried to upscale by adding upgraded furniture, but forgetting to update the bathroom and other amenities. Friendly, helpful staff. Very comfortable bed with quality linens and great pillows. Free internet with reasonable speed. No bathrobes in the closet. No freebie shower gel. No face cloth in the bathroom. Didnâ€™t get what I was expecting for the $180 I paid. Probably worth $120 - $150. I will look elsewhere next time unless I can get a much better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EddeeM
Reviews.Content: This elegant boutique hotel is full-service in a gracious way. European in origin, the staff is polite and friendly. The concierge went above and beyond helping us arrange our international boarding passes, even to the point of calling the airline. We watched a glorious orange and red sunset from the quiet pool (a waterfall masks the airplanes). Our room was tasteful and lovely, and the breakfast delivered to it came on time, was delicious, and affordable. We will seek a Sofitel in every city we travel to, and hope for more in the USA.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to say, but all the poor reviews were right!”
Reviews.Author: damo101
Reviews.Content: Less a Sofitel, more a dated Mercure. We stayed here for one night after flying from Washington. The room was tired and while the furnishings were from the Sofitel catalogue, they looked like they had been discarded from a better class hotel. The bathroom was tidy, but old. Not a five star hotel, more a 3.5 star. Disappointing for this usually luxury brand. On the bright side, we still got the macaroons and a-club silver welcome drinks on check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Kirk V
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Sofitel Miami. Both stays were relaxing comfortable and completely enjoyable. Location to the airport is convenient and airplane noise is minimal. Pool and deck area comfortable and relaxing. Will plan on staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Travis K
Reviews.Content: The stafff was very attentive. The room was AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel At The Airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We needed to stay one night before travelling to Orlando by car. We came late and where picking up the car early in the morning. The hotel is located close to the airport, it is a beautiful property with swimming pool and all that you need for a one night stay. We enjoyed our stay, but little dissapointed of the a la carte breakfast due to the fact that all Sofitel hotels we have stayed in else where have a big buffet. The hotel is perfect for stays connected with the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise accomodations”
Reviews.Author: MsDuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel one night prior to our cruise. Arrangements were made through norwegian cruise line. We paid $200. It is very close to the airport but the planes really didnt bother us. While the hotel was nice, I would not consider it a "luxury hotel" as it claims. All Staff we encountered were quite nice and efficient. The public areas, ie bar and seating area, restaraunt, and pool area (while small), were quite nice. The rooms themselves were fine, but nothing more spectacular than your newer Holiday Inn or Best Western. Would stay again if our purpose was the same. To me, this was an expensive hotel, but I really have no idea what a nice hotel in Miami should go for.

Reviews.Title: “"Good Airport Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaHarmony
Reviews.Content: Good shuttle service- easy check-in. Got in late and left early, but no complaints other than kind of noisy neighbors in the morning. Staff was very personable and friendly. Really liked the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a renovated room!”
Reviews.Author: Panda3403
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Sofital Miami twice this month. We chose it because its convenient to the Miami International Airport, and we've had good experiences with Sofital hotels in the past. Our first night at the Sofital in Miami was not great. Not awful. But not what we expected from past stays at this hotel. The room, though clean, was on a lower floor and needed to be updated. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant. We ordered steaks, medium rare. They arrived tough and gray with a few limp vegetables on the side. I sent an email to the Manager of the hotel, expressing my dissatisfaction, and I got a nice reply, thanking me for my feedback. When I returned two nights ago, I was given a beautiful room on the 15th floor, nicely renovated. We had dinner at the same restaurant, and this time, we ordered scallops and mahi mahi. They were delicious! I wish they had a better wine list for wine by the glass. I ended up paying $21 for one glass of wine because the wine by the glass offerings were pretty bad,but that said, the restaurant and the hotel are back on my list of places to stay when i'm passing through Miami. I will, however, always ask for a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Dayroom before flight”
Reviews.Author: Jorich
Reviews.Content: We came off our cruise ship at 9am & our flight home to the UK wasn't until 9pm. we booked a dayroom at the Sofitel & were so glad we did ! It gave us an extra days holiday rather than hanging around the airport or trudging round a shopping mall with our luggage. We arrived at 9.30am & although check-in was 10am the lovely receptionist Justine gave us our room straightaway along with info about the pool, bar, restaurant etc. The room was fine for an airport hotel & the bathroom was spacious & plenty of nice toiletries. The pool area was pleasant with comfy padded loungers, tables & chairs & canopied day beds. There was no bar service at the pool but the lobby bar was just a few steps away as was the restaurant with indoor & terrace seating. We had a lovely relaxing day by the pool, a good lunch & aroom to shower & change before leaving for the airport on the hotel's free shuttle which arrived bang on time. We have never booked a dayroom before but it was worth every penny of the Â£70/$107 we paid & we would definitely do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight between Flights”
Reviews.Author: Windborne
Reviews.Content: Booked Sofitel when our travel from the Caribbean to Boston required a Miami overnight. Greatly exceeded the "in airport" options at similar price. The staff has customer-service to a tea...all with a Francais Flair. Lovely room, restaurant, and attentive front desk. An easy 4:30 AM shuttle back to the airport. Some airport noise overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect one or two-night stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessica P
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here all the time but haven't been to Miami recently and was a little wary to stay here seeing as some of the reviews say it's a little run down and it'd been a few years so thought it might have been. We got a great deal, however and it was only night so we took the chance and weren't disappointed. I requested a room where no pets or smoke had been present since I have allergies - so I'm not sure if this helped, but our room was very clean and the furniture did not look worn. Bed was amazing. We had a partial view of the airport - I'm a light sleeper - and was not disturbed by the planes. The staff's great, the free airport shuttle a bonus (although most hotels within the area offer this). And the $10 roundtrip shuttle to Dolphin mall was also good for us (although other hotels in the area also offer this). I only recommend for a short time because if you're actually visiting Miami, you'll probably want to stay in a different area, closer to hotspots like the beach and downtown, but if you want to stay close to the airport and some of the bigger malls and aren't looking to do much while in town, stay here! We also didn't have a car, but if you had one there are many areas within driving distance worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MAL58
Reviews.Content: I loved my recent stay at the Miami Sofitel hotel. Right from walking in the door, I was greeted warmly, had a quick check in and felt very comfortable! All the staff was attentive and willing to make sure my stay was memorable. Room service was much better than other hotels - quick and the food was very tasty! I will stay there again! MA.

Reviews.Title: “2 day business trip was fine.”
Reviews.Author: Henry V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doral location in January. The accommodations were fine. Interior and rooms were slightly dated but more than adequate. Restaurant food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “superb staff”
Reviews.Author: erobinson
Reviews.Content: we have been staying at the Sofitel for 15 years, during which time we have always been well looked after and found the accommodation to be good with very comfortable beds! The staff throughout the hotel are extremely helpful and will assist in almost anything you require. The familiar "Bon jour, welcome home" upon arrival always makes us feel right at home! A room on the lagoon side provides a most beautiful view of sunsets and the twinkling lights of MIami. Being close to the 836 motorway, It is an excellent location for getting to South Beach, Miami Marina or malls such as Dolphin. We look forward to our next visit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “close to the airport and welcome relief at 7am”
Reviews.Author: ThirroulAnnette
Reviews.Content: The complimentary shuttle bus picked us up from the airport immediately and had us to the hotel in minutes. We were in our room quickly and the hotel restaurant served a great breakfast. After a night on a plane we needed a good sleep and it was quiet despite the proximity to the airport. We were unfortunate that we arrived on the coldest day that Miami had experienced for some years but when I asked for the air con to be fixed a serviceman arrived in minutes and had the room warm very quickly. We ordered room service late at night and the food was delivered fast. A shuttle bus is available to take cruise passengers to the port and you just need to book with the front desk. Hotel is clean and comfortable and the service and food in the restaurant is good.

Reviews.Title: “day room at sofitel miami”
Reviews.Author: springholme
Reviews.Content: just a short review to tell anyone wishing to stay here even for the day - DON'T- room was dirty, wallpaper ripped, smelly definitely would not have stayed night. Pool was just as bad, freezing water in pool and generally just not clean. However restaurants did look nice but we didnt dine in any.

Reviews.Title: “Short, but Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Claire2525_12
Reviews.Content: We stay here when leaving early out of Miami airport. The Sofitel never disappoints - clean, fresh and very good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “not quite what was expected”
Reviews.Author: AZOR_12
Reviews.Content: Based on the Sofitel name, we thought this one would be pretty nice. It was not quite up to Sofitel standards. The room was badly in need of painting and carpet. Everything else seemed to need attention.

Reviews.Title: “A decent quality Miami airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: spysmum
Reviews.Content: Airport hotels vary enormously, from shabby and run-down to expensive deluxe oases of calm. Because of our flight timing, we had to stay near the airport when travelling from Miami International, and picked the Sofitel as a mid range choice. The room was comfortable, quiet with a pleasant bathroom, but strangely, lacked a fridge We ate an excellent lunch in the restaurant, choosing the reasonably priced set lunch, though the menu had a wide choice of offerings. The pool area was large and pleasant, but an enormous waterfall meant that many sun loungers were constantly showered if even the slightest breeze was blowing. We found it irritating to be blasted by overloud loop system pop music when trying to sit and read, or to eat lunch on the terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta take the good with the bad!”
Reviews.Author: chey1234
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel looks very old and dirty. The rooms are very average. The carpet looks dirty. Walking down the hallways very bland.I would compare it to the same standards as an comfort suites. With that being said. The lobby is amazing along with the restaraunt pool area and the staff. I would compare that to a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average airport hotel - needs a decorative refresh”
Reviews.Author: pottering_pasty
Reviews.Content: The staff and service differentiate this hotel from other airport hotels. However, the decor needs an update. The reception and bar area are nice - spacious, well laid out. The corridors and rooms are average. The main issue with the rooms is that they are very poorly soundproofed. Even in rooms at the opposite side to the runway you can easily hear the take-off roar. And the hotel is very close to the runway! Add to this that you can clearly hear what's going on in the room next-door and you have a recipe for an unrelaxing time. The outside space is quite nice - pool and bar area. There's also a good fitness room. The food and drink in the bar was great though Would I stay here again - yeah probably - but getting a peaceful room will be tricky.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, but.....this place is just average.”
Reviews.Author: mshbnyehud
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at other Miami Airport hotels which are much better than Sofitel, notwithstanding their exceptional service. I admit getting in too late, and leaving too early, to use any of the hotel amenities. Which leaves the hallways and rooms. I think the decor is significantly dated, and the entry to my room smelled strange. The room amenities are okay, but overall, I was underwhelmed. Plus, it takes too much time to get to the hotel using their shuttle, which only runs every 30 minutes. And, for the forseeable future, there's lots of construction making the trek from airport to hotel extra long. For the money, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and service”
Reviews.Author: mauro p
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Personal with a high performance in attendance the customers. Good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay before Cruise”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaGolfer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here before a cruise on Princess. The hotel is very nice, the beds are some of the most comfortable in any hotel I have stayed. We arrived late in the afternoon and did not want to have to go out to find something to eat. We were told the restaurant was too expensive for what you got so we stopped at the bar to have a drink. While there the bartender showed us the bar menu and we stayed and it was fantastic. The wine was cold and the food was very good, the service was very personable and over all we loved it an will go back to the Sofitel when in Miami again. In the morning it is a short walk to a grocery store to stock up on supplies and then we were off and running for our cruise. We had no issues with the hotel and the coffee shop in the lobby was nice. Great place to stay and will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you want to stay by the airport”
Reviews.Author: GoHawks5
Reviews.Content: Although not the top quality Sofitel that you might expect say at the midtown Manhattan location, still a very good value. Rooms are very nice, just outside of the flight paths. Fitness center is well equipped. Staff as always in a Sofitel very high quality. Restaurant very good. If as a businessman you need a hotel after a flight or as a tourist to change flights for the next day or for a cruise, this is a very nice respite. Internet was slow, although I've had slower at 4 star hotels. This should be improved.

Reviews.Title: “INTERNET SLOWER THAN DIALUP!”
Reviews.Author: David_Kirkland
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting on a Tuesday morning in Coral Gables. This hotel was conveniently located and well reviewed, so I booked it. I arrived late that night, was able to eventually download my email, and went to sleep. I got up at 6 and logged in, trying to work. I kept getting timed out of websites, and finally went to a site to test the speed. It was 28 KBPS, slower then the old dialup speeds. Horrendous! I was not able to work or prepare the things I needed for my meeting. Thanks a lot Sofitel. Oh, and at 6 AM airplanes started flying over the hotel - for an airport hotel, they should have invested some money in sound deadening. Felt like I was on the runway. I will NOT be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The true highlight of my 3 week vacation - the Sofitel Miami. The Jewel of Miami!”
Reviews.Author: HNLGAL
Reviews.Content: Every single detail that could have been thought of was. It was one of the nicest, if not the very nicest hotel I have ever stayed in - and I have stayed in many! Every single employee I spoke with was very pleasant, as helpful as they could be and very informative. Small details such as a swing away magnification mirror with a backlight that made for the ideal night light, superb amenities.... (quality of creams, lotions, shampoos etc., a couple of compact emery boards, Qtips, makeup remover pads etc.), ultra soft sheets/bedding, oversized thick towels, outstanding views and delicious room-service! A housekeeper who didn't speak English and wouldn't take no for an answer helping me with my bags.... And then wouldn't take any money! Attentive with a capital A, Excellent Service with a capital E and S and superb quality and value. Nothing but the best. And yet, so affordable. So many more details etc... I HIGHLY recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “An embarrassment to the Sofitel brand.”
Reviews.Author: andyg16
Reviews.Content: "A Sofitel at that price?" we thought to ourselves. It should have been the proverbial red flag. This hotel is something of an embarrassment to the brand. It looks like a Holiday Inn that hasn't been particularly well cared for - stained carpets, dingy rooms, uninspiring furnishing. In short, it simply doesn't live up to the Sofitel aim. It's convenient to the airport and the service is reasonable. The barking dog in the room next door was surpassed only by the duck. Yes, duck. The hotel allows pets. We're assuming the duck was in that category as the restaurant was actually pretty good...

Reviews.Title: “Good Nights Sleep”
Reviews.Author: JessiDoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before a cruise. As usual the Sofitel beds are the best. The hotel itself is trendy and clean. We didn't eat in the hotel, just grabbed coffees from the Starbucks downstairs in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for some.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleS_dub
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night following a cruise- the hotel is very convenient to the airport, and they were gracious to allow us to check in to our room quite early. The hotel isn't fancy- and even a little tired. That said, the staff were very friendly, the room was clean, nice amenities (L'Occitane), comfy bed, and the airport noise wasn't a bother for us. The concierge arranged a one day car rental for us, and what was supposed to be a 15 minute wait for the shuttle to take us to our car ended up being an hour, which was annoying. As others have reported, the airport shuttle was also a little loose in terms of its schedule - it was supposed to come every 30 minutes, but that seems more like an aspiration. And given how many people and bags they jam onto each van, it's more like an hourly shuttle. We ended up taking a cab for $15- money well spent in my mind, and definitely eased the stress of transitioning to the airport. The highlight of our stay was by far the dinner we had - the food was just outstanding- as was the service. It very much exceeded our expectations for an airport hotel, and more than made up for the issues I mentioned above. The food was interesting, well prepared, the bread was made in house, and the staff were very professional- it's not cheap, but was such a nice surprise that we didn't mind the expense at all. The food easily competed with the food we had during our pre-cruise stay at the Ritz Carlton in Fort Lauderdale.

Reviews.Title: “Experience”
Reviews.Author: Yvonne H
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed hotel. The the porters were very helpful indeed especially Ricardo. Would recommend. Myself and partner enjoyed stay. Even helped to get us to the airport on time.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Brandie_in_Boston
Reviews.Content: I stayed one overnight at this hotel en route to Haiti. I actually didn't choose it myself, but was traveling with others who made the choice. First, the shuttle didn't seem to come all that frequently. I waited 30 minutes-plus for it. Check-in was quite easy though as an Accor member they had me wait at the desk for a welcome letter which was really nothing more than that, so it seemed like a bit of a waste. The room was not great. Not super clean (pillows on the bed had visible stains on them). The carpet was old. Overall it was just a bit run down. Toiletries were nice though. The worst part, is unlike some other MIA airport hotels, you were literally on the back of the airfield. I didn't sleep more than a few hours. The hotel wasn't that cheap so I suspect you can find better deals else where near the airport where you will actually be able to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice......but”
Reviews.Author: ollowood
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed at this hotel for one night before flying out to the caribbean. We checked in late at night and was shown to a nice room. However there was a really bad smell in the room that wouldnt not go away! As this was in the middle of the night i didnt want to go down to check in and find another room. I told the manager the following day and to be fair they gave me a big discount on the price i paid. Apart from that the hotel is beautiful and near to everything in Miami and obvioulsy the airport! Would recommend and would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Miami - near Miami airport”
Reviews.Author: XTIAN3000
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel is amazing except the rooms. The first room I was put in had more scuff marks and stains then any hotel room I'd ever been to. And I've been inside too many. The furnishings from the bathroom counter to the desk lamp were rusty, dilapidated, or falling apart. The room also lacked all the standard hotel room amenities. Front desk moved me to another room that actually felt like a hotel room. Like someone actually took care of it. Unfortunately, the room layouts are cold and unforgiving. Looks like the hotel spent some money trying to update the look and failed miserably. A big, fat F on interior design... said the designer. The lobby, restaurants, meeting facilities, outdoor pool and gym are all on the level of great or outstanding. Even more outstanding is the hotel's quality of customer service. The best I've come across in quite some time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for airport travel”
Reviews.Author: mcl3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice. Great location for the airport. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Airport shuttle was prompt. Very clean. The restaurant was ok, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Good for airport nearby”
Reviews.Author: europearoundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here in late Dec, 2011 for mix of business and pleasure. Lobby and common areas nice and clean, but rooms and hallways seem a bit dated and worn out (we stayed on 14th floor). Carpeting was stained and worn out in room and hall.Wide mix of guests - ages, languages, couples and families, etc , so makes for interesting crowd and varying noise level around lobby, bar, restaurants and pool. Reception staff and concierge very nice (David was professional). Parking costs around $9-11 a night. Parking staff nice and friendly. Check out was crowded, busy. High point is cafe in hotel lobby serving coffees and pastries. Be prepared to speak a little bit of Spanish or French in this hotel, and English as a back-up. Great location for airport! Also around the corner try the Don Jose cuban restaurant-- great food and people. take a ride down Calleocho (8th) for a real Miami feel and great food and service at Cafe Versailles! It's the best! have the caffe con leche. Good overall experience and we may return if in area again and need to be close to the airport. Otherwise, try someplace closer to the downtown for more to do and see nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant lake view room”
Reviews.Author: Mariner1947
Reviews.Content: A Europeon style hotel in the middle of no where with good service and well appointed modern rooms. not slot to say for a quiet stay.

Reviews.Title: “convenient luxury”
Reviews.Author: bayarea000
Reviews.Content: stayed here for two nites while before a cruise. everything about this hotel was modern, luxurious and very friendly. The staff seemed genuine not rehearsed. there is a shuttle from the airport. the price was very reasonable. i didn't eat in the reataurant but a friend did. she said it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight MIA”
Reviews.Author: 3tonkies
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel was nice. It was a little dated. I always pick hotels with room service 24/7, not knowing how I'll feel when I arrive. Sofitel offers a limited menu after midnight, and we did not choose to order anything. They have a small bakery in the lobby that had delicious croissants and other pastries that are made in-house. The shuttle service to and from MIA was reliable and friendly and even provided water for the very short trip. The employees were very friendly and helpful. This is a very good choice if you need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the Airport but far from South Beach”
Reviews.Author: SanjG
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel Miami for a business trip for 2 nights only. Room was average and in need of a major renovation. Breakfast was a la carte and expensive hence chose to pick up individual breakfast items from Starbucks conveniently situated next to the lobby. The area is quiet with very little night-life or dining options hence a taxi ride to South Beach maybe wise but consider a fare of $50.00 as it is a distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent value for the cost and was only a 5 minute shuttle ride to Miami Airport. The pool is beautiful and the service was excellent. Sofitel is in the class of Hilton, Sheraton, Hyatt, etc. but does not have the same level of visibility in the US so tends to have cheaper comparable ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the very last minute for a short shopping trip just after Xmas, so during the very high season, when most hotels mercilessly jack up their rates as high as possible. I could not have asked for a more pleasant stay. The "Luxury Room" I received, with a beautiful 9th floor view, was priced in line with "Standard Rooms" at competing nearby hotels. My favorite things about this hotel include: the VERY friendly, welcoming and professional service I received from each and every employee; the food, (not inexpensive but impeccably prepared - noting that I ate in the lounge every evening), and the fluffy, comfy bed. (I LOVE Duvets with soft white sheets!) Other things I appreciated were the Free WiFi, the little Starbucks cafe, the beautiful pool area, the L'Occitaine toiletries and the fact that I was made to feel quite at home despite being a single female, which isn't always the case when I'm on the road. The only improvements I would suggest would be for Sofitel to consider upgrading the flooring in its rooms to wood or laminate vs. carpeting; to provide those little white slippers (at least in the Luxury rooms); to add Minibars to the rooms and lastly, to heat the pool - which was downright freezing. While I bravely swam in it, most guests did not due to the water temperature. I am a very frequent worldwide traveler and have stayed in a wide range of hotels (from basic to very high end). For me, the Sofitel was a good value and I would definitely return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient if you want close access to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Ocahan
Reviews.Content: First time I have ever been disappointed with Sofitel. The location should say that you are next to Miami International Airport and a long way from downtown Miami. Pack your earplugs as the planes depart and land 24/7 and yes you will hear them. It feels old and dated, I couldn't actually believe it was a Sofitel. When we arrived the doorman seemed too busy to open the door despite standing there doing nothing, and when I pressed the button to open the doors electronically he then told me they were broken. Moving on things did improve with a friendly and prompt check-in, luggage to the rooms and free Wi-fi. The room was quite dated with old carpet and and cupboards accompanied by a damp moist smell. The bed and other furniture were newer though. The beds were the highlight of the stay so I guess I really can't complain in that respect and at the end of the day that's what you want a good sleep (Thankfully I had my own ear plugs). We also ordered room service which was prompt and friendly and enjoyed a pleasant meal of grilled salmon and vegetables and fruit platter.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Manager11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel Miami for 3 nights. Comfortable, clean, great restaurant, wonderful staff. Would highly recommend to all/ anyone. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in Miami named SOFITEL”
Reviews.Author: Vytautas M
Reviews.Content: I am somewhat prejudiced as I have stayed at this Hotel many times. It is managed by a Mr Balendra Nagesvaran who has made this property run as a highly tuned machine! This Hotel is very close to the Miami airport but the soundproofing is such that only rarely can one hear the air traffic. The building itself is beautiful and the facade reflects the French tricolor. The blue Lagoon adds extraordinary beauty as well. A hotel should have a heart. Sofitel Miami has hundreds of hearts which are exemplified by its employees. From the check in desk to the Concierge station only good will prevails. Doors are opened smiles are given and good will exudes from all. The dining room is outstanding in quality, value and service. When you arrive to this hotel always ask for a lovely lady in the dining room by the name of Derling and in the evening ask for Maxime Carlo and Daniel who will cater to your every wish. When I leave this property I feel a touch of sadness which immediatley is overcome by the knowledge that I will be returnig there soon. Doctor M.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality and rooms. Good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: tulipberlin
Reviews.Content: Excellent valie for the money. Super nice and clean rooms. Very close to the airport (which also means you may hear the iccasional plane take off or land). Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Radiant360
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a pre-cruise weekend. The location wasn't directly near stores but low cost shuttle services are available to Dolphin Mall (great shopping--must check out the Lord &Taylor outlet!!!!!) or to South Beach- approximately $10 round-trip. Rooms were clean and the beds were featherbed,sinkable soft for a great night's sleep. Free internet available on the bar level.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent as always”
Reviews.Author: yflavio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little old, but the service and the staff are excellent. Need a room refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “It was almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlejfan
Reviews.Content: I booked the Sofitel because American Airlines had a promotion that gave additional points when you booked through their vacation site and we needed a place to stay pre-cruise so I thought I would give them a chance. For the most part, our stay was fine. Staff was uber friendly! We were taken to our room by the bellhop; 10th floor overlooking the lagoon. Room and bath area was very clean. Yes, it's a little dated, however for the price of $100 a night, I wasn't complaining. Bed was totally comfortable. We had free internet and got free parking for the night. Our only complaint was we came back from dinner around 10:30 and there was a band playing very loud and we could hear it all the way to the 10th floor. We took our showers and were in bed by 11PM and the band was still playing. We did not expect to hear this sort of noise at such a late hour. Never heard the airplanes at all, the band though was a different story. We had breakfast in the dining room....very chic! Loved the service and the breakfast. French press coffee and fresh squeezed orange juice were to die for! We arranged a shuttle over to the cruise port, 20 bucks for the two of us....pretty happy with that. If I were to stay again, I think I would ask to be put somewhere where the band not an issue, or make sure there were no activities going on over the weekend. I would love to give this property an excellent, but I expected a little bit quieter of an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place near airport and cruise port”
Reviews.Author: RetiredgolferOlympia
Reviews.Content: Ten minutes from Miami airport and twenty minutes to cruise port. Rooms were spacious and very comfortable. Arrived at hotel early and they did their best to get us in our room by 10:am. Flew all night so that was a real treat. They make arrangements to travel to cruise port, which was handy. Walking distance to a couple real good restaurants, (Chinese and Italian), plus grocery store. Even though next to the airport, was not noisy at all. Customer service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Softel Miami”
Reviews.Author: Fernando H
Reviews.Content: Excelent, I always use this Hotel when I am in Miami

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Zoeluma
Reviews.Content: My son and I needed a hotel near Miami International Airport and the Sofitel was very convenient. All the employees at the hotel were very helpful and polite. The rooms could be in better conditions; the carpet was a bit worn but the bathroom was very clean and working just fine. There is free parking available and shuttle to and from the airport. I would definitely stay there again; by the way, it was my son's second time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Layover Hotel but Loyalty Program Lacking”
Reviews.Author: Parity
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Sofitel Miami several times a year over the last decade. The reason I keep going back is because of their fluffy down bedding, flat screen tv, airport shuttle service and familiarity. The Sofitel is far more airport hotel than luxury hotel, but this is reflected in their rates. Over the years their shuttle has downgraded and the rooms are getting close to being in need of an upgrade. There are not many shops/restaurants in the vicinity and eating/drinking in the hotel can quickly add up to more than your room. They are very good about accommodating late check out requests. The worst change has been in their loyalty program, the old program was great, they knew I was a frequent visitor, provided quick check-in at the concierge, frequent room upgrades, and a free drink coupon. Since the change to A Club they have now forgotten I am a frequent visitor and decided to not transfer any points to the new program, so I have decided it is time to check out the competition after a decade of loyalty.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: navymom123
Reviews.Content: I stayed here along with my niece, mother and sister ( we shared 2 rooms) as we were waiting t take a cruise the following day. Rooms were a bit dated and the beds were OK. The rest of the hotel was beautiful and the location was fantastic. Included in our room rate was transfers from the airport, as well as to the Port Of Miami the next day and breakfast in their restaurant. All of which was wonderful, convenient and well organized. The staff was wonderful also. Would definitely stay here again for the same purpose.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: tootoos22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for our one year wedding anniversary before flying out of miami international airport. Our room was beautiful and when we arrived they had champagne, a sampling of desserts, and fresh flowers for us! The style was very sheek and the bed was comfortable with a down comforter which gave it a European feel. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. We also dined at the hotel restaurant, La Riveria, and were pleasantly surprised with delicious french fare and at such a good price. It was also sleek yet romantic. We dined outside, the seating was comfortable and the waterfall from the pool made for nice background noise. The service at the restaurant was exceptional. Overall a very pleasant stay. My husband and I plan to stay here again when we travel throught MIA. Thanks Sofitel for a memorable anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: ttchin
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights before a cruise at the Sofitel. Clean, comfortable room and bed. Rooms are a bit small but fine for a short stay. Very nice view of the lagoon. Very pretty lobby and pool area. Nice to hang out in. Excellent service. Breakfast buffet on Sunday was very basic for $20.00. Good location 5 minutes from airport with shuttle running every half hour. Within walking distance (10 mins) of Walgreens pharmacy and small plaza with restaurants and Publix supermarket. There was a wedding the Saturday we were there just above the pool area. This did generate some noise but it was distant and did not disturb us on 8th floor. I would guess if you were lower down it would be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Therezinha E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sofitel for three days. The location is great. The staff was excellent all the time. They took care of some things of mine for three weeks and everything was very well maintained.The atmosphere is very pleasant and at the end of the day was very good to stay in the bar, computer room, and pool. They have a very good restaurant (they do not know how to make the ''magret de cannard''). Starbucks is always a good place for coffee. Definitivelly, we will stay at the Sofitel Blue Lagoon again if we're going to Miami

Reviews.Title: “BUSINESS HOTEL - CLOSE TO AIRPORT”
Reviews.Author: Euram
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel Miami, one night from 6 to 7 September 2011 as I was in transit in Miami. The hotel is very close to Airport and offers free shuttle service. Staff was very kind, starting with the driver of shuttle. My room was a Superior and it had a lot of space and all equipment that a guest may desire. I spent some time at swimming pool, which was very clean and had dinner. Restaurant is very good. I had to stay at Hotel after check-out deadline. Since I was not feeling good, staff extendend time of my stay til 5 pm without extra charge. I appreciated it very much. In general all staff was very friendly and I had a nice stay although the surrounding areas are not much interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Souvenirs”
Reviews.Author: Rudydentler
Reviews.Content: I Stay there in April 2011. I went to Miami to get married and the staff made this stay unforgettable. The employees are friendly and professional. Very reactive. Many french employees (ACCOR touch). The room with the view on the lagoon was so extraordinary. We'll never forget the wake up with this sunrise and this view. No mini bar in the room but the staff can bring you one very quickly. Crazy brakfast (different kinds) and good restaurant. The hotel is far from the city center but you can easily use the buses (organisation made in googlemaps). You have some fast food 5 minutes walking. The SOBED is such a good concept. And I miss my wake up BOSE.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value rooms, expensive (but good) cuisine”
Reviews.Author: chrizzler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights on our honeymoon. Champagne & chocolate covered strawberries was a lovely touch on arrival. The room was spotless and we were given our request of a higher floor after reading prior reviews of noise from their function room. This turned out to be a smart move after experiencing the noise that pounds out from here on a weekend, it didn't bother our sleep though. Plane noise could be heard in the room, but given the proximity and convenience of the airport, this was minor and afforded us a perfect view of the aeroplanes coming and going. The shuttle bus took about 5-10 minutes through heavy traffic, with free water and good air conditioning. Food here is expensive, but very good. We took a bus not far away into downtown Miami, which was very cheap and allowed us to see local restaurants close by. Overall, a definite recommendation to stay here, but choose your floor level accordingly if staying at a weekend. Thanks Sofitel, we'll be staying again if we hit Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bring earplugs, they supply them”
Reviews.Author: Bugman54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another couple Nov 18 & 19 2011 (a Friday & Saturday night). Entering the parking lot we were handed a parking stub and told to have the front desk validate it so we could come and go through the security gate. Upon check-in around 5 pm we were greeted at the door, directed to the front desk were every one was very kind and courteous. Our rooms were clean and exactly what we had expected, a view on the lakeside. We were on the 2nd floor and our friends on the 8th. Around 6:30 pm we decided to go out for dinner. When we returned around 9:30 and entered the room the sound was defining. We were right beside the ballroom and a â€œSweet 16â€� party was going on. We complained to the front desk and they moved us to a room on the 5th floor. Guess what â€“ it was just as loud in this room. Our friends on the 8th could actually watch the glass in their window vibrating the music was so loud. The response from the front desk was â€œthey paid for ballroom. We canâ€™t ask them to turn it down. They will be done by midnight. Would you like some earplugs? We will bring them to your roomâ€�. What kind of response is that EARPLUGS???. They showed up an hour later with them stating they ran out and had to go buy more. They obviously care more about the income from the ballroom than the guests. Saturday night â€“ same thing, different night.. On checkout I was asked how I liked my stay (no need to comment here) and would I like to put the parking charges on my credit card. â€œWhat parking charges. I was told to get my pass validated.â€� â€œYes sir, it is $9.00 a day. Would you like that on your credit cardâ€�? At this point I lost it and needless to say there were no parking charges. All in all it is a nice hotel but never never stay here on a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport. French flair. Excellent concierge service”
Reviews.Author: JohnM715
Reviews.Content: We held a business convention. Four days. Excellent consierge service. great food . Great fitness center. Compfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Good option close to MIA, but nothing around”
Reviews.Author: Martinzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed just overnight for an early morning departure. The lobby and the room were OK, however my corner room was getting some noise from the airport up to the point that some items on the desk were shaking when older planes were taking off. Also the wait for the shuttle to pick me up from the airport was a bit too long - 30 minutes after request. Other hotelÂ´s shuttles passed twice or even three times in that period. Yet the rate was good for the period given. So the place is OK for spending a night close to MIA, yet for an extended stay I would be probably looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff at check in. Comfortable hotel with spacious rooms, good location for MIA International Airport. Excellent shuttle service to and from airport. Nice outdoor area for dining and pool

Reviews.Title: “no respect for their customers”
Reviews.Author: cheryl t
Reviews.Content: stayed for 2 nights at the sofitel recently first night there was a sweet 16 party we were on the 8th floor and the noise was unacceptable couldnt move us no rooms offered us nothing 2nd night there was a wedding again noise was way too loud couldnt sleep and they offered nothing would not recommend this hotel they dont care about their guests and you pay good money to stay there

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel near the Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: Luzmarina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights on a recent business trip. The hotel and its grounds are beautiful. Parking at the hotel is gated and secure. The hotel is surrounded by commericial buildings and there is nothing to do near the hotel. The hotel provides a list of nearby restaurants that you can walk to but we drove instead. We ate Cuban food at Casa Juan. This restaurant is located in a shopping area where there is also a supermarket. The restaurant is like many other Latin food restaurants where the food is good and reasonably priced. However, we were very surprised to be charged $10 for a mojito in such a modest looking establishment. Our room was very nice and had a beautiful view of the Blue Lagoon. We could see the airport but could barely hear the noise from the planes. We had free WiFi. The toiletries were very nice and there was even a live plant in the bathroom (a nice touch and a first for us). The service was excellent and courteous. I received a prompt reply from the hotel manager when I had a question about my bill. Traffic in the area is heavy at all times and it is not easy to drive to South Beach and other areas of interest. I would recommend this hotel if you have business in the immediate area or if you are flying in and out of Miami and need to stay near the airport. I would not recommend this hotel as a base to visit the Miami attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers but with excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: AntDee
Reviews.Content: In America flights change, not by minutes like in Australia but hours and days, so it was with horror our flight was moved to 12 hours prior, we had booked the Sofitel Miami months ago and was not looking forward to arriving at 6am from a red eye flight and having to sit in the foyer till check in at 2pm. My husband was very ill when we arrived and although there policy was not before 2pm the staff were wonderfull they took me in a limo to get medicine, organised a room for us and made sure we were comfortable, from the doorman to the receptionist and housekeeping they contiunually checked on my husband condition and helped in every way, so I guess your now wondering about the Faulty Towers comment, well the staff were excellent you could not fault them at all, the rooms well, we had three as we were travelling with freinds, one room had no hot water, the other the T.V didn't work, and there were a couple of other gliches, they were all fixed by the staff, and it was more funny than dissapointing as each time there was a problem the staff came quickly happily and could have a joke with you even the ones that couldn't speak english very well. Not perfect on the surface, but brilliant with the hospitality, and after all travel is about the experience. Thank you Sofitel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: rumboogie
Reviews.Content: I love lodging at the Sofitel for a few reasons: the free shuttle and friendly drivers who always offer cool bottles of water; the hotel is minutes away from the airport which is totally convenient for me since my international flights depart early the following morning; the staff is always friendly, helpful and engaging; and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Whenever I visit Miami, this is always my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Mogreen33
Reviews.Content: We had read that the hotel courtesy bus runs every 30 minutes. After a long flight from UK we were grateful that we only waited 10 minutes.. All the staff we met from Bell Boy, Reception, bar and restaurant staff were all very pleasant. We had a suite with seperate living room and bedroom and a spotlessly clean bathroom. The restaurant dinner menu was very tempting but we were too tired to want to eat very much so purchased a snack from the small cafe in the foyer. The bed was the most comfortable bed. After a good night's sleep we had breakfast outside on the terrace over-looking the pool. The set breakfast ($15) was beautifully presented. There were plenty of other options if we wanted them. The courtesy bus left on the hour to return to the airport and we were soon on the next stage of our journey. Would have no hesitation in using Sofitel again next time we are in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not what i would expect from a Sofitel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MariannePG
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for just one night and i think it is ok, if you think about a hotel near the airport. The only thing is that i would expect more for a Sofitel stay....

Reviews.Title: “Marshmallow Beds”
Reviews.Author: MAGGIESWScotland
Reviews.Content: We recently went a cruise and stayed overnight in the Sofitel in Miami, after travelling for more than 24 hours we arrived at our hotel. We were met by the cruise representative who told us we looked tired, she said we would have a good nights sleep as the beds were like marshmallows. We went to our room which was very tastefully decorated with a Chaise lounge and a great big enormous bed. We have stayed in a lot of different places over the years and this has to be the most comfortable bed we have ever stayed in and the description of 'Marshmallow' sums it up, you felt as though you were melting into a giant marshmallow. The hotel was very tastefully decorated and had a lovely atmosphere about it. Just wish we were staying for longer.

Reviews.Title: “Too much expectations”
Reviews.Author: Guz V
Reviews.Content: Shuttle was late for 45 minutes, even though I asked them to send it a little earlier (it was almost 1 am). My room was big but the bed room didn't had air conditioning! Otherwise, it was just fine - for a 1 night stand - it looked very nice but as the flight was late I couldn't visit it - hope next time it will be better

Reviews.Title: “Visit with grandson”
Reviews.Author: peter_glazier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here again due to its location which is excellent. If you are in Miami you need to rent a car anyway so there is no reason for staying in expensive locations. You have to drive wherever you are. In the 10 nights we stayed here and back to my previous review on 4 occasions outside PIzza Parlor flyers were placed under our door. On one occasion the Â´Â´person`` even had the audacity to knock on the door. When we opened the door he had gone - presumably to deliver more flyers. One does not expect this in a chain such as Sofitel. I was surpised to be advised that the hotel does not have CCTV cameras on the floors. In other words the deliverer of the flyers could be there for other insalubrious activities.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service- felt like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: bay30
Reviews.Content: My son and I chose this hotel for our pre-cruise stay. We arrived to a beautifully maintained hotel with hard working staff. We were greeted and checked in quickly. The hotel offers transportation to the Port of Miami for $10.00 per person that is easily arranged at the concierge. The pool had beautiful lounge areas, a beautiful waterfront view from the pool area. The pool area had nice lounge areas and a waterfall going into the pool. The fitness room is the best fitness room I have seen in a hotel. Fully loaded with elipticals, treadmills, weights, weight benches, and a variety of weight training equipment. The fitness room was clean and well maintained. The restaurant is fantastic, the chef takes pride in the food and it shows. It is a bit pricey but honestly worth it. My son and I felt so spoiled at dinner, we couldn't wait to see what breakfast would be like. I fell in love with this hotel and would highly recommend staying here. My 7 year old son said he felt like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect oasis near Miami international airport”
Reviews.Author: compatible2u
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sofitel Miami late October because of attending a wedding in Coral Gables. One of the services provided by the hotel was the free shuttle bus pick up at the airport which runs every half hour! As we get picked up the pleasant driver offers cold water which he keeps in a refrigerator installed in the van. As we get into the lobby we are welcomed by smiling faces and Bonjour greetings. Raul the front office manager checks us in an Explains all the facilities that the hotel has. We are given the keys and off I go to find my room which was located on the 15th floor and has a beautiful view of a nice lake and the pool. The restaurant for breakfast an lunch is magnifique! I will definately return to Sofitel Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, rooms and views- close to Airport- Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I was in for one night, and needed to stay close to Miami Beach without paying the season prices for that exact location. Expedia offered this for about $150 inlcuding taxes and with the VIP status I was put in a great room, top floor (15) with a panoramic view of the city, lagoon and aiport (pictures included). Very nice hotel. Great Beds and Bathrooms! The staff are terrific, rooms are great. So it has my stamp of approval! Well done....

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: tsimJamaica
Reviews.Content: Nice, modern looking, however this is definitely an older property;the elevator is quite old and quite slow. good service. Free airport shuttle is available.

Reviews.Title: “Good option for near a quick stay”
Reviews.Author: mat_in_london
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel while transiting Miami on business. I was due to arrive late so picked an airport hotel for convenience. Staff were friendly, helpful and courteous throughout my stay. Free airport shuttle is a plus, although it's only every 30 mins so I ended up taxiing when I got in. Dinner and breakfast were both good, and not too expensive considering you're eating at a hotel. The beds were huge and comfortable, and the selection of TV channels was great. There are fast food options within about 1/2 mile (Wendy's, BK, McD's) along with a pharmacy and some other shops. No free WiFi but there are free computers by the bar (Internet speed was a little slow, but hey, it beats paying for it). All in all, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: BUNGLE67
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel prides itself on comfort and value, the miami Sofitel fits the bill.Great location and free airport shuttle bus are important. The only criticism I have is no breakfast. As Sofitles go it is reasonably priced but I do feel a breakfast would be a nice bonus, even a continental option. That said its a lovely hotel, nice pool, I hardly noticed how close to the airport the hotel is.I do recommend this hotel for the extra touches that Sofitel offer, the room and the hotel itself were spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Very good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinandreassen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to MIA. If you rent a car at the airport please note that the car rental companies are not located next to the hotel but approx. 15-20 min drive away! We parked our car at the entrance and immediately got help with our luggage and the car were even parked by the hotel staff. Parking area is gated and there is a daily fee of $9. The staff at the reception were friendly and the check-in went pretty quickly. We got a room at the 9th floor with a nice view of the runways at the airport. Despite this there were not much noice from the airport during our stay. The room was nice and clean. Our kids liked the hotel pool even though it was not warmed up. So all in all our stay was very good and we can really recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Overnight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Airlinekits Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was great - view of airport runway and lake. Bar and resturant service was the best I have had in Miami. Shuttle to the cruise port was well organised and clean. We will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Miami”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The 3rd time staying in the Miami Sofitel Hotel was not so great, However the previous times were a good pleasant experience. I will recommend this hotel because it is in a great location.. close to airport and restaurants,

Reviews.Title: “Disaster !”
Reviews.Author: Murielle P
Reviews.Content: A nightmare ! We arrived in the hotel at 8pm with our 2 daughters aged 5 and 7 after a 11-hour flight from Europe - completely jetlagged....to discover at 8.30pm when we were in our beds that we were in a room just in front of a marquee with a wedding party that went on until 3am!!!!! So loud !!! Will never ever stay there again, and ruled out Sofitel for ever!

Reviews.Title: “Nice for business near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Tomas_RV
Reviews.Content: Spent one night for business meetings close to the Blue Lagoon / Miami Airport area. However, is still close (20 min drive on traffic) to Miami beach. Rooms are large and well suited for work (Wifi is fast and reliable). Breakfast at the hotel is a recommendable experience (french press coffee, outstanding bakery, good service). Employees are friendly. However, please be aware: if you are looking for a tourist or downtown experience of Miami this is not the place to be. There's nothing to do outside the hotel in a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “"Continental" Florida”
Reviews.Author: archiebeck
Reviews.Content: close to airport: not too far from any of the good times in town: clean, cheerful, nice room, restful and pretty good food.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ppfiuza
Reviews.Content: I believe this hotel has a good cost-benefit ratio. I liked the location and the room...Just ok, but with a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarahyelverton
Reviews.Content: We flew in from Heathrow and stayed for one night before moving on to West Florida. The hotel is very comfortable and has a lovely atmosphere. Our room, a junior suite, was very clean and comfortable. We were not disturbed at all by any noise from the airport. We had food in the bar which was very nice. The pool is lovely. The breakfast was also very good but huge! We would stay again. The service was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good to relax after landing and close to mall ...”
Reviews.Author: eduardomiyake
Reviews.Content: Very close to the airport , good to relax after hours of fligth and very close to the Dolphin mall , besides easy to get Maimi Beach and neraby ...

Reviews.Title: “I remembered why I ALWAYS stay here!”
Reviews.Author: flacalinda
Reviews.Content: I first walked in to a room nice and roomy but a little dated, I was upset that I was next to elevator and service room, then the next day we left and came back to our spotless room, folded clothes, everyone goes above and beyond to make you happy and I remembered why I always come here... THREE THUMBS UP!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DudeintheSun
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Miami on business. Company office was out by the airport, and the Sofitel turned out to be a great, comfortable and convenient choice. Folks at the front desk were friendly and very accomodating. The room was a junior suite, which was not what I expected when I checked in. Bed was very nice, big and comfortable. I did not eat at the restaurants, but did eat at the bar both nights I was there (working late meant I wanted to keep it simple - drink and dinner). Bartenders were friendly and responsive. When I needed to get to the company office, the Concierge desk arranged for the hotel shuttle to drop me off and pick up that evening. Much more convenient and cheaper than a taxi would have been. Only real downside may have been the Internet connectivity. It worked, but wasn't the greatest. Overall, very comfortable, convenient and pleasant place to stay for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our three nights in this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doffa
Reviews.Content: We came to Miami for relaxation and shopping. Therefore the location of the Sofitel close to the airport and to several shopping malls was perfect. Service was outstanding. Smoking room was given and we were even up-graded to a suite. Coffee machine and fridge in the room. Breakfast was really great. Staff always authentically super friendly. We plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old building needs some major face lift.”
Reviews.Author: Owl201
Reviews.Content: We stayed this hotel due to a flight cancellation. The room is clean and modern style. However, the building seemed to be old and needs some face lift. Lobby area was not well lit and clogging. Overall this hotel was not "luxury" as the hotel claimed.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: sicilianprincess1
Reviews.Content: clean and comfy! Great breakfast. Friendly, helpful staff. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nick_VTRESORT
Reviews.Content: Free airport shuttle, late check-in, staff spot-on. The room was great, but the bed made quite some noise which could spoil certain activities ;-) we were too tired for. Breakfast was fancy and good, the pool however is small and lacks sunshine in the morning hours. If Miami is just a stopover, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “only stayed 1 night but great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcinradlett
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming staff. Large room with 2 double beds. Free water in room. Starbucks in the lobby. Very close to the airport. Free shuttle to the airport every 30 mins. $130 room only. Great place to stay for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms great service”
Reviews.Author: MzB17
Reviews.Content: The rooms where clean,and new! Only downside is that this hotel isn't close to anything,so must take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Guest of the day”
Reviews.Author: fcbluppie2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sofitel Miami for three nights as a start of a trip in Florida. On check-in I was the guest of the day; I got a free upgrade and they promised me every day a little present from the hotel. But wen I returned in my room after the first full day, nothing was there. And this happened every day. So the promise of the guest of the day was a empty one... The hotel itself is nicely located near the airport and 10 miles from south beach. The lobby with bar ois a perfectplace for a drink and the rooms and beds are good. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you need to stay close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel074
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is very close to Miami Intl and also offers free shuttle service. We flew into Miami and spent one night at this hotel before our flight to Antigua the next day. We contacted the hotel prior to retrieving our bags to ask the shuttle to pick us up. Once we had our bags we did have to wait for the shuttle but he got there and off we went to the hotel. The hotel is literally about 2 miles from the airport. Once we got to the hotel, it was very impressive and so were the staff. Everyone was very friendly and wanted to ensure we had an enjoyable stay. We had a room on a upper level floor that looked toward downtown Miami. The room was very nice and the bed was really comfortable. There isn't much right around the hotel (restaurants etc) but a taxi is easy enough to get. We liked that it had a bar and restaurant as well as a Starbucks right at the hotel. On our return from Antigua we stayed another night at this hotel. Since we came back in the International terminal and the shuttle picks up at the domestic terminal, we decided to get a cab instead of trying to figure out how to find the shuttle etc. Our flight back to Phoenix wasn't until 5:00 p.m. the next day so we decided we wanted to get some beers instead of paying hotel bar prices. We asked the concierge and instead of getting us a taxi, he took us to the grocery store. It was short walk back to the hotel, but we didn't mind. On our return trip, we had a similar room and again the bed is very comfortable. Again the staff was very friendly and helpful as we were trying to plan what to do before our flight home. The hotel was too far to take a cab to South Beach as it would have been around $40 + tip one way and we didn't have that much time. We decided to go to the outlet mall and shop! So much fun! We took a cab there and back and I think it was $40 total. The hotel stored our bags and since we knew the shuttle ran every 1/2 hour to the airport we could plan accordingly to get back in time to get our bags and get on the shuttle. Once we got back to the hotel, we grabbed our bags, they gave us a bottle of water and off to the airport we went. If we have to fly thru Miami again and need to spend the night, we will definitely stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but showing its age”
Reviews.Author: niner42
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after a cruise. This hotel was booked by our cruiseline so it wasn't by choice. The hotel had a nice foyer, staff was excellent, and a nice pool area. The hotel was probably quite nice in its day but it is starting to show its age. The rooms were nice and the location was great. Only a few minute walk to a small shopping area with a great Cuban restaurant, and a Publix. Would probably stay again if price was right...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and trendy”
Reviews.Author: Carolinasonggirl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the stay at this hotel. It was very nice. You have to pay to park. It it decorated nicely and is close to the airport. They have a nice business center with internet; This was a very great stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: businesstrav056
Reviews.Content: Service was nice but the hotel was older Holiday Inn at best. Should have known...it was only about $110 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Reliably consistent quality”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for business near the Miami airport. Reliably consistent high quality in cleanliness of rooms, operation of internet, and food service. Round-the-clock shuttle service to the airport is a plus. Very quick breakfast service gets you on the way in the morning on time. The bar is a relaxing setting after a long day's work.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport/Conference Hotel but not close to anything for a spouse”
Reviews.Author: Mindful_Travels
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple times. It is a great hotel, nice rooms, great service and even with conferences happening still quite. The only problem is the lack of things to do if you do not have a vehicle or if you enjoy walking places. The fitness area is well equipped. The pool is nice except for when any of the meetings have breaks as everyone comes down to the pool side to smoke or hang out and gawk at the individuals sun tanning. The restaurant serves a decent evening meal which is not overpriced for a Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: LukaszWarsawPoland Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for transit. Only five minutes from MIami Intl Airport - hotel's bus avaliable every 30 minutes - but calm and comfortable. Big rooms and excellent service in place - just Sofitel quality. Art Deco District accesible by taxi - 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a night”
Reviews.Author: ebbie1081
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night before leaving on a cruise. The shuttle barely stopped for us at the airport and we had to chase him down. When we got there, the hotel was booked so they upgraded our room to a junior suite for free! The staff were friendly, but the lobby was so noisy and crowded I had a hard time understanding them. The room itself was huge but nothing terribly special. The bedroom got really hot at night and wouldn't cool down. The pool area was very nice but the water was freezing. There's a little cafe to buy breakfast in the morning but bring your wallet, because it's pricey. Also, there's really no restaurants around, so we had to get Dominos delivered for dinner since we didn't have a car!! Overall, I can't complain because we got upgraded for free, but I would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: mountain51 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is advertized as a luxury hotel and they in fact charge it as a luxury hotel, but it is not a luxury hotel and service is not good at all. No comparison with the services you get at Marriot or Hilton. I do not recommend at all to stay in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Miami Hotel July 2011”
Reviews.Author: cruisebygroup
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers free airport pickup and drop off service from the Miami airport and that was my main reason for staying. They charge for taking you to the cruise ship port. The concierge service was very good (Boris and Frank) Nice drivers and front desk people. The hotel is within walking distance from a large grocery store and a really good Cuban resturant, Casa Juan. However this hotel is old. I was there for one night with my family on our way to a cruise. We had two rooms and both bathrooms were horrible! Dirty, filty bathtubs :( The lobby and guest area is very nice with a small snack area. You can buy drinks and snacks and sit. Overall not too bad for one night but I would not want to stay much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good service - will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: TJO422
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the conveneince to the airport & shuttle service.
