We stayed 2 nights total (1) when we flew in late, arriving around 11:15pm, and the last night of our vacation (we arrived at the hotel around 5:30pm to leave early the next day) Our 1st night; our room was a bit musty smelling but we were tired & it was late. We ordered roomservice; we were starving. The portions were HUGE & VERY GOOD. but a bit expensive. All the staff was wonderful! The 2nd night we stayed we had more time to enjoy the hotel. We had dinner at the restaurant (very good) and had drinks outside at the pool at sunset. Very pleasant experience the 2nd night & our room had a great view of the lagoon. We will stay here again anytime we fly into Miami.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Averbuch
Reviews.Content: I keep my opinion about Sofitel as one of the best options in Miami, if you consider location, sleep quality, acommodations, staff and the price for everything. But since my last visit some things changed. Parking for guest is charged now and they also charge for wireless internet, and charge it per device. If we think that even cheap motels provide good wireless internet for free, this situation in a hotel like Sofitel is ridiculous. I don't know if they provide cable internet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellinDan
Reviews.Content: Our flight from Miami to NYC was cancelled by AA due to thunderstorms in the area. They would not pay for a hotel. We flagged down a Sofitel courtesy van and the driver was nice enough to call the hotel and see if a room was available for us. They subsequently told us we got the last room. After the airport craziness and confusion to to the many cancelled flights, the van driver gave us some bottled water, which we were grateful for. As always, Sofitel does not disappoint. The staff is amazing, the rooms are very nice, and the dinner and breakfast we had were quite spectacular. We had dinner at the bar, which was a wonderful personal pizza with mushrooms and we had beer and wine with it. For breakfast, my wife had wonderful blueberry pancakes and I had cuban style eggs w/Chorizo and tomatoes and cheese. We were also given a coffee press for the table. In all, a fabulous breakfast. If you have a chance to stay at a Sofitel, I urge you to give them a try, you will not go back to a Marriott or similar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: uscmike1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel while working on a project in our Miami office. I was amazed by the beauty of the architecture, the great food in the restaurant, the plush and comfortable room, and many other features. The pool was nice, the workout room was good, the staff was extremely helpful. This was my first time staying in a Sofitel, and it greatly exceeded my expectations! This hotel is also very convenient to the airport. Enjoy your travels!

Reviews.Title: “WOW did they cater to us!!!”
Reviews.Author: kenhawk13
Reviews.Content: From the shuttle driver to the maid utmost help. Opened doors to carring bags this place rock. Bar was on the high end but the bar tender was a great (even if he was a Yakees Fan). Bed, Bar, Breakfest, and Bathroom all great. We will be back, and if we are in Europe we will look for this Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Crappy Unpleasant Depressing Dump”
Reviews.Author: Billyz11
Reviews.Content: Horrible hotel that requires an immediate multi million Dollar makeover. This place is not even close to Sofitel standards. Accor you should be deeply ashamed of this establishment it is an embarrasment. Nice touch for Gold Card Member....cheese and wine in the room. Receptionist very charming. Entrance, elevators, hallways and room absolutely dreadful. Drab, outdated suite more like a prison cell than a luxury hotel. Smelt musty and of tobacco. Motel 6 bathroom (sorry that's actually an insult to Motel 6) worn carpet, no a/c to bedroom, fittings at least 10 years old except for 2 new, small flat screen tvs. Charges for parking and internet. Smart mouthed service guy told me to turn the a/c to freezing in the living area and leave the door open in order to cool the bedroom. Nice view from 10th floor of airport and lake. Will never consider staying here again. Give this one a miss, you're far better off in a Courtyard or similar.

Reviews.Title: “A few rough edges, but an excellent and professional staff”
Reviews.Author: ecoaggie
Reviews.Content: Like many others we needed to arrange "bookend" nights in Miami for connections on each end of our international vacation. We chose the Sofitel for the front end and the Sheraton for the back. Both were similarly priced (although the Sofitel was $30 cheaper), close to the airport and have a free shuttle. The Sofitel won the comparison hands-down. Although it shows its age in some areas, the lobby, restaurant & bar areas, and rooms were generally much nicer at the Sofitel. The main difference was the exceptional customer service we received at the Sofitel compared to the Sheraton. The shuttle drivers were fast and friendly both directions, the check-in was quick and easy, the concierge was enthusiastically helpful, and the bartender was very personable. All of this is in complete contrast to our experience at the Sheraton. We'd definitely stay here again if we are passing through Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: magpie_rover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights pre cruise and had no problems. The room we had was spacious and comfortable, the public areas are stylish and we found the staff helpful and pleasant. There is a nice pool area to relax and the bar area is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business around airport area”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good position for me - have two customers in area nearby. Nice pool, good rooms, good in-room dining, fares are correct and personnel friendly. I was curious to try Hilton nearby but then decided to head back to Sofitel for the 3rd time around. Why not? I like everything and the vale for money is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Most expensive glass of wine I've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: lucydodd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the way back from Costa Rica. We had booked a one bedroom suite online and the price seemed OK. The shuttle from the airport was convenient to get there. Our flight arrived in the late afternoon, so we thought we'd get checked in and enjoy a couple of drinks then a leisurely dinner. The room was OK- not quite as nice as we expected, but, it's an airport hotel, so there you are. We went down to the bar and I ordered a glass of house wine. The bartender was very friendly, and we paid the bill as we wanted to take our drinks out by the pool and watch the sunset. The glass of house wine was $16! With no alternative in sight, we stayed put, stuck to the plan and had dinner as well. The food was pricey as you would expect with drink prices like that, but it was good. At the end of the evening, we realized that we had spent more on the drinks and the meal than we had for two days worth of eating and drinking in Costa Rica. The most negative part of the visit to this hotel was that when we got up to catch the first shuttle in the morning to the airport so we could make our flight home, the shuttle driver didn't appear until almost 20 minutes after the shuttle was supposed to leave. By the time he warmed up the vehicle, etc. it was almost 1/2 an hour late. There were a lot of unhappy people standing around waiting, by the time we left the hotel property. Overall, not sure that I would rush back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay if you are flying out of miami airport”
Reviews.Author: donita28
Reviews.Content: we had an early flight the next morning so choose sofitel rather than staying at the airport hotel. only five minutes away. french restaurant is fantastic and open late. shuttle takes you right to terminal for free.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our stop before and after trip”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Stella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Miami for one night before leaving for our Caribbean trip and for one night before returning home and we found this to be the best choice of all Miami Airport Hotels. See Diego at the front desk to be greeted and serviced with a smile that was contagious! Very friendly staff, Fidel at the consigner desk was also more than helpful with restaurant recommendations! The lobby and pool as well as in hotel restaurants were very nice and impressive however the rooms were - more 4 star. Comfortable yes, the amenities were great, however stains on carpets, rooms smelled of smoke from days where that was allowed, and needs an overall paint job. This wouldn't stop me from staying here again as I would in a heart beat! Good value for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Best deal for an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Doberri
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Sofitel Miami was great for several reasons: - Staff is friendly and really dedicated to the quality of the service - no rudeness detected. - Premises are good though "dated" - Food is great, cocktails are good - Free fitness club with quite a large array of machines - The hotel is not under an airline - The view is nice - once again for an airport hotel... (lagoon view) - Last but not least: price of rooms is decent and rooms are quite big. - If you have a car the hotel is at 15min from the beach and everything. Stay there for business trips or if you need to be in a "remote" area - far from the Miami Beach party.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vikkij1980
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel, especially with the rate we received through continental.com. Definitely a good 4 star hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the service was amazing. everyone was nice and helpful and always around when needed. check in was good. almost missed the bus to the boat port though because no one told us it arrived. check in and out was speedy. the chocolate croissant was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: Expedia-Customer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just perfect. The staff was awesome as well. I highly recommend to anybody visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent combination of French atmosphere and American practice environment”
Reviews.Author: aparisiCPQ
Reviews.Content: I use to stay at Sofitel everywhere is possible. I lost count of how many times I stayed at Sofitel Miami, since 1994 and every time I go there, I got a surprise about improvement of service quality. This time, beyond the good service, they surprised me with a â€œwelcome backâ€� amenity and sent me a tray with French cheese, grapes, and cracks and bottled mineral water. Since I made a lot of on line shopping to be delivered at hotel, upon my arrival all my stuffs were delivered to my room properly labeled. I do recommend this hotel and even if they are 20 minutes far South Miami Beach I donâ€™t care to drive down there for a dinner or shopping. It worth!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: hairylaury
Reviews.Content: We mainly booked this hotel as we were due to fly out from MIA in the morning and it's only a 5-10 min free shuttle bus away. South Beach is approximately 20-25 min by car. The room was spacious and clean with a good outlook in the direction of the airport. The hotel gym was also practical and modern. We did dine out at the restaurant and the food was ok but the staff were attentive.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Terribly disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: germanv78
Reviews.Content: When you think Sofitel images of luxury and that European feeling shakes you, but Sofitel Miami is just the worse hotel I've ever stayed at. First - we decided to take the shuttle right after landing from our 8hr flight, thought it was going to be better to get some sleep before calling Enterprise to rent a car. Shuttle was full, had to wait an extra 30mins. When we get there people at the front desk were extremely nice and helpful. No complaints about staff. Check in was just a matter of mins, very happy with that. Although when we walked into the room we were hoping to see a really nice, remodeled room. Negative, rooms are old, outdated, bathroom literally had hairs everywhere, toilet wouldn't flush properly. The bed was amazing though, very comfortable. La Riviera is awfully expensive for the food they serve. Went down to a Denny's, my wife and I ate two plates filled to the top for $15 , what one meal not even half of a plate costs. There's no free internet, they have only 4 computers which are old and 2 aren't even connected to printer. Parking is charged $9.00+ tax per NIGHT. Stayed at Holiday Inn at Orlando few days before and it was free being a regular hotel. And what the hell is up with those hats staff wear at parking gate? That doesn't give it any "french feel" whatsoever. Wife couldn't stop laughing at that, beyond ridiculous. Short drive to airport, close to convenience stores, ate some yummy cuban food at a restaurant called Poyo Tropical, would definitely recommend it. Really cheap and close by for those late night munchies. Overall for the total $$ we spent it wasn't what we expected. Don't let the pictures online fool you. Don't understand why such a big hotel, with so many people staying (day the we checked in there was a couple in front of us trying to get a room and they were full, old lady told us it was like that most of the times) hasn't been updated. Needs a lot of things, has the potential to be a 5 star hotel but if they don't want to spend money on fixing it, their loss. Staying at Sunny Isles hotel next time. Same price, beach view, same size rooms and way cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: canadabound
Reviews.Content: the hotel had been booked by the cruiseline after a transatlantic flight and the day before the cruise so we weren't expecting much. However we were pleasantly surprised-our reaction was-this is an airport hotel? Rooms were large with king size bed and chaise long.Corner room so 2 window views one of which faced the runway but weren't disturbed by any noise By the time we arrived 6pm local time it was 1am according to our jetlagged bodies but we were too wired up to sleep We therefore went down to the pool for a few cold beers in the warm Florida evening-very pleasant pool area but should have put on insect repellent-that mosquito with my name on it got me! Beds were really comfortable it certainly wasn't due to that ww woke up 6am and couldnt get back to sleep Breakfast wasn't included and the fare on offer was pretty pricey so we had a danich and coffee in the atrium coffee shop before being picked up by the shuttle to take us to the cruise terminal would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel Miami is Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: welive4holidays
Reviews.Content: Loved every bit of our stay at this wonderful Hotel. Stayed here between cruises and had a wonderful time. Travelled from Australia and when we return to the states we intend to stay at the Sofitel. Loved the food and service, room cleanliness, pool area, conceirge, and free internet access. Staff are wonderful. Cannot praise this hotel more highly. Bed was amazing...best sleep we have had in our lives. Fantastic location and easy access to cruise port, bus station, beach etc Thankyou Sofitel Miami :)

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel? Choose another hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KIMT_IV
Reviews.Content: WI-FI, Parking (US$9+tax per night) - not free. Both are free in the 2.5 star hotel we stayed at in Orlando before moving to Sofitel Miami. Defective toilet, water was running endlessly. Staff had to pay the room a second visit to fix the problem. While the pool looks inviting, it is for swimming and not for staring. But that is the only option since it is unheated. Again this is not a concern in the 2.5 star hotel. I believe that before we could talk about luxury the basics should be covered first. Upon checking our account we discovered an erroneous entry/charge from Sofitel. We had to get in touch with our bank regarding this. Wrote to Sofitel because of the incorrect amount charged to our MasterCard. We were over charged by around US$200. Did not get a courtesy of a reply from the hotel but the amount was adjusted the next day or so. One thing though, the beds are very comfortable. 'Soft as clouds' as the hotel puts it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mahlerfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night, needing a hotel close to Miami Airport. The hotel offers a free shuttle to and from the airport every half hour. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy outdated hotel...”
Reviews.Author: sian421
Reviews.Content: I am not quite sure why other reviewers are giving good scores to this hotel. It is completely outdated and dingy. The carpet is disgusting and smells moldy, the beds are hard as a rock, there are "unknown" stains on the chaise lounge in my room, and the bathtub looks dirty and gross. It also sounds like the airplanes are going to land in your room. It also borders a not-so-nice area of Miami. I am highly disappointed and if my work meeting were not being held here, I would have left.

Reviews.Title: “Post flight recovery”
Reviews.Author: JohnBCambridge Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Miami is a very short distance from the airport- many rooms have runway views- but is well isolated from any noise.The hotel shuttle bus leaves from the departure level every 20 mins and is very quick. The hotel is not attractive from the outside, but is a haven inside, with a very efficient reception, comfortable lounges on different levels, a very well maintained pool area, and a europian style restaurant. The rooms are large , a little old fashioned, but well equipped. A lot of the staff are French(hotel is part of Accor Group), & speaking French is an advantage. All in all a quality hotel , very restful, and ideal before hitting the Florida hectic life.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: keitha57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel as we needed a hotel close to Miami airport for the first night of our holiday. Friendly check-in and efficient bellboy service. Pool nice for a quick swim after a 10 hour flight. Room service quick and food quality good. Room was a good size and quiet despite proximity to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “As good as Always”
Reviews.Author: danielcarvalhoBR
Reviews.Content: Flights from South America, arrive at Miami very early in the morning. Hotel is very close from the airport, it means very often, i get at hotel lobby about 6AM. Thats not a problem at this hotel. IÂ´ve stayed there more than 30 times, and just for a couple of times, i had to wait for the regular check in time. Staff are very gentle. All rooms have been recently renewed. To be better need minibar and a better shower.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience!”
Reviews.Author: TJ_putuje
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, the person behind the reception desk was extremely rude. The room was fine, but very average. The Starbucks in the lobby was extremely expensive, even by tourist hotel standards (yogurt parfait = $8.95!). Then a few days later when checking my bank account I can see that I was charged an inexplicable extra $80 to my card. I tried to call the hotel directly to inquire, and keep getting routed to a phone tree for reservations only. I would avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: peter_glazier
Reviews.Content: As Sofitels go this is far from their average European properties. I stay here regularly but this time their security slipped up and I even received a menu from an outside pizza parlour under my door. When accepting groups one has to expect the worst in terms of quality of service.

Reviews.Title: “Warmest Welcome Back”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a memorable 3-night stay here last year, so when our travel plans recently included an overnight stopover at the Miami Airport, we naturally chose the Sofitel even though this time it was only for what we call an "airport flop" - in late and out early. Much to our delight and surprise, the Sofitel highly personalized our return stay and made us feel like visiting royalty. Our vacation got off to a grand start with our night here. We departed well-rested after rising from the sumptuously comfortable bed. The staff are exceptionally warm and genuine. We are very glad that we had occasion to stay here again and hope to many times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Pre-post Cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: BuzzyBee_9
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much at the Sofitel. We booked through NCL and all arrangements were taken care of. Airport pick-up - this was the worst part and almost gave our holiday a bad start. We were unfamiliar with the Miami airport and the information provided for hotel shuttles was limited at best. There was no designated pick-up location for shuttles (even though the airport led you to believe there was) basically keep a look out for the white van that says Sofitel on the front. Check-in - this is a busy hotel lobby but check-in went smoothly. We had to wait for our room on the post cruise as we got to the hotel so early. Check-out was equally smooth, again lobby was always busy. Room was very nice and comfortable; we stayed on the 9th floor for the pre cruise and the 8th for the post cruise stay. Nothing to complain about. Restaurant - We expected pricey as we saw the menu on-line, but the food and service was well worth it. For a local taste on the post cruise stay we walked down the road to a strip mall and went to a Cuban restaurant. OMG the amount of food they gave you was huge and very tasty. Since we didn't have a fridge we couldn't bring any left overs. We will share next time. We also enjoyed the outside pool area for reading, relaxing and a couple of drinks. We will stay again when in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, unpretentious service”
Reviews.Author: ppierre84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few days ago during a very long layover in Miami. There is a hotel in Miami International Aiprot but I decided against staying there since the reviews were so poor. This hotel is about a 5 to 10 minute ride from the airport (there's a shuttle that picks up at the airport every 30 minutes so it's very accessible). From the moment I checked in the front desk agent was prompt and friendly. She made sure I knew about all the amenities. It's very much "service with a smile" here. I had breakfast in the dining room and the young french gentleman who waited on me was very professional, prompt, and extremely friendly as well. The room was very nice,clean, and the bed was oh so comfy. I ordered room service when I woke up from my nap and again I was very impressed with the service. My tray was picked up promptly after I was done and when the dining manager saw that I hadn't finished my cheesecake she called to ask if it was ok and if I had any feedback or if I would like a replacement dessert. I didn't use the pool but it looked very elegant and nice. The gentleman (Horatio) who drove the shuttle back to the airport was very friendly and even recommended some great hotels for my next trip to Punta Cana (that's where I was coming from before my layover in Miami) I would recommend anyone stay here if you are visiting Miami. I definitely will be back the next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect. Except for the lack of a minibar in the room. That would be great! It was the only thing I missed. The breakfeast was delicious and the room service was perfect. All the employees were very helpful and polite. I will certainly recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good for people with a car”
Reviews.Author: Bman84 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next to the airport. We used the hotel as a base to go to the beach from. The hotels on the beach were way too expensive and we had rented a nice car so we decided to go for a good hotel away from the beach, for less, and then just take the car to the beach. Glad we decided to do this. Because of this decision we weren't at the hotel that much, so all I can rate is the sleeping experience. The bed was awesome, as usual at Sofitels. The bathroom was standard, nothing special. Room was spacious, and had a nice view of the lagoon and the airport. The pool looked very refreshing and not too busy, but didn't make use of it. If I were travelling out of Miami through this would have been my pick for sure. Only complaint was that the wake up call was 1 hour late. We went over to DST on the first night we stayed, and the night after that I used the automated wake-up call service, and it was still on the old time. That was very unprofessional, and there wasn't even a sorry at the desk when I complained. Only a "Yeah, we're working on that". Unsatisfactory if you ask me. But besides this small mishap, no probs at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bev046
Reviews.Content: We regularly need to stay overnight near Miami Airport and have tried a few places. This hotel stands out for its very nice rooms, good bar and restaurant (if expensive), and outstanding staff. It's also very near the airport; the shuttle takes around 7 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel; convenient location”
Reviews.Author: asg845
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel in October of 2010. It wasn't a bad first impression; all the employees were very nice and it seemed to be a nice relaxing hotel. We got to our room and it seemed pretty clean until I took a look into the bathroom and noticed strands of hair stuck to the bathroom door, walls and toilet. It did seem that the bathroom did need a little work; the sink faucet wasn't straight and you could see where they tried to re-attach the shower faucet as well. The walls are pretty thin, we could hear the television in the next room and we could hear every time someone left their room and banged their door closed. Another thing I noticed was the gum stuck between the painting and the wall above the bed; but I guess housekeeping wouldn't think to look there when cleaning. We didn't have a room with a lagoon view but that was fine, we were in Miami to go out not to spend all our time in our room. We did hear the airplanes as the were taking off or landing at the airport. The restaurant was a little expensive but the food was good. There's no refrigerator in the room, but you can request one for no charge; but I don't know how many the hotel has available to spare. Checking out was interesting, there was only one elevator working and almost everyone was trying to make check out time at the same time. We were on a higher floor so we were not going to walk down stairs with our luggage. It was ridiculous how they tried to squeeze so much luggage and people into the elevator; it was very claustrophobic. But when we finally made it down to the lobby it was an easy and fast check out; no problems. PROS: Location to Airport for short business trips and one night stay before/after a cruise. CONS: Dated bathrooms, elevator service, restaurant prices, and hair all over bathroom walls and doors (they were literally stuck onto the wall). Had to pay to park in their parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again...not sure about the restaurant...”
Reviews.Author: lynnanne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel one night - returning from a cruise in Miami. The hotel lobby, pool, bar and rooms are clean and nicely decorated. The service was great. The service desk and bellhop were helpful and friendly. We did not have any issue with the hotel shuttle to the airport. They were helpful, courteous and on time. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms were spacious - a noticable and welcome, since we had spent that last 7 days in a cruise cabin. We used the hotel computers, near the bar to check-in for our flight out of Miami - the computers were well maintained and there was a working printer - very helpful. We did not eat supper at the restaurant - LA RIVIERA however we did have breakfast there. Ordered the Egg Tortilla Dish - expecting a huevos rancheros type of dish. Unfortuntaly it was not very good. One dish could feed a family of 4 - I did not enjoy it. It was bland, watery with way too much scrambled eggs. Plus, it was over $15.00. If I did go back, I would stick to the American breakfast. Or pay the $15.00 cab right to go somewhere else - almost $40.00 for a breakfast for two people (that was not even enjoyable) is a little over the top.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel unusual Location”
Reviews.Author: Bertie525 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for rest after a long flight due to it's location close to the airport. Booking in was quick and efficient, room was large, clean and well appointed. Located in a business area it is some distance from resturants if the one on site or the coffee shop are closed or not suitable so having your own transport is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stopover hotel,perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: LondonUna
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Sofitel pre cruise and again back to the hotel for the day post cruise. Very quick and efficient check in, even though it was busy. We arrived about 8.00 p.m. but the conserige was very helpful and rebooked a restaurant for us that we were late for. Rooms were great. A very good size and the beds were fabulous. Bathroom was good with a very powerful shower. Bathroom freebies were excellent quality. The pool area is lovely but the pool is on the cold side. We had a nice breakfast in a very pleasant setting. I would definately stay at this hotel again as a stopover, due to its location to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: Parakeet701
Reviews.Content: I came here for a work-related conference which was held at the same location. The room was very clean and the bed extremely comfortable. I could have slept for hours on it!! My co-worked forgot some items and the front desk promptly brought up the missing items, staff was very friendly. Great location for the airport (right across the street, you can watch the planes land from your room!) and it's also a short drive to South Beach etc. You can occasionally hear the airplanes taking off but this was only during the day so not a problem for sleeping. They also did very well with the conference I attended. Everything went smoothly and all the food/service they provided was very good. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel with all amenities”
Reviews.Author: hotelsulike
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night here prior to our cruise. Good attractive hotel, nothing to complain about. Free shuttle bus from airport, takes about 10 minutes. Very quick check in and out. Large comfortable room with very comfy bed. Drinks and food were pricey ($10 cheapest glass of wine). Good breakfast in attractive, airy dining room, attentive staff. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “a little isolated, but handy to airport”
Reviews.Author: sydneydweller
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for an early morning departure or late night arrival. A shuttle takes you to the airport. The rooms and staff are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elizvictoria
Reviews.Content: Stayed with extended family (5 rooms) before embarking on cruise in January 2011. Hotel suggested by cruise consultant, who provided transport to cruise dock. All rooms as requested, and they allowed us to park our car while we were on the cruise. I thought the restaurant was a little pricy, but food was good. Close to airport, so noise from jets occassionally, but that was expected. Nice grounds, well kept. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: bwbooz
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. Stayed at Sofitels before - what a pleasure. This was not. Room stuffy and stinky - we were told too early in the season for air conditioning, so we just had to accept stuffiness and no sleep. Breakfast we PAID FOR at La Rivera was a joke, in terms of service. Slow, food cold, server lazy, coffee with grounds in it, no condiments, not offered what others around us were. Common areas had stained furniture. Common computers not working. On the positive side - bartender great! His service and attentiveness helped so much after so much CRAP. One concierge also very nice. We won't return, and we would never recommend to anyone else. For a luxury hotel - for any hotel - they should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “One night prior to our cruise”
Reviews.Author: dcullivanio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 2009 prior to embarkation for a cruise, leaving Miami the following morning. The room was very comfortable and clean, as was the rest of the hotel. We went out for the evening to eat ,after having a couple of drinks in the hotel bar which was also nice. The concierge at the reception was very knowledgable and happy to help us find a suitable place to dine out at. On returning we had a great undisturbed sleep, although this might have had something to do with how long we had been awake! On returning from the Cruise a week later we returned to the Sofitel for a day room stay before our flight back to the UK. We lunched at the hotel restaurant which was very enjoyable and would recommend it. I am not entirely sure how good a location this hotel was, as we arrived and left via transfer and did not have a point of reference for the rest of the Miami area. Overall an enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: missedme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise. It was a nice clean hotel with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Between Flights”
Reviews.Author: amoffat
Reviews.Content: Great nights sleep. Very comfortable bed. Clean room and bathroom - BUT- the decor finish needs to be looked at. If thats not a concern - no problem. We enjoyed 2 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to airport”
Reviews.Author: deniselagrange5
Reviews.Content: As my late night flight home was cancelled after an interational flight, I stayed at the Sofitel to catch the first one home the next morning. The courtesy van driver was quite helpful and friendly and I appreciated the bottle of cold water on the drive to the hotel. Again, the front staff was also friendly. I was somewhat disappointed in the rooms, not from the size or appearance but from the bed. As I was staying in a double, each bed had two small pillows stacked up on top of each other. Even with 4 available pillows, my sleep was not good. As other reviewers have mentioned, the time to change the mattresses is probably iminent. The location is good for an overnight when flying in or out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: viniciusdanieli
Reviews.Content: The rooms and the restaurant perfects. The fitness room great! Vinicius from Brazil.

Reviews.Title: “Good value base to explore southern florida”
Reviews.Author: geosu
Reviews.Content: We stayed from boxing day til new year for a pre-cruise holiday, and booked the sofitel because of the great price we saw online and thought it a good location to use as a base to explore southern Florida. We were given room 1506, a large sized room overlooking the airport and lakes to the front of the hotel. Excellent size bed which was also very comfortable. Large t.v with plenty of channels to choose from, and the bathroom was very modern with a good shower. The room was on the top floor so consequently we has an amazing view of all the hundreds of different firework displays in Miami and Fort Lauderdale. Reception staff were very helpful but have this French vibe going on which I didn't quite understand. The reception is nicely decorated, but the elevators are ancient, and it was sometimes frustrating having to wait up to 10 minutes for one to come. The bar was overpriced so we only used it twice, the same food served in the bar is available on room service which we has a couple of times. Food again was expensive but very good. The pool area to the rear was really nicely kept and is a real sun trap. The hotel is very near to the airport (quite interesting to watch the planes take off and land) but we didn't really notice any noise. There is a supermarket and a laundry nearby as well as some fast food places. If you hire a car it's very easy to get to the main roads from the hotel. The hotel does a free shuttle to and from the airport ( flag the sofitel bus down outside the Entrance to 'Departures'), and also a pay shuttle to Dolphin Mall and Miami Port. Don't understand why the parking is so expensive. Don't know the wifi is so expensive either. We preferred the Intercontinental where we've stayed before but that was overpriced this time, but I didn't mind the area and would consider the Sofitel again if we got the same good rate. Now if someone could explain the French thing to me...........

Reviews.Title: “Not a real Sofitel -- more like a Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: JacobJohnson
Reviews.Content: If you are used to other properties under the name Sofitel, you will be surprised by this place. It is not in the same league: it's more along the lines of a Holiday Inn Express or a freeway motor hotel. First, the room (a mini-suite with a living room and separate bedroom). The decoration is very stark and not at all "nice" or "elegant" (I usually don't even pay attention to these things, but this room stood out). The room we were given had a picture on the floor that had fallen off, which immediately demonstrated that we were in a low-caliber establishment). For a suite, this room was very small. Second, the bathtub filler didn't work and kept bouncing back to shower mode (we wanted a bath for our child, not a shower). Third, the phones didn't really work correctly in that after 15 minutes of calling room service and getting a busy signal, I finally called the front desk to ask what was wrong, and they simply connected me right away. I guess they do this to slow down people's use of room service? No idea. It was super-annoying. Next, when I did order room service, the food finally came after about 30 minutes and part of my order was wrong. I called room service (again, using the front desk as a switchboard, not the little button on the phone) and explained. 30 later minutes and I had the last entree. It was luke-warm. The food was "decent" but not great. The prices were typically high for a high-end hotel which this is not. The location is close to the airport, although still a 15 minute jaunt around it. The noise from the airport is bad as the property is not far enough away from the runway yet is not "super-insulated" like some hotels right on the tarmac. It's the worst of both worlds--you hear low rumbling all night long. If you don't pay very much (viz. get some kind of discount) and don't expect anything fancy, this hotel might work for you, but it's certainly not a Sofitel like others I've visited. I won't be taking any chances with any of the others anymore either.

Reviews.Title: “wow - that was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cindystuff
Reviews.Content: Wow - that was disappointing. I really thought that the Sofitel was supposed to be a high-end hotel. We stayed one night between flights, and were disappointed. It is a lovely hotel when you enter and gives the appearance of a nice place. The restaurant was a quite a bit overpriced for the food served. Truly, we do not mind paying this much when the food is excellent. But it was just good....hmmmm. Our room was pretty average to what you would find in a business hotel. The one robe which was there for two of us was unwearable, as it was so stiff and prickly. The bath was in need of help, as it was quite worn. The hallway carpet was worn, too. The saddest thing of all was that the mattress had a huge dent in one side. I finally changed places with my hubby, as I could fit into the 'hole' there and he could not. Neither of us slept much. Yes, we should have asked for another room. I don't know if it would have helped, though. I think we will just avoid staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant and convenient”
Reviews.Author: alwaysgreen Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a quick trip from the airport for an overnight layover. The hotel was pleasant and the tasting menu in the restaurant surprisingly good. Overall it was an excellent way to recover between flights.

Reviews.Title: “SoBed are great, good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for Christmas as travelling from Europe with my wife. Had Suite 1006 as pre-booked and pre-paid. Room was nice and large with plenty of space. Nice lagoon view and airplanes view too (if you're a fan). Sometimes noisy from airport traffic but was ok. Arrived late at night after long flight and it was easy to reach from the airport with our rental car. SoBed are great and was very nice to have a deep sleep. Bathroom was good but not a real Sofitel standard as seen in different Sofitel hotels around the world. 2 Flat Tv's in the room and loung aera. Had room service which was nice (breakfast and dinner). Service in hotel was good too. Only 2 downsides of this property was the expensive parking fee and no free Wifi in our Suite. If needed, we might go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luisa13
Reviews.Content: Once again, we visit this hotel because of the easy access to Miami International Airport. Nothing has change in this hotel, for me is still one of the best in the area, from bell boys to room service is one class hotel, however the lack of cleanliness in the bathroom turn me down. I know that this little things happen sometimes and I will be very unfair if this makes me write a bad review, I know the next time I visit Sofitel things will be like as usual Tip Top.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel but BEWARE ROOM LOCATION or you wonÂ´t sleep”
Reviews.Author: flacalinda
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel for the price, extremely nice, clean and great staff. I was there at a busy time and still felt like and important guest. The one BIG WARNING is beware what room you are assigned!!! I was staying at a suite, and it was located right next to the ice machine and service elevator.. I never heard street noise, or other guests, but I heard EVERY time the service door creaked open, creaked closed and then slammed shut, also EVERY time someone got Ice we were all woken up! We could here service personnel speaking loudly and sometimes yelling for things, when they got beds out, EVERYTHING! and we heard everything from the upper floor ice machine and service area as well! IT WAS A HORRIBLE NIGHT SLEEP EVERY NIGHT... They kept waking up my babies, it was a hot mess! But IÂ´m sure this would not have been the case had my room been FAR from this area, so just make sure you request the furthest room available from the elevator/service area/ice machines!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: jedilori
Reviews.Content: We Received vouchers from American Airlines for 2 rooms due to a delayed flight. We were told that this was a really nice place. They lied! This was the nastiest hotel I've ever been in. All of the lobby and the room furniture was old, worn, soiled, faded, ripped in some places, and even had crumbs in them. The windows looked like they had never been washed, the elevator buttons were faded and cracked, and the tables in the lobby were flat out dirty. Plus, both of the rooms had such a strong chemical smell that I couldn't stay in there; I had to go to the lobby just to breathe! If this is considered a 'nicer' hotel in Miami, I'd hate to see one that's worse than this.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room View”
Reviews.Author: RUReadytoTravel
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel on our way home from a cruise. I prepaid for this room months ago and got a very good price. However, upon our arrival, we were given a room on the second floor that had a totally obstructed view of the lagoon. There was a huge, white colored enclosed tent/canopy extending the entire length of this side of the building. So, all we got to see when we pulled the drapes open was this monstrosity. No view whatsoever. So, naturally we didn't want to look at this tent/canopy, so we never had the drapes open. I also requested a smoking room, so I guess this room is where we evil smokers get relegated to - to the second floor room with no view. (I have stayed in other hotels that allow smoking and have NEVER been put in such a room as this one.) Additionally, the interior of this room was anything but luxurious and the carpet needed replacing a long time ago. I also noted there was not a top sheet on either bed. Bottom line - I am not sure if I got this room because I reserved it at a prepaid, special internet rate or because I am a smoker. But either way, the room was sub-par. If it was because of the special internet rate, then when I called the hotel they should have told me the room would be substandard due to the rate I paid. If I was given this room because I am a smoker, then if the hotel does not want smokers as guests then they should not offer rooms to smokers. To give an inferior room to a guest for possibly either one of these reasons is wrong because my money is as good as any other guest who stays there. And if it wasn't for either of these reasons, then this hotel needs to stop touting itself as a "luxury" property in Miami as I experienced firsthand anything but "luxury." I also inquired about the business center as I needed to print out my airline tickets. I was told there was a computer and printer I could use for this task. However, when I went print out my tickets, there was no printer connected to the network. although there was a printer in the business center. I had to have the concierge go onto his computer to do this for me. I will not stay here again when I am in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: idaho48
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel is very close to Miami airport, offers a free shuttle which we only had to wait a few minutes for. Rooms were clean and roomy and beds were comfy, but no top sheet which I don't care for,,,just a duvet. Ordered room service the night before for breakfast and it was delivered right on time. We ate dinner in the bar and it was good food. No coffee pot in the room, but they brought one on request, altho they do have a Starbucks in the lobby. Very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service”
Reviews.Author: ngaminova
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to a cruise and were very pleased with the high caliber of service that each staff member provided. The concierge was incredibly helpful in giving instructions regarding the complimentary airport shuttle, arranging for cabs to dinner and the Port of Miami, and answering a number of other questions. We were very happy with the lobby bar (great drinks and friendly staff) and the coffee shop which serves Starbucks and has a great selection of sandwiches and rolls for a quick breakfast on the go. The complimentary airport shuttle runs every thirty minutes which means that there isnâ€™t much of a wait time for pick up at the airport. Sofitel also offers a shuttle to the Port of Miami for $10 per person (a cab runs a total of $30 with tip), but this shuttle only leaves the hotel at 11:00 a.m., 3:00 p.m., and 7:00 p.m.; much too late for a cruise that starts boarding at noon and departs at 4:00 p.m. Overall we are very pleased with the Sofitel and will definitely consider staying at this hotel, as well other Sofitel properties worldwide, again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay in many hotels and it is very difficult to get a goodnightâ€™s sleep because most beds are so uncomfortable, but here i feel a sleep like an Angle. I really cannot fault the hotel, staff, and amenities great.

Reviews.Title: “very nice except few thins”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The quality of service and cleanliness are good. But I can't understand that there wasn't refrigerator in the room. In my opinion, the hotel located far from downtown, Miami. So, although we wanted eating some drink or beer in the room, we couldn't. The only way to do is room-service. I can't understand the absence of refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport - friendly staff - good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: kremm
Reviews.Content: Spent one night after an intercontinental flight. Nice to arrive at a hotel with efficient luggage handlers and a efficient and nice front staff. The hotel is 5-10 mins in taxi ($24) from the airport. The room was typical american. Carpet, two huge beds, 32" flatscreen (with HD-channels) and a view over the lagoon. Neither wi-fi ($10) nor breakfast was included, but at $110 for one night, that's not the worst problem. Breakfast was a la carte from the la Riviera restaurant and it was good value for money, and also here the staff were efficient and courteous. All in all, after having spent a week at several hotels in Florida, this is the best value for money so far! But I just can't give away 5 point to every hotel that provides good value for money (got key card for a room one floor below, thankfully the luggage handler helped us), 32" tv is too small (yes, it is!) and the rooms are just as any other typical american hotel (carpets, two huge beds with a lot of pillows and a bathroom like any other hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Very Service Oriented”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: During our recent stay, at the Miami Sofitel by the airport, we encountered the need for a wheelchair; and I asked the hotel concierge if she knew where to rent one. I needed it for one day. The concierge made arrangements and got a wheelchair, from the hotel, for us and fee of charge! That's service. I forget the name of the concierge, it was the lady on duty during the afternnon shift on Monday, Nov 22nd, 2010. We have stayed at the hotel often as we visit my in-laws regulary and they live close by the hotel. The hotel staff has always been very attentive and the facilities are wounderful. It's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean room, great service and a good break fast. The hotel is near from airport and the most hyways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jenhan1311
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I were a couple of days in Miami, before we went to Orlando for our Honeymoon. We've stayed at this hotel and the staff was very friendly to us. My husband got sick when we've arrived at the hotel, they send out imediatly a bellboy to the CVS pharmacy to buy him medications. Room was clean, we had a room with nice skyline view. They offer free shuttle service to the airport. All by all we had a pleasant stay at this hotel and we will definitly return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: fourstaronly
Reviews.Content: Arrived early after an overnight flight but this was no problem for the staff. Was checked in by 10.00 am. Lovely room and views. Bell staff always hovering at the door. Excellent shuttle service from/to airport just wait outside airport for sofitel bus(every 1/2 hour) and free (tip) The hotel seemed to charge for parking if you had a car

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bartalotti Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Sofitel Miami last week, and i could appreciate a great service, excellent staff and a confortable and clean room amenities. The proximity of the MIA Airport and Car Rental Area are a important point to consider for travellers. As a A-Club gold member, i had an enjoyable wellcome drink at the pool : )

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, would stay anytime”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great for the money that was spent I wasn't expecting it to be soo good, the beds are the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in and I have slept at alot of hotels. the bathrooms are great, their service is great, my only pet peeve is that they dont have microwaves in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Noireevb
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Sofitel. I really enjoy the service, the friendiness and the attention that I get when I stay there. The price was very reasonable and it was close to everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: “The beds were great!”
Reviews.Author: Cooltraveler123
Reviews.Content: Pros:I didn't have to wait long for the free shuttle from the airport to the hotel; room was great with view of the lagoon; down duvet and pillows and the gracious staff let me have late checkout. Breakfast was a selection of american, french or cuban dishes with excellent croissants and pain au chocolat. Cons: the exterior of the property itself seemed a little odd until I realized it was bleu, blanc and rouge, for the french flag. There was not a breakfast buffet, although they wanted me to prepay for it. The shuttle was only available to the airport and cruise ship ports, not to other local places..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kysang
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels weÂ´ve been lately. ItÂ´s not luxury, but that is not an important item for us. WeÂ´ve been at luxury hotels but no confort. ThatÂ´s an item most people donÂ´t care much. The service is perfect. All employees are very king and polite. Food is very good with a backery inside the hotel. A must stay in Miami, even for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, second visit.”
Reviews.Author: omeganatasha
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now prior to joining a cruise. Near to the airport, easy transfers to the dock, really quiet. Good quality food, relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place before you fly out”
Reviews.Author: KayOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: We happened to choose the Sofitel as the last place of our trip to Florida. We spent our last night there and we haven't regretted it at all. A nice service, lovely rooms - it doesn't feel like an airport hotel at all. The pool was a little colder then the ocean at South Beach that is very easy to reach if you have a car. Most of the rooms have a great view on the runway, something every child (and most dads :)) love a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why the negative complaints”
Reviews.Author: billz1979
Reviews.Content: Let me first premise this by saying I write reviews based on what is expected of a hotel. This is a very nice airport hotel, convenient to the airport, clean, comfortable, affordable with great service. The only knock I can think of is the lack of free wireless....seems odd to charge for WiFi. That said, if you need a pre cruise hotel or a hotel near the airport this is a very safe bet.

Reviews.Title: “Better than anticipated”
Reviews.Author: KWBrace
Reviews.Content: We stayed here unexpectedly because we missed our connecting flight in Miami. We didn't expect much since the airline was paying for it and we were pleasantly surprised. It's obvious the hotel isn't brand new but the bed and the linens were very comfortable and we were able to get something good to eat in the hotel's lounge. The staff was extremely nice and gave us extra toiletries because we didn't have our luggage with us. We were very pleased with our overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Fred_Brazil_69
Reviews.Content: Sometimes cleanness can be a matter of luck, or not. For us - a party of six, 3 separate rooms - sofitel Miami was very nice, with a soft & delicious scent of vanilla in rooms everytime we open the doors. In the EUA we always rent a car (expect in cities like NYC, but the big apple is just an exeception, as well) so the distante between Sofitel Miami and the mall or the beach was not a problem for us. The staff was very kindly but the guy at the concierge made a mistake: my friend asked him for a scale to weigh his luggage. The weight was about 68 lb and they said it was more than we could take in our international flight back home. Well, he was wrong: the maximum permited is 70 lb = 32 kg, each bag. But I already know that and solve my friendÂ´s doubts & fears.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff but Unimpressive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chioalumni
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel along with our cruise on the Norwegian Epic. The main thing my husband and I look for in a hotel is cleanliness. It doesn't have to be the prettiest hotel or the most expensive hotel, just clean. CONS: The hotel does a terrific job in their pictures because we were expecting a nice, clean, modern looking hotel but was shocked at how worn down it was. There were huge stains in the carpet down the hall heading to our room. When we came into our room, the bathroom had grimy tile and even hair in the corners of the bathroom. PROS: The staff however is extremely nice and helpful. Anytime we asked a question, they were great at providing useful information. The service is very good. The pool is very pretty but we never got in it. It was also conveniently located near the airport. Overall, like stated in the title this hotel had very friendly staff but the overall hotel didn't feel clean. We will probably stay elsewhere should we return for a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel always delivers French quality”
Reviews.Author: WanderingProfessor
Reviews.Content: I agree with some of the reviews: this is not a "real" Sofitel, it's a dignified one. The building is ugly, and what can you expect from a hotel located 5 minutes from the airport? Well, that's the point. When I arrive in Miami, jet lag is always a killer so I have barely enough energy to get my luggage, rent the car, and check in the closest hotel I can find. The Sofitel is perfect for a power nap or a good night of sleep. Staff is professional, rooms and lobby are elegant and clean, you have a nice pool and a good gym plus there is a Starbucks Coffee in the hotel for the morning coffee at 5am when you hit the road for real. The Sofitel does the job with class, and at great value. I recommend it and will return next time I land in Miami (which is as soon as possible).

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: italianfaith
Reviews.Content: I used to stay on the beach but got tired of the attitude. I love the Sofitel, convenient if you've got a car (and parking isn't expensive the way it is on the beach). Rooms are large and comfortable. The concierge desk is the greatest--always available, knows all the great places to go. I wouldn't think of staying elsewhere in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “No bargain”
Reviews.Author: VITraveler50
Reviews.Content: Booked a 2-night stay on AA.com at end of 2-month trip in US - knew Sofitel name from other cities and thought low price was a great deal. Not so. Property is in a lovely location, but it is very, very tired. Outdoor parking was $8/night. Internet was NOT free. Drinks were sky high ($15 for a cocktail). Food in restaurants and on room service menu also sky high. Coffee & croissant in lobby was good but pricey. No coffee maker in room. Housekeeping failed to empty bathroom waste basket. Noises in corridor and plumbing woke me repeatedly. Bed was nice, but my back ached in AM, and bed-skirt was snagged and lop-sided. Wonderful linens, but no top sheet on the bed - only a down comforter (in Miami??) Air conditioning kept me frozen (ah-ha - the comforter is making more sense now) until I turned it off completely, whereupon the room got stuffy. Staff was helpful, pleasant, friendly. Shuttle service to/from MIA was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfotable bed in the World!!!”
Reviews.Author: nicnac_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel pre cruise, and I wish I'd had a few more night's in the hotel! I found the staff so pleasent, the room was spotless, and the bed was so so so comfy I didn't want to get up!!! Best hotel I have stayed in for a while. My only complaint was it was so Cold, was Jan to be fair, but freezen cold inside!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Arizona828
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful room, excellent service and a good price I booked off the hotel website. From the driver that picked us up at the airport to the desk staff to the restaurant and the driver who took us back to the airport. Super Experience. We'd highly reccommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for the money. Extremely clean, awesome staff. The hotel is very close to the Miami airport and has free shuttle service from the airport to the hotel. We stayed in a Deluxe room, which is on the opposite side of the airport and did not hear any airplane noise. The restaurant in the hotel if very nice, food was good, but very expensive. There is a Starbuck's in the lobby of the hotel. Would definitely recommend for a pre-cruise stay.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely end to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: MrsControlFreak
Reviews.Content: We stayed before we were due to fly out from Miami. We felt very happy with the hotel. It had a French atmosphere. Very nice (but not spectacular) room. Great L'Occitane toileteries! Pool lovely with great sunbeds. Restaurant looked a little expensive for our end-of-holiday budget, but there was a Publix within 2 min drive, and we ate in a little Italian restaurant next to it. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. For the price I paid I was very happy with the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay means great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Francescodioliveira
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel, we hesitated a lot as some were really good and others not so much. My wife and I needed a hotel to spend the night before an early flight, and wanted a luxury hotel, not a "passageway" with too much transit like airport hotels can sometimes be. Maybe we were just lucky but everything about our stay was perfect. The staff is outstanding, ready to do anything to please us, there's always someone ready to help should you need anything, the lobby is beautiful, loved the starbucks coffee and the juice bar by the pool! Anyway my point is, what more can one expect from a hotel? Of course the location isn't the trendiest, but for an airport hotel, this one definitely stands out! They are very into detail and we appreciated that very much! Honestly, don't think twice, you won't find a better hotel in this location!

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel price, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricardomt
Reviews.Content: Very average hotel for the price. Looks old, in need of some renovation. Rooms are average, restaurant too "chic" for me, specially when it comes to serving breakfast. Staff is very nice and willing to help. The onion soup we ordered was pretty good though!

Reviews.Title: “Silver Lining”
Reviews.Author: pdiddyva
Reviews.Content: Some buddies and I were put up at the Sofitel, for a few hours, after missing our flight out of MIA. The shuttle driver was very cheerful, offered us water and gave us the low down on where the party was at on a Thursday night. We arrived at the hotel right as the restaurant was closing but seeing that we were quite frazzled from our travels they offered to seat us anyways. The food was good and were able to pay with our vouchers without any issues. A quick shower and then we were out for the rest of the night. All three of our rooms were comfortable and clean. Another quick shower after our early morning return and we were out the door to the waiting shuttle. Didn't get to sample any of their amenities besides the free internet stations they have. Even though our stay was short and our exposure to the hotel was minimal it still made a good impression on our trip and I will be sure to look them up again should I need to spend another few hours in MIA.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at a good price”
Reviews.Author: 2blue
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a place to stay overnight between legs of our vacation flight. The room rate was very reasonable and the service was excellent. The pool and lobby area are very nice. You could hear some noise from the planes taking off, but we slept right through it. Given how close the hotel is to the airport I think they did a good job of insulating it from the sound. The free shuttle from the airport in the evening and then back to the airport in the morning was a big plus as well. The food and drinks at the bar/restaurant weer a little expensive but were very good, so I guess you get what you pay for on this, just be prepared for the high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: MattstephM
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a French Hotel? I think. It is older but updated to look modern like all white dining with red accents. The pool was really nice with great furniture around it and towels. The hotel as clean, and a large bar area with big screen tv in it. The restaurant was Italian and a little on the pricey side. Kids grilled cheese and fries $10. The staff was for the most part nice. A little stuffy but attentive when coming and going, always opening the doors for us. We asked for extra pillows and they were never sent up. Beds were comfy with a feather mattress on the bottom and just a down duvet on top with not top sheet. Coffee shop downstairs says Starbucks brewed here posted everywhere so I thought it was one but it wasn't. It was really expensive. A cup of fruit was $8 and a small travel size pringles $4 !!! Overall, not a bad hotel for the money but there are newer hotels right by there that are more appropriate for children and families.

Reviews.Title: “nice convenient”
Reviews.Author: hugezeppelinfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Sofitel-Miami for one night 8/20-8/21 while in route to St Lucia. Very cool hotel, close to the airport. If you need to layover in Miami, it it a great place. The Price was perfect for what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, good if you are only...”
Reviews.Author: Kjk18
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, good if you are only stay a night and need a hotel close to the airport. Airport shuttle took a while both ways and staff were ok. No international adapter for electronic devices like all other large hotels have. A 19% gratuity on room service plus a $2 fee, yet the waiter still wanted a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Sofitel Miami”
Reviews.Author: MikeLentini
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand the negative reviews. We were only here for 1 night, but everything was as advertised. Non-smoking King room was larger than expected, with new looking amenities and electronics. Great pillows. The staff we interacted with were super friendly. Cannot complain about anything other than the occasional plane flying over, but it's near the airport so tht is expected. I guess you can't make everyone happy?????

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: sarahsmile39
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. I feel safe going in and out. You get a quiet night's sleep. There are not many amenities but it is so convenient to the airport. I got my wake up call on time. my only complaint is that the crib they loaned me seemed about 200 years old; i am not even sure the bars were close enough to meet regulations.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a dumpy holiday inn with...”
Reviews.Author: orridge
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dumpy holiday inn with the sofitel name on it. Do not be fooled. The overall room condition is dingy. Bartender had a number of inappropriate conversations about his police interactions with his pistol in his car and shuttle driver could not stop staring at my wife's breasts (though I have the same problem). Lady at front desk was a delight. For the money, go to the holiday inn and get free breakfast. Our biggest complaint is that based on reviews and sofitel name, we expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Could only handle 8hrs.....”
Reviews.Author: GrayGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night as we had travelled from Las Vegas and arrived at midnight so it was a place to put our head down before we moved onto downtown miami for a futher 3 nights. We waited a good 30 mins for the shuttle bus to arrive but maybe it was the time of day (we had been delayed 2 hrs in vegas and arrived after midnight). Hotel is a 10 min drive away from airport so not bad location for airport only. On arrival i have to say we were checked in by a really nice and friendly man and got upgraded as we were on our Honeymoon. On arrival to our room however we realised why the rate is pretty competative. The room stunk of stale smoke as the carpet and fittings had obviously been clarted with the smell of tobacco. They advertise this place as luxury but the room was far from it. They are trying however in a place they dont have much to work with as the building must be approx 30 years old. They have nice flat screen tv's and even a bose soundwave in the room but they stuck out as the furnishings and fittings, especially in the bathroom were worse than that in a motel 6. The room just didnt feel clean, maybe it was the stale smell but i could hardly sleep as i thought the bed was probably riddled with bugs. I couldnt wait to get up in the morning and move on in our travels Im sorry, i wouldnt recommend this hotel, its a bit of a dump to be honest that they have tried to tart up with fancy tv's & radios

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: apperley17
Reviews.Content: After a 10 hour flight to Miami, we were taken to the Sofitel for one night before we joined a cruise ship. It was a wonderful hotel; the room was spacious, clean, cool (it was difficult to adjust to the Miami heat having left the UK in winter wrapped in 5 layers of clothing!), the bathroom had everything I needed so I didn't have to unpack any bags to find shampoo, hairdryers etc. We went for a short walk around the grounds and tried to find some shops. There was a newsagent and a couple of other small shops nearby, but you will be lucky if you can get anything other than essentials. We couldn't find anywhere to eat, so we went back to the hotel where they were running a wine and buffet evening. We choose to have a pizza and burger, both which were freshly made and very tasty, before lounging by the pool for a couple of hours with a beer. It was a small pool, but kept clean and relatively warm. There was a great view over a lake. Towels were available and employees kept coming round tidying up glasses / sun loungers / ashtrays. Couldn't fault it. Breakfast was perhaps the highlight. My husband ordered pastries and I had blueberry pancakes. All of a sudden 2 waitresses approached with fresh fruit, pastries, syrups, jams, juice, coffee. It was amazing. All fresh too. Check in and checkout was quick and easy. The staff were all very polite and eager to help. I suppose the only downside is that it is outside of Miami (about 15 minute drive). Reception were happy to order taxis, but it isn't the most convenient place to stay if you want the hustle and bustle of Miami. Given that we were just there for one night, this didn't bother us. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone flying into Miami and needing somewhere to stay for a night or two. We'll be putting in a request next time!

Reviews.Title: “What a GEM!!”
Reviews.Author: pambarber
Reviews.Content: From Seattle and needed rest both back and forth to Galapagos. What a find Sofitel is! Free shuttle from Miami Airport. Asked for room on 14th floor and got it! Spotless, very friendly staff. Room very quiet in spite of view of runway. There wase a totally jolly Starbucks barrista as we departed at 6 AM . Very appreciated. Too old to sleep in airport for 9 housrs after red eye specal, we got a very reasonable NAP rate of $69. Only downside was was just one shuttle every 30 minutes to and from airport. If we weren't so cheap, we would have taken a cab. Hope you're as lucky as we were.

Reviews.Title: “Concerned about location - don't be!”
Reviews.Author: Psasha
Reviews.Content: I was told not to stay in this area next to airport. I did anyway, and didn't regret it. After a few days in SoBe and a cruise this turned out to be the most relaxing place, far from the hustle and bustle and the constant sales pitches. The hotel is quiet, and no, we did not hear planes flying over our heads every 2 minutes (didn't hear them at all). Rooms standard, not the most modern, but decent. Pool area nice, pool too cold though. But lovely gym and 2 free tennis courts, which was a bonus. And if you go to SoBe, you're there in 15 mins (literally). So, unless you want to at the beach and party all night on Ocean, stay at the Sofitel and explore Miami from here and save the bucks for better things!

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: hairstylist051
Reviews.Content: Thank you Andres for everything! We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: SamprasCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed there the night before we went on a cruise. Loved it! The staff was very helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful, so is the restaurant. I will stay there again next time before going on the cruise. Convenient location to the airport. Not too far from South beach either only 20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: DiveCoco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for $99 a night. That is a bargain for a solid 4-star hotel. I had not stayed there in more than 10 years. Due to the rate I thought it was going to be runned-down. It was a pleasant surprise to have great service and rooms for that rate. Definitely recommended

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: messyjessigirl
Reviews.Content: On our way home from the Bahamas we had an overnight layover in Miami and decided to stay at the Sofitel Hotel. I was very pleased with how quickly they picked us up from the airport. From the time I called to let them know we were ready, it took them less than 5 minutes. When we arrived at the hotel to check in we were impressed with how kind the employees were. We felt like everybody was at our beck and call and 100% attention was focused on our needs. During check in we were treated to an upgrade. When we were ready for dinner, they drove us to the restaurant of our choice. The suite was so nice and clean. The bathroom was spotless. There were 4 computers to access internet for free. When we were ready to head to the aiport at 5am, they were ready and waiting for us. I would highly recommend this hotel especially if you need to be close to Miami International Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to Sofitel Brand Standards”
Reviews.Author: sharonalyse
Reviews.Content: I chose the Sofitel Miami based on its location to the office I was visiting and because I LOVE the Sofitel St James in London. This hotel is nothing like that one. It doesn't have the amenities or the class the St James has. If you need a place to stay by the airport, you are very close. The problem is that you won't be able to sleep because you can hear the planes taking off and landing all night long. I am a gold member of their loyalty program so I was told I was being "upgraded." I had the same room my two colleagues were given. I got make up on a towel in the morning, so I put it on the floor with my other dirty towels. When I came back to the room at night, the towel was placed back on the towel rack. EWW! I mentioned it to the manager and I was put in a new room, which was an upgrade as it was a jr suite. It would have been nice to be in the room for both nights as it was definitely nicer with a Bose docking station, etc. If you are going to Miami Beach from the hotel, expect a $40 cab ride. They also charge $10/day for Internet use.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chicagohoosier07
Reviews.Content: The lobby and entrance are well-done, and the rooms are fairly modern and well-kept. However, the staff placed me and my girlfriend in a two full-bed room instead of the King we had purchased because they said there were no King bed rooms left. We realized the bed was just terribly uncomfortable. There was no sheets under the comforter and the bed was rock hard, as were the pillows. Sofitel only provided a single robe as well. The city view was miniscule. The TV was nice and good quality. The Concierge was adequate and it is located close to the airport, but there were too many flaws to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Airport Hotel - Plus”
Reviews.Author: Tellurian
Reviews.Content: Originally, my husband and I were only going to spend 1 night here during a flight stopover. When we decided to spend 2 more nights in the Miami area, we thought of moving to Miami Beach, but when we compared hotel features and value and considered the hassle of moving, we opted to stay all 3 nights at the Sofitel. It was a good choice. Our high floor corner "luxury" room was quiet with a nice view. Sofitel offered attractive deals; we chose one night on the "air of romance" package, which included in room "champagne" (shame on you, French chain, Sofitel for calling Washington State sparkling wine champagne) and straberries dipped in chocolate, plus full breakfast in room or restaurant for a rate of $116 (not a typo). The other two nights were $135 each with a use-as-we-liked hotel credit of $50/night. For the quality of the room, the nice amenities and services, we felt that there was no reason to move. The hotel courtesy shuttle to the airport made it a cinch, not to mention cheap, to catch the $2.35 express "Airport Flyer" to and from South Beach and finally to easily get us and our bags back to the airport for our onward flight. The restaurant, where we had breakfast each morning, was pleasant, but I have to say that it's not up to it's old standards. Years ago, the pastries tasted like they were flown in fresh from France daily; now they are passble, but pedestrian. Sofitel is evidently going more global than remaining true to its French roots, but at least all the staff still greet you with a "Bonjour."

Reviews.Title: “Modern Euro style hotel near airport; great staff; comfy beds w/duvets; roomy baths”
Reviews.Author: Herb_Lover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at front and back end of business cruise Miami/Bahamas with a colleague. Really like the soaring Art Deco lobby and euro-style/modern furnishings in rooms; staff gracious and experienced. Our generously sized room had a nice view of lagoon, 2 double beds and work area; flat screen TV; feather beds & duvets were very, very comfy; chaise lounge to relax on; spotless bathroom w/granite counters, L'Occitane amenities. Outdoor pool w/waterfall; onsite bar and restaurant w/outdoor seating when weather permits; Starbucks coffee bar in lobby handy for wrap sandwich or local pastries. Happened to be during a cold spell and our first room just never heated up; they quickly moved us to another where the heater worked. Fitness center.
