Bar food very good, pricey like all hotel bars, but nice selections; liked the arugula on my delicious sandwich. Used the business center; Concierge arranged for shuttle to Port of Miami for $10 P/P. If you really need to sleep whether it is PM you arrive or late next AM, ask them to put you in a room away from noise - actually something I check on at every hotel I stay at, if I know I'm going to need the quiet. Always found them able to juggle rooms at last minute if this is an issue. Great value booking direct and early online with AAA discount. Free shuttle to/from airport. Will stay here for next Miami trip.

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying and fair value”
Reviews.Author: voyager_b
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is renowned for its comfortable beds and pillow menu. This Sofitel is several years old but has had a refurbishment and is pleasant enough to stay in if you are en route. It is a five minute courtesy bus trip from MIA and although the restaurant closes at 9:30pm and the Starbucks badged coffee area sometime sooner there is a 24 hour room service menu and my tasty good value meal arrived within 25 minutes. The rooms are clean and the one I stayed in was comfortable and large even with the king sized bed installed. I wouldn't reccommend this Sofitel for a holiday although the pool is nice and, set beside a lagoon, the views are restful despite the other side of the hotel facing the runways. It's position dictates that it is a stop-off to somewhere else. I have friends who stay there on their way to the Caribbean and it is used by Cruise Ship travelers. The staff are well mannered and helpful. My only annoyance with Sofitels everywhere is that they say "Bonjour" on arrival, on answering the phone and generally any time they can to remind us that the Accor Group is French. I come from Australia & it seems insane being greeted this way there or anywhere not truly French! Never the less, I left rested the day after a 20 hour flight and that's a good reccommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4+ Star Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AJCM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel in early March, for 4 days on business. I had an amazing experience, from start to finish. I was travelling to South Beach daily, and even with the costs of cabs, this hotel was STILL cheaper than anything in South Beach, and it was like an oasis away from the hustle of the city. I am typically a picky traveller, and usually stay Hyatt, Fairmont, W - 4 star minimum. This hotel was in that calibre, and had a welcoming European feel. LOCATION The Sofitel is located close to the airport ($12 cab ride) however the hotel offers a free and convenient shuttle. There is also a $10 (round trip) shuttle to a local outlet mall. It is a 15-20 minute ride, but luckily Sofitel is the last pick up, and the first drop off. Otherwise, there is not much around the hotel. Miami Beach/South Beach is approx. a 20 minute cab ride away, and this costs $38-$40 with tip, per way. HOTEL The hotel is clean, and modern, and nicely laid out. The elevators are right in the centre of the lobby, as is some seating. There is a small gift shop, and a great Starbucks for breakfast/coffees. The hotel is located on a lagoon, which affords beautiful views and a nice setting for their pool. The pool is clean, and offers thick cushioned loungers, with plenty of towels, and lots of shaded or sun areas. The pool area is small, but you feel like you are at a resort. There is also a free internet cafe/business area, which was a nice touch. Wireless service is provided at a small fee $7.99, but it was worth it, as it works anywhere in the hotel. RESTAURANTS You can choose from dining room, sitting at the bar, or sitting in the bar/lounge area. All food was TERRIFIC, as were the drinks (and the tasty complimentary bar snacks). Breakfast can be selected from the restaurant, Starbucks, or room service. Lots of great options at any price. ROOMS The rooms were clean, modern, and comfortable. The bathroom is a typical marble bath, but nice and clean, and well maintained. The bed has a thick fluffy white duvet - which to me is the standard for a 4+ hotel! It is changed as often as you like, and the bed and pillows were super comfortable. The only complaint might be the noise of the planes. As far as hotels go, it was quiet, however you do get a gentle wake up call at 6:00 a.m. when the planes start departing. As I said, even with the planes it was no noiser than a typical hotel, and this did not bother me. SERVICE The service at this hotel was OUTSTANDING, from the bellman, to the concierge, to front desk, to restaurant staff. It was just amazing. Everyone was helpful, and friendly, and had a smile on their face. Bottom line - a great experience! Keep in mind it is off the beaten path, but everything is accesible via taxi or shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: afriend0607
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night here before going on a cruise The hotel was wonderful, very pretty, good veiws, good location, the staff was night, they have a couple of good restaurants on sight, the rooms were pretty and spacious, and the pool was pretty (though a little cold). Overall it was a great stay and if i ever go back to miami for a longer stay i will def stay here! We liked it a lot! The only complaint is that we did hear some noise while trying to sleep, but then again we did go to bed a little early.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - what's the beef?”
Reviews.Author: visualgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel due a flight change. We were in South Beach but decided to stay closer to the airport. Since we've stayed at Sofitels in other cities, we figured it would be the same. Did not book through third party, but with hotel directly, so we paid more for the room, but I'm learning that hotels often treat customers who use third party systems differently - so this was kind of an experiment. Reservations person on the phone was extremely nice and when I asked a nice room for the night and a late check out (since we were going to have to spend the day there) and she assured us we would get that. She also extended a 10% discount even though we didn't have a AAA card with us, no questions asked. We arrived by taxi, so parking wasn't an issue. The bellhop whisked our bags into the lobby with a smile and it didn't seem as though he was angling for a large tip at all - in fact, he walked away and we followed to compensate him appropriately. We checked in and I reminded the front desk about my phone conversation regarding nice room and late check out. All was fine and we were given a corner room on the 14th floor. and again, service with a smile. I might add here that we were dressed very casually as we had just spent the day tooling around South Beach in a gocar and we were not profiled in any way. The hotel lobby is separated in that the upper lobby is check in and a coffee spot, the lower lobby is the bar, restaurant and seating , which I liked. It's very open, airy and nicely decorated. Our room was lovely with a great view of the lagoons on one side and the city on the other with the pool below. Seemed quite clean, although there was a long hair along the rim in the sink. The shower pressure was quite weak, but the bathroom was very nice with plenty of towels and nice amenities. The bed was very comfortable and you can see in the pics that my husband lay down as soon as we got into the room and promptly fell asleep. Yes, there is airplane noise but not terrible and the hotel is situated near the airport so what the heck do you expect? The pool area was nice even though the red, white and blue colors are a little weird. It was too chilly to use the pool but I could see it being quite pleasant on a nice day. We decided to just hang out in the hotel for the next day (there really isn't anywhere to walk to as far as I could tell, so one wouldn't want to come here for the surrounding area). We relaxed in the lower lobby most of the day and the wait service was great. Polite, pleasant and helpful. We had a light lunch and a few cocktails. A stroll around the pool, watched some TV and other people. The food was very good. The restaurant was beautiful but we didn't eat there, we opted to just hang in the lobby. All in all, a very nice stay although it all kind of fell apart when we got on the shuttle to the airport. The driver was a bit clueless and kept forgetting where everyone was getting off. We had to remind him to stop at one of the terminals for a couple going to the UK. He was picking up people as well as dropping off, so it was getting a bit crowded. He actually told us to get off and walk to the other end of the terminal so there could be a few more seats on the shuttle for pickups! We refused. Unbelievable! It was as if he didn't know where any of the airline drop offs were. So aside from the idiot shuttle driver, we enjoyed our stay here and would come back again if we need to be near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel quality everywhere in the world!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelkWhite
Reviews.Content: Like all of the hotels in the Sofitel range, this is very very good! The beds are out of this world! The staff on reception were very good and they gave me an upgrade to a suite. The room was massive and the lobby and lounge in the hotel were classic Art Deco style. You get great value for money compared to the hotels on Ocean Drive or in the SOBE area but it is a bit of a short drive to get to the shops and the bars. Stay here for quality and check out any Sofitel hotel in the world if you are looking for something special!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: elguapo_8
Reviews.Content: Modern, chic, clean, comfortable, friendly staff, close to airport, not near night life and south beach, though Coral Gables isnt too far away. Pricey menu. Great place for a romantic getaway with your lady. Everything was great, but housekeeping forgot to clean our room after first night. They brought towels after we requested them.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, but choose your room carefully”
Reviews.Author: mmfun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel the night before a cruise, and also rented a day room to use between disembarkation and our late afternoon flight home. The day rate is about $80.00, similar to the price of using the airline's private lounge, but a much more comfortable way to spend several hours! The hotel is literally right across the road from the airport and has a shuttle service to both the airport and the pier. It's about a 4 block walk to a shopping center so it's easy to pick up last minute items like sun tan lotion and disposable cameras. We had excellent meals in the restaurant at both dinner and breakfast. The area around the pool is very pleasant and includes a nice eating area. The staff went out of their way to be accommodating. Unfortunately the soundproofing in some of the rooms is poor making it difficult for light sleepers. There is the noise of the planes in the rooms on the airport side, and the jr. suites are above the entrance canopy so there is both noise and vibration. It's important to really check out the room before you start to unpack or go to bed. We checked in tired and hungry, ate, turned on the TV, and got ready for bed before we noticed that our room was far to noisy for us to sleep well. Do not assume that asking for a quiet room before checking in will solve the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service and pampering!”
Reviews.Author: MandragoraMaggie
Reviews.Content: We wound up here via our cruise line and did not know what to expect...it was Superbowl Weekend and everything was else was booked. What a pleasant surprise!! The outside of the building was a bit strange...cubism gone mad...but the inside is beautiful..elegant, spacious, artfully decorated, luxurious. The service was five star from the doorman to the porter, reception, lounge and restaurant. Every single staff person went out of their way to make us feel welcome and pampered. The room was excellent, the beds were heaven. The drinks at the bar were great (try their Mojitos!). We had a great breakfast on site and the pool here is gorgeous. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel...only negative is that it is adjacent to the airport, but the windows when closed are pretty soundproof. It's 10 minutes from the cruise dock and 5 minutes from Miami International.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: nolmthater
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way to and from the Caribbean in the beginning of January and we loved it. We got in late on the way in and they upgraded us to a suite for free which was great. The rooms were nice and clean and the beds were very comfortable. On the way back we were upgraded again. This hotel is close to the airport but you could not hear it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Dog friendliest place in the US”
Reviews.Author: mw_6680
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sofitel Paris as well as the Sofitel Miami Airport and can honestly say they have the friendliest staff I have encountered in the US. My yorkie was welcomed, the rooms are clean and gorgeous, the location is secluded and safe....perfect place. I lived in Miami for 28 years and can say it is a true oasis. Going back this weekend !

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, incredibly helpful staff, right by the airport”
Reviews.Author: alwaysplanahead
Reviews.Content: Stayed there after a cruise. The staff especially the concierge, Rafaele, were fantastic. Rafaele was helpful even before we arrived. I had phoned a couple of weeks before to get restaurant recommendations for the area so I could make a reservation and he was extremely knowledgeable and pointed us to Ortanique on the Mile, which was outstanding. When we arrived our boys wanted to use the tennis courts so the hotel provided racquets and balls and when I asked for extra towels and pillows they also brought up lots of extra shampoo, etc. which were by L'Occitane and were heavenly. Also provided lots of helpful shopping information. Generous sized room. Lovely restaurant - great food, reasonably priced for a hotel and good sized portions. I

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusieFromMN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in January and it was great. The room was really nice and although we could see the airport out our window, there was no noise. The bed was quite comfortable. The hotel was easy to find and I was glad that just blocks away was a CVS. Casa Juan, a Cuban restaurant nearby was also good but the portions were huge so two adults can split just one plate. It was raining hard the morning we left and as they did not have umbrellas, the shuttle bus operator offered to take my husband out to his car. They were also very helpful with the basics like moving our luggage, holding doors, etc. I didn't know what to expect but for just a one night stay before catching another flight, the Sofitel was great!

Reviews.Title: “An oasis... minutes from the airport...”
Reviews.Author: tdcguy
Reviews.Content: Spent the night before our cruise with NCL (wished we would have skipped the cruise). A beautiful European hotel comparable to 4 Seasons properties. Very chic outdoor oasis with well manicured grounds and pool. Spectacular room with unbelievable bed and soft bedding. All of the staff were attentive, polite and hospitable. The restaurant was pricey, but offered well presented, tasty food. Only 5 minutes from the airport, but not a traditional airport hotel. I have recommended this hotel to my mom ;-) and will be back when I am in Miami

Reviews.Title: “Not what it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: Dskooch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for the Orange Bowl, since it was a sponsered hotel of the O.B. Anyway, there was really no problem the first day we were there, but we were woken up at 7 a.m. by a banging and scratching sound going on in the room next to ours. Apparently, the hotel thought that 7 a.m. was a good time to do renovations with an occupied room next door. When my husband took a shower, the tub filled with over 3 inches of water. After making our way down to the lobby, I very discreetly and politely told the front desk of the noise and shower issues. She agreed to move our room and gave us free coffee. That was it. No partial refund on the room, no free breakfast for being woken up, nothing. Then, when we were inquiring about transportation to the game, the hotel had nothing arranged to transport the numerous amount of fans to the game. Keep in mind, this was a sponsoring hotel of the game. So, after spending over $120.00 on transporation (cab) to and from the game and being woken up early in the morning, we were not happy. not to mention, the hotel itself looks VERY worn. The walls, carpet, etc are scuffed, marked and damaged. Not what we expected from Sofitel. Marriott is much nicer. No coffemaker in room, either. We wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnafique!”
Reviews.Author: Toad143
Reviews.Content: I was recently a businsess trip to the Miami area. After one night in South Beach I looked for a convenient location to work from as a hub. I found the Sofitel Hotel near the airport. What a suprise! I had never stayed at one before. They have nice sized rooms, very clean, awesome beds and linens, very well appointed. Flat screen LCD TV's and great furniture. Granite top in bathroom. Great prices after doing an online search too. Wonderful staff with a little French flair. I would not hesitate to come back with my family either. The only downer is that you have to pay for a T-mobile hot spot wireless hook up that runs about 8 bucks a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: StardustMx
Reviews.Content: We went to Miami to spend the last week of 2009. During the first part of our trip we went to the Sofitel Hotel, which is just great. Very nice staff, and very nice and clean rooms. I hightly recommend this hotel. It is nearby Miami's Airport.

Reviews.Title: “We really like this hotel as a stop over for connecting flights”
Reviews.Author: travelingtocaribean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a first class place to rest and relax. We use often as as stop over from connecting flights (overnight flights that connect through Miami). The staff is wondeful. The food was good, pricey but good. The beds are fantastic european style that you just sink into....

Reviews.Title: “Good value with caveats”
Reviews.Author: petechan
Reviews.Content: In short, the hotel has very friendly courteous and helpful staff including the porters, check-in and concierge. The rooms are average sized, very clean, nice TV, beds very comfortable, bathrooms clean and well furnished. Nice spaciouslobby, beautiful pool. Safe environment. Caveats: internet is not free, no microwave, no fridge, no coffeemaker, no free breakfast, parking is $8 a day. Restaurant is pricey ($15 for omelet). Hotel is about 15-20 minutes to downtown Miami by expressway. Around the corner by car is a small strip mall with several restaurants including a chinese place, Casa Juan and also Anacapri Italian restaurant, as well as a Publix supermarket. Casa Juan, despite the other reviews here, for my taste, served good Cuban food in generous portions, usual prices are $9-$12 a dish. Also open at 5 am for those needing early breakfast ($4 an omelet). Somehow ,they will try to get you to tip twice, maybe its usual practice. The italian restaurant is $15-$25 a dish, cozy, and the dishes we had were very good also.

Reviews.Title: “A modern hotel... actually awesome one!”
Reviews.Author: skljajic
Reviews.Content: This is probably one of the best airport hotels I've ever seen, and I've seen many! Top notch rooms, cleanliness, service. Fantastic breakfast and excellent dinners in hotel's restaurants. A beautiful, beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lackadaisical, lazy and not understanding”
Reviews.Author: kayung
Reviews.Content: Front staff seems pleasant at first but would try to blame you for docoding the room key, convince you to rent a car through them (tell you that they are the cheapest, which they aren't), then kicks you out of unused part of the lobby (saying it is restricted).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCovington
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful!!! I was kind of hesitant to book it because of some of the negative reviews it received but I'm glad I did! The majority of the bad reviews were from the beginning of the year so maybe they have updated since then. The staff was very friendly. Conceirge was helpful. Check in was fast. We came back from a cruise at 8am and check in wasn't until 3pm. They were able to find us a room and get us checked in early around 9am. The decor was beautiful. Everything was decorated for christmas. The lobby and lounge and bar areas were gorgeous. I didn't make it into the restaurant but it looked nice from the bar. The pool was nice. I don't swim so I didn't pay too much attention to it. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bed was very comfortable. It was weird not having a sheet to cover up with, just a comforter, but the comforter was soft and warm so it was fine. The pillows were extra soft!! There was also a free shuttle to and from the airport. Even though it is close to the airport, we didn't hear any of the planes! I read one review that said the walls were then and they heard their neighbors. We stayed on 2 different nights and didn't hear a thing. There's a small shopping plaza about a 10 min walk away. It has a grocery store, coffee shop with wi-fi, cuban food, fast food and a gas station. So everything is very convenient. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: plexiglasss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel instead of more expensive hotels in downtown Miami and Miami Beach. We were surprised with how nice the lobby and rooms were. The bed was huge and super comfortable. The bathroom was extremely clean. Airport noise is there, but not an issue at all. You can hear the planes take off and land, but we slept through it each night with no problems. You'll definitely need a car to get to all the good stuff to do in Miami. It's about 15 minutes to downtown Miami and 25 minutes to Miami Beach by car. My only complaint is about the restaurant. It was really expensive but our only option at 9pm on our arrival night. (Not many restaurants around this area.) The food was decent, but the service was awful. We waited 45 minutes for our check. Annoying and not worth $60 for a salad and entree. Other than that, I'd highly recommend this hotel as an alternative to the other outrageously priced options in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Night Before Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wilma58
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an ok place to stay prior to a cruise (one of NCL's night before hotels). Hotel food and drinks are very (too) expensive (left the hotel to find dinner, area is not near eating establishments), rooms are fine. Hotel is near the airport, not near the pier. Conciere staff is confusing, absentminded, and, in addition, gave out incorrect directions to an alternate dinner location. This hotel is a stop over for cruisers, good for just about that. Will not stay here again, will move down to the Bayfront area.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond In The Rough”
Reviews.Author: BeautifulMind504
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel for us when we visited Miami in October. I was a little apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the reviews. I must say I'm glad we decided to stay after all. Inside our room you wouldn't know you're across the highway from the airport. No noise or vibration at all. The decor is nice. The beds are sooo comfortable. The staff we came in contact with were friendly and helpful, opening/holding doors open for us and offering smiles and greetings. We had a minor problem and it was handled efficiently and effectively. I would reccommend having a rental car when staying in Miami as everything is a short drive away. Taxi rates would eat away at your pockets. I will definitely stay here again when visiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: GineydaD
Reviews.Content: we stayed the night before our cruise and fell in love. the decor was great and the food was so good that we came back after our cruise and stayed another night. a bit costly but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great beds!”
Reviews.Author: kmtkmt
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel before going on a cruise with RCCL. We got a room with 2 double beds and the beds were amazing. We had breakfast at the restaurant and it was very good. Try the breakfast fajitas....great ;) A super hotel to stay a night before cruising.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for such a good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ginagermany
Reviews.Content: A stylish hotel, very comfortable, only very COLD inside!!! I was shocked by the waste of energy! Two or three degrees less cold - I am sure only very few people would even notice! As a German traveller, I was looking forward to the warmth of Florida so much, and then I was actually freezing everytime I was in a shuttle bus or the hotel or the airport. It was even difficult to get the air condition in my own room to shut down, but they quickly sent someone to fix that problem. So Sofitel, being a European chain hotel, should maybe try to be a bit more European about the Air conditioning ;-) - at least the European travelers (except maybe those from the South) would surely appreciate that. However, this is most likely not only a Sofitel issue - most of the other hotels are probably similarly cold...? The pool water on the other hand, didn't seem that cold to me. I liked the pool area, but found it a bit uncomfortable to have to walk through the (very fancy and beautiful!) bar area after having gone swimming. The food was expensive - yes, but it's an expensive hotel after all - they give you a great deal on the rooms, but the restaurant then charges the 'normal' luxury prices... I recommend the "So Breakfast," which at 14 Dollars is not such a bad deal, very good tea too, but unfortunately not in the rooms - that would have been great! For me, this hotel was a great place to reenergize myself between two long distance flights!

Reviews.Title: “OMG What a palace!”
Reviews.Author: yorkiebard
Reviews.Content: Moving from a luxurious apt on South beach to Sofitel was difficult, thinking we were downgrading but found quite the opposite in a fantastic place. Service was exemplary, foyer decor was out of this world with a staircase better than the one on the Titanic , not that I saw the ship first hand of course. Rooms were elegant with plush decor and beds you could stay in forever. HD flat screen TV was a luxury we didn't expect but a nice bonus. Being close to the airport meant a little noise from the constant take offs but not enough to wake us. Located so far from South beach could be a problem but the public bus service is very good, cheap and reliable. All in all, with a high class restaurant this place is way above any other hotel in the area (not that I have tried them all of course) and one that I would gladly return to.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Homeboynot
Reviews.Content: We were lucky that this four star hotel came up on Hotwire for only about $65 for the one night we needed to stay near the Miami airport. It shows up on Hotwire as a four star hotel for this very low price. Their free shuttle runs every 30 minutes departing on the hour and half hour from the hotel to MIA airport. The bed was wonderful with a European style comforter. No coffee maker in the room. Free Internet in the lobby area but the computers will reset to the home page if you don't access something every minute or so which is frustrating if you're trying to copy something down on paper. They say the pool is open 24 hours but you must wear a wet suit - it's cold and unheated. Very dark lobby at night - you are in danger of running into things in the dark. Otherwise very clean and neat. $8 per day for parking which is better than the Wyndham which charges $11. Cornflakes for breakfast in the restaurant will set you back $5 - the cheapest option. Great value for the money at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay ... I'd definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: Nijo23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel in October 2009. The staff and hotel are very nice. For the price we paid and location of the hotel, we received a very good deal. We had one problem where the a/c wasn't cooling the room. The staff sent someone to the room immediately and within minutes switched us to another room, they even sent someone to retrieve our luggage. The decor is nice and the rooms are nice. We stayed in a double suite with the lagoon view and although we were barely in the room, when we were, we were comfortable. I loved the pillows. My head just sunk into them and I slept like a baby in the bed. I've read some of the bad reviews and I was skeptical at first, but once I arrived I understand that you cannot please everyone. For a near the airport hotel, I'd definitely stay there again. The only qulams I have are that the windows were a bit dirty and I couldn't get a good pic of the lagoon from the room, we had to pay $8 a day for parking and the room service and restaurant prices were a bit high. However, those things did not effect my stay at all. I consider myself to be picky and if I can say that I enjoyed my stay, then I think a less than picky person would too. Now if you want mega amenities, then you should pay more and stay somewhere else. It's close to everything, so if you have a rental car you won't be driving around aimlessly. They offer the basics and you'll have a most comfortable stay. Trust me.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PLACE IN MIAMI TO STAY FOR THE MONEY, SOLID 4 DIAMOND & DIRT CHEAP!”
Reviews.Author: bmw745ion19s
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at the Sofitel this past weekend. I picked this hotel as the price was great on Kayak (at $120 all in) then was actually $108 all in as a promotion on the Sofitel site. Also, it was reviewed great here and seemed like my type of property being a large, full scale property and great value. 1 night was planned the other added on due to some unfortunate events while in town. The staff were great from bellman to front desk attendants to the concierge. Everyone was very professional and friendly. While I wouldnt go so far as to say the hotel is a true 5-star, it is definitely a VERY SOLID 4 Diamond as its rated by AAA. The location isnt the best if you arent going to the airport but if you have a car its only a short 10 minutes on the expressway (right outside the complex) to downtown and 15 minutes or so to the beaches. To me the value more then made up for the drive back and forth to the hotel. The room was very nice and id definitely say anywhere else in miami this room would be $300+ a night. As much as I dislike Miami in general when I return again on business I will definitely give Sofitel a chance again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and guest service!”
Reviews.Author: katfberg
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning for an afternoon cruise, and were staying at Sofitel at the end of our cruise, a week later. We had an entire day to kill, and decided to see if we could leave our bags at the hotel while we did some sight seeing. The gentleman at the desk was so helpful! Not only did he allow us to check our bags in, he arranged a bus tour of Miami and a shuttle to get us to the tour start location, and then to our cruise ship. After our cruise, we were very pleased with the stay at the hotel. The room was large and clean, and had a nice view. It's very convenient to the airport. I wouldn't stay here if I was vacationing in Miami, but a wonderful place to stay before or after a flight. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice ..Very Nice and Very Nice. Actually very nice very nice very nice.”
Reviews.Author: lallishahi
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to be if you are in Miami for the first time or the last time. Very cheerful and helpfull staff , free shuttle rides to and from airport and the dolphin mall. extra clean. i mean i dont have words if i have to lure you into getting this hotel for your next vacation. its that good. :O) seriously. we are definately staying there next time we are in miami.Food is very good. you do have buy internet for 8 bucks a day from tmobile. The parking is extra 8 dollars but the front desk just validated it .overall it was very nice and i had a wonderful time with my girlfriend. Sofitel made it a trip to remember and the best vacation ever so far. good luck Lalli Shahi

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but only if you need to be near the airport”
Reviews.Author: faulk64
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on international transit so I prefered to be near the airport. I was very happy with the room overlooking the lagoon & was not bothered with aircraft noise at all. Food & beverage service was above average though priced that way as well. I also wanted to hire a car for a little sight -seeing which the hotel was quite helpful in arranging. There were also some problems with the car itself & the hotel concierge was helpful in finding a solution to these also. Good for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but location isn't ideal for a tourist”
Reviews.Author: lemurific
Reviews.Content: As a Miami native, I knew the location was pretty sucky, but I wanted a comfy hotel room to spend the night near the airport. I got what I wanted. Most hotels close to the airport are pretty rundown crappy hotels (DO NOT leave anything of value in your car). I got a great deal on a room in the Sofitel through Hotwire. However, if I was a tourist, I would be upset by the location and lack of things to do in the area. This is a good hotel if you are doing business near the airport. The only unpleasant part of our stay was that they originally gave us a smoking room, which reeked. After discussing this with the front desk, they moved us to a non-smoking floor. If you want to stay near the airport and near some decent nightlife, stay at a hotel in Coral Gables instead.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great place to experience Miami”
Reviews.Author: browan04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for three nights on a weekend trip to Miami, and thought based on the value and convenience to the airport that it would be a good idea, but it was not. We ended up renting a car in order to see anything in the city as it's not located near any points of interest. Also, when we arrived we were put in a room with a loud banging from what was later discovered to be the boiler room, and when we asked to switch rooms they claimed they didn't know what we were talking about but later told by a staff member that that happens all the time but they tried to put any sucker in that room. Overall, the hotel was fine, nothing terrible but nothing to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luisa13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and this have been our hotel for our last 4 visits to Miami. It is nice to go to Miami and be treated like royalty. For the past 18 month we have stayed 4 times in Sofitel and we have been assigned to the same room (1204). We really enjoy the Sky View Laggon and Airport View. The check in was easy and fast and every staff member is very well train in good manners and good quality service. The beds, pillows and duvet covered comforters are great. We love the plasma TV in our room and the variety of movies available. The shower is big enough and the bathroom itself is quite confortable. Good supply of toiletries too. The restaurant and room service are expensive indee but the food is really good. The coffee shop open and close early. Prices here are way over price. The location is great, close to the airport, restaurants, rent car, easy to get to major hi ways, close to the beach. I am just guessing that there were some bad luck people who can't sleep at night because of the airplanes take off noise. Let me just said that this is just part of a hotel been so close to an airport. We really love this hotel and would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Edward15
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked nothing like it did on the internet, on the internet it looked very modern, but it is fact very dated. We checked into our room and I immediately spotted dirty used tissues under the bed from the previous guests, which suggested the room had not been cleaned properly, the staff were not at all concerned which annoyed me as we had paid good money so expected at least to have a clean room. The bar costs were hideous $14 for a glass of average wine. I can honestly say i have never put a complaint about a hotel on trip advisor, we travel regularly and I have in the past put good comments about where we have stayed but I was so disappointed I had to write this, last year we paid the same price to stay at the Hard Rock Miami and that was Fantastic. This place is not worth the cost!!!!! and we won't be returning

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with refurbishing needs”
Reviews.Author: QuebecCaroline
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice, well located, very close to the airport although they did not seem to have airport shuttle so we took a taxi for $15. The hotel is getting a little old. The restaurant is too sophisticated and expensive. We were traveling with teenagers and it was too fancy and expensive for them. They really should have a family type restaurant. The coffee shop closed early the night we were there and it was also very expensive. The fruit cup was $9, the same at $5 at Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Never going back”
Reviews.Author: JSSOrlando
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the Sofitel Miami for a 4 day business trip in July, 2009. Upon driving up to the hotel, I was shocked. Not only is the building painted a terrible red and blue, it is also very dirty and looked like it was falling apart. When we pulled up to the gate, we were told we had to pay $12/day to park ( normally I don't mind, but then again I normally stay in 4 star hotels that actually are 4 stars). While walking from the parking lot to the lobby, I realized that I had to walk up a flight of stairs with all of my luggage. There was no ramp to walk up. Not for me and my associates carrying all of our luggage, and not for any handicapped people. The lobby decor was ok, but it's starting date itself. The pool was so small, I didn't even think about going in. The Sleeping Room - Small. Very outdated. Ant infested. Low lighting in the bathroom. Everything in the bathroom was very short. I had to bend over to use the sink and dry my hands on the little towel hanger - and I'm only 5'4"!!! When ever I had to use the toilet, I felt like I was sitting on the ground! There was also hair on the floor when I checked in. No coffee maker anywhere in the room. They have those at every hotel, even the $35 a night ones! No refrigerator. And strangest of all - no sheet to cover up with on the bed. Just a fitted sheet to lay on, and a heavy comforter to cover up with. Very strange, and hard to keep comortable at night. Also didn't help that the bed was hard as a rock. Everytime the air conditioning kicked on, it made a VERY loud knocking sound. The walls are paper thin. I could hear my neighbors' TV and their conversations. I stayed for 4 days, and my room key broke every single one. I had to stop and get a new key, every day. Location - Terrible. I guess it is somewhat convenient due to the close proximity to the airport, but I would rather drive 10 more minutes down the road and not hear airplanes all night while I'm trying to sleep. My room shook when some of them took off. That is too close to the airport. Also, not a good neighborhood. Meeting Space - Small, but adequate. Staff interupted the meeting constantly to check in us. It was very distracting. They also cleared out the snack/coffee area during our meetings instead of during our breaks. We had boxed lunches everyday for lunch, and none of the sandwhiches were labeled as to what kind they were. It was a guessing game every day. The convention bathrooms were disgusting. Dirty, cracked tile floors with holes in it. The ceiling also had holes in it and had large water stains all over the place. Overall, I was very dissappointed. I am very glad that my company paid for my stay, otherwise I would have left after the first night. Don't waste your time here. It is old, dirty, and overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at the Sofitel!”
Reviews.Author: TimeLikeGlass
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went on a girls trip for a week in Miami. We stayed at the Sofitel because of the great deal that we received. We had originally wanted to stay in South Beach, but chose the Sofitel because of the price. We were pleasantly surprised with the entire experience. The room was very clean, the hotel lobby was very pretty, clean pool and the staff were absolutely incredible. We never had to open the door once. There was always someone to greet us and give us a smile and ask how our day had been. The concierge at this hotel was so helpful and friendly! He really made our stay. He gave us directions to various places and made very good recommendation for clubs, restaurants, shopping and tours. We really love this hotel and would highly recommend staying here if you'v never been to Miami before. It's a 20 minute ride to the beach, cheap parking and conveniently located (close to gas station, grocery store, Starbucks). Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “incredibly rude and condescending staff”
Reviews.Author: travelinbooth
Reviews.Content: First, our travel agent booked this hotel as a comp for us because our flights changed unexpectedly. My husband and I arrived on a Wednesday night after many hours of travel from Barbados. We were dressed casually, which is an absolute no-no for this hotel, apparently. From the moment we walked in the door, we were assessed by the staff as people who did not belong. The hotel shuttle driver was incredibly rude and practically ripped the bags out of our hands though we insisted that we could handle the small carry ons. If you don't feel it's appropriate to leave a $20 tip for the person who opens the door for you, find a better hotel. We decided to eat elsewhere because we were exhausted and the hotel restaurant is anything but casual - I'm sure it's fine, but it was late and we had to be up at 4am the next morning. We were told about a great restaurant a 10 minute walk away by the concierge, and they offered to take us in the hotel's towncar. When we got to the concierge desk, the driver, the concierge and one other individual took one look at our casual clothes and began talking in Spanish about how much we might tip, saying "do you think it's 5 or 10?" "make sure you have change" and a few other rude things. To the Sofitel: You're in Miami. Don't assume that your drivers are the only people who speak Spanish, okay? Despite this, we tipped the driver generously because that was the expectation. It was a 3 minute drive. He promised us that he would return as soon as we had the restaurant call the hotel. We finished our meal, our waiter told us that he had contacted the driver who would arrive in 5 minutes, and 15 minutes later we decided to take the 10 minute walk back to the hotel. When we arrived at the hotel 20 minutes after we should have been picked up, the driver was walking out of the door toward the car. He pretended that no one had called, that he wasn't walking toward the car to come get us very late, but it was very clear that he was lying and that the folks dressed in casual clothes don't deserve prompt attention, even though our money was just as green as the guests on business trips. The rooms are small. They're nothing special. I'm so glad we received this hotel free, or we would've walked across the street to a hotel with staff that treats people with respect, regardless of how they are dressed. This was the absolute worst experience I've had. I would've rather slept in the airport than been treated like dirt by drivers and bellhops.

Reviews.Title: “Simple yet sophisticated elegance, quiet, with ultra courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: WalelaTA
Reviews.Content: For the discount price I received online, this hotel was a fabulous find! Extremely convenient to MIA, the harmonious environment envelopes you the minute you walk through the front door. Clean lines and clean rooms! Peaceful flora lined terrace with 24 hour pool access (unless area reserved for a wedding), mouthwatering and visually delicious breakfast frittata with the freshest pressed coffee! Daily parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: gonoyo
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Sofitel 21 years ago on our first wedding night, and I decided 2 surprise my hubby 21 years later with a weekand stay there. Bought back alot of memories.Extremely friendly staff from thesecurity lady at the entrance to the bell boy to the supervisor. Rooms are comfortable although they were installing plasma tv's in the rooms this weekend and made quite a bit of noise, they did respect our do not disturb sign and didn't disturb us. Wish room and at least a mini fridge but overall it was a good 2nd honeymoon and with great rate of $88.00 per night i found on line even better.

Reviews.Title: “VERY AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: JonnyJ60
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the uninterested barman the staff were very good but the rooms were grubby.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1111
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Sofitel Miami Airport. A beautiful and relaxing place to stay overnight between flights. My room was on the top floor with a view of the pool. The ground floor bar was pleasant for drinks and snacks (in lieu of dinner). The Art Deco ambiance is elegant, althought the '80's post-modern exterior looks a bit dated. The hotel is superior to any other airport hotel I've stayed at. Didn't have a chance to try the Starbucks in the lobby, but I enjoyed the sumptuous and moderately-priced (by hotel standards) breakfast in the dining room. Just two minor disappointments: the gift shop did not sell any magazines and there weren't enough computer terminals for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella_gal
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Sofitel Miami, and it is great for an overnight between flights. The rooms are lovely and very comfortable. There was a small glitch when we stayed at the beginning of our trip in March, but we talked to the front desk upon our checkout and when we returned in April, everything went flawlessly. The restaurant is excellent, although not cheap. We were also pleased that complimentary internet is available at four computers off the lounge/bar area. Rather than vending machines, one can purchase sodas etc. in the small coffee bar/sundries shop off the lobby. All in all, we will definitely stay here when between flights in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Always Love It !”
Reviews.Author: PremiereTraveller
Reviews.Content: Enjoy it always.. good rooms and beds to get you a good nights rest... Food is great at the restaurant or in room dining.. but dont expect much out of the restaurant service.. they seem to have too much of an attitude problem. I have been staying here for too many years and have had this age old experience...which doesnt seem to improve

Reviews.Title: “Terrible overrated hotel! Look for other options.”
Reviews.Author: Michigan2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel in February for an overnight stay before our cruise. We made the reservation on Priceline and paid $165 for a one night stay. We reached the hotel around 1 am on April 5th and we were told that our room wasn't ready. There were a few other families with young children waiting in the lobby for their rooms with us. We were told by the manager that they were having some trouble with the housekeeping staff and that the room will be ready in about 15 minutes. After waiting for one hour we were given the room key around 2 am. We asked for a room with double beds, but we ended up in a room with a king bed and a rollaway bed. We called the manager about it and he told us that they could not guarantee the type of room when you make a reservation with them. We were so exhausted that we didn't do anything about it. The manager gave us a voucher for breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel to make up for all the inconvenience. We ate breakfast at the restaurant and left the hotel the next morning for our cruise. We thought that would be the end of our experience with Sofitel but I checked my credit card statement today and found out that the hotel charged us for the "free breakfast" that was offered to us as compensation for the inconvenience caused by them. I will never stay at any Sofitel again. This was probably the worst experience we have had at any hotel. The hotel itself is in a good location near the airport, but the rooms are small and the bathroom was not even cleaned properly after the previous guests. You will be better off paying a little extra to stay in a hotel that actually cares about their reputation.

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: rondakar
Reviews.Content: Hotel does not have coffee maker or vendingmachines also without transportation there is only the restaurant in hotel prices starting from 16.00 to 48.00 too expensive for someone on vacation. Old hotel trying to look like luxury hotel and not suceeding.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for airport”
Reviews.Author: MeggTravellers
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay here, we usually stay the 1night before we fly out the next morning on our early flights. The airport shuttle very convienient both picking up at the airport and taking you to the airport. Only takes a 5-10min ride and you don't have to wait to long either side for a pick-up. Rooms very spacious, furniture a little worn but clean and tidy. Have eaten in the restaurant......very good pizza and great steak! Yes at an airport hotel ! Staff very friendly and prompt to assist when needed. Will be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Dooped!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ZAYJacksonHole
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because they rated themselves as a four star property. This might have been true in the sixties but not now. The room we had booked was supposed to be a non smoking room but when we entered the room there was a discusting stale smoke smell in the room. After we complained, they switched my room. The new room did not smell but left a little to be desired. We have stayed in better two star properties than this. The carpet, Furniture, and the decor is badly dated and evrything is overpriced. I would not have willingly paid $50.00 for this room.Unfortunately, our room was prepaid so we had to stay the night The best part of the stay was the pizza I ordered from Pizza Hut for dinner. I for one will be staying away from this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: SJSlesnick
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Hotel Sofitel in Miami and am never disappointed staying here. My fiance and I traveled with our wedding party (30+ guests) and this hotel (especially the concierge - Andres) were beyond accomodating. First, we booked the group rates so long ago, that once we realized the rates had dropped the week before the event, the hotel had no problems meeting the lower rate, saving all guests $50+ a night, depite a previous contract. We planned a girl's day out to a local salon and the hotel took six of us by shuttle, for free, to a local salon for drop off and pick up, keeping us from having to rent a car. They also have great free shuttles to and from the airport. We also planned a rehearsal dinner at a nearby restaurant, and again, the hotel took all guests (over 30) by shuttle, for free, when we had been quoted elsewhere for over $300. They upgraded our room and my parent's room to suites at no additional charge and at their own discretion. They keep all their rooms clean with the absolute most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. The pool area is beautiful, but unfortunately we did not have the best pool weather to swim, but laying out was great. They have a beautiful bar area that is a great central meeting point and fun atmosphere for the after dinner drink. They also have four computers with free internet access and a free printer that always worked. Their staff is above and beyond and they treat every guest as a VIP. They shuttle you to local areas/malls, etc., without a charge. And they never make you wait. We shipped a bunch of wedding stuff ahead of time and they safely held on to our goods and had it delivered to our room within minutes of getting settled. I would only stay at this hotel... and after having traveled the world and stayed in Four Seasons and Ritz Carltons, etc., this is a great bargain hotel with beautiful facilties and the nicest staff possible.

Reviews.Title: “The most confortable bed where you 've ever slept...”
Reviews.Author: JonJack
Reviews.Content: Being this hotel near the airport, it is ok if you don't need to see only South Beach. A rent a car is a must have, as the only public transport you have is a bus which goes around the airport towards the Dolphin Mall, which is close-by. It is to recommend also if you have a short layover in Miami as they provide a free shuttle to and from the Terminal building. Free internet only on the PCs in the lobby which are a little bit too slow, the swimming pool was ok although we didn't have the chance to enjoy it due to the weather. Parking costs 8$ a day which is not bad for Miami. It's a shame that there was no coffee machine or safe in the room, we were expecting them....but great bed, soft confy and a real nest.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, gone bad.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRBurton
Reviews.Content: Have you ever seen "Somewhere In Time" and wondered what it would be like to stay in a hotel that used to be beautiful, but now was messy and unkempt, well Sofitel was exactly that. The building is beautiful, from the front entry, the elevators, the entrance doors and fixtures are all just lovely. The rooms have a great design, expensive furniture and crown mouldings. But the hotel is a mess. Under the beds aren't vacummed, the bedskirts are sloppy and unironed, the beds are the messiest made I have ever seen, the curtains were stained. We asked for an extra blanket and it had a stain on it the size of my hand. The ledge outside the window was covered in bird droppings. The beds only have a bottom sheet and a duvet cover. Hotel managment clearly just doesn't care anymore. Parking cost an extra $8, internet (not wireless) cost $10 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Ok Hotel near to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Wadhams
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night stopover while transiting Miami Aiport. For that purpose the hotel is perfectly OK for us and had everything we wanted. Booking was easy and reception were very quick and friendly on arrival. Our room was the usual boxy style of a modern hotel with a large bed and good toilet facilities. We slept well and were not disturbed by any noise from inside or outside the hotel. The hallways and other public areas were all clean and of good appearance. The bar and restaurant were well staffed and nice places to sit and relax with a bar meal and beer before bed. The food was fine and reasonably priced and they have draft Stella Artois beer. The pool area overlooks the lagoon and is a pleasant place to relax bearing in mind the location of the hotel. We used the gym facilities (which are open 24/7) in early morning and then jogged around the local area which was runner friendly with paving and the lagoon to give a cool breeze. Breakfast was very good and nicely cooked. Checkout was simple, no errors made with food and drink bills and very quick again. All the staff in this hotel were very friendly and helpful to us and we enjoyed our night there. The free shuttle bus got us back to the airport on time. I would stay here every time for one night if transiting the airport or to somewhere else in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pay4netfd
Reviews.Content: From the moment I enter the hotel you get the feeling you are the most important guest. You are greeted at the door by friendly bellmen and continous through to the front desk area. They are professional and courteous. They can't seem to do enough to make you comfortable and welcomed. Room service was great also... The hotel was spotless and the rooms were spacious and clean as well. I highly recommended ...

Reviews.Title: “Do Yourself a Favor, Don't Bother With This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: APR73
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read a few of the negative views on this hotel before I booked my Valentine's Day stay. I had a one night lay over in Miami with my girlfriend, it was close to the airport and the photos on their website show it to be a beautiful hotel. But let me tell you, this hotel was way over priced and in no way lived up to the photos they post on their website. In fact, the photos on their website, especially where the rooms are concerned, are outrageously misleading, bordering on fraud. Yes the restaurant, bar and lobby are well kept, but that is obviously in the hook to get you in the door. Beyond the first two floors, I have a hard time finding one redeeming quality. The rooms are old and outdated from the rugs to the walls to the furniture and don't get me started on the musty smell that pervades the hallways and the guest rooms themselves. Trust me I tried two different rooms and the musty smell in both was terrible. I stayed in a $400 a night suite that reminded me of a cheap motel on the highway in the middle of nowhere! Please take my advice, if you want a nice clean room that doesn't remind you of a seedy motel, find another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport but far from everything else.”
Reviews.Author: culak6
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a cruise. If you want somewhere close to the port, this is not your place! It is super close to MIA Airport, but we had to rent a car to get downtown or to South Beach (or the port). The staff was very helpful and nice. We didn't like the rooms or lobby, but thought the $99 price was good.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: nicknick38
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Saturday afternoon for a 1 night stay. The first problem right off the bat, there was no doorman to assist me with my bags or to open the door to the hotel. I had to put my bags down, pull the door towards me, and enter the hotel. He was talking to a girl in the gift shop. I checked in. That was ok, very fast. Ran out to my car again, and it was the same thing. No doorman to greet or assist. Now he was gossiping with the concierge. The upgraded room, which was $289, and an additonal $10.00 for Internet, was small, outdated. The 22" TV didn't work. For what I was paying, I was expecting a large flat screen, something modern, as you seem to find in most hotels today. The couch had stains. There were M&M's under the bed and Dorito crumbs under the love seat. In other words, the room wasn't clean. When you shut the bedroom door, you have to hold back the curtains, as they obstruct you from closing the door completey. At 11:30 that night, housekeeping had to bring me up sheets as there weren't any on the bed. I called down stairs to ask about soda, vending machines. I was told on every floor there were ice machines, but no soda or vending machines. Wrong. Most of the floors don't have ice machines and those that do, they don't work. If you want ice, you have to go to the downstairs bar. If you want a bottle of water, you'll pay $7.00. If you want a tiny bottle of free water, you have to track down the concierge, who's usually talking to the doorman, and when you do get it's at best, room temp. Two small bottles of diet coke cost me $9.00. The bathroom floor had hair on it. I stayed there 5 days ago. My final charges were $333.00. But they charged $333.00, $339.00 and $339.47 to my card. I am still trying to get them to fix this. When I call the hotel and ask for accounting, all I get is a voice mail. Yesterday the desk manager told me that somebody would call me by days end. That never happened. For the money, you can find much better than this, go else where. Get a clean, modern room that provides the basic amenities and services you would expect from any hotel. The Sofitel, although it does look nice, is not worth the money and aggravation. All I want now is for them to reverse the $678 in overcharges to my credit card. Nick

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel in Miami (MIA)”
Reviews.Author: Laura P
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is French style hotel located at Miami International airport. Rooms are comfortable, spaceous and clean, equipped with tv, hair dryer and iron. Hotel is also reasonable priced and staff is friendly. Unlike many other hotels, Sofitel also offers breakfast in their own restaurant. Sofitel also has a private pool. Sofitel has great location for people who want to rent a car (which we recommend in Miami - public transport network is not so covering). Computers with Internet access is provided for free at the lobby, with a printing option.

Reviews.Title: “3 *** at best”
Reviews.Author: ChipLondon
Reviews.Content: Do not be mislead by the good photgraphs shown for this hotel, yes the reception and bar areas are pleasent, the actual main hotel areas are very tired and dated. The corridor areas are run down and similar to a cheap motel, the rooms do have fancy mirrors in the bathrooms but that is all, the tiled areas are so dated and dirty, no mini bar, even no safe in the room, just security boxes in reception. The pool area looks great in the photos but in mainly in the shade, and not an appealing area at all. There was no luggage assistance on arrival, and the entrance doors really dirty, this hotel needs better management and a good clean, Overall a dissappointing stay, there is much better available nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: youngtraveldude
Reviews.Content: Had an extra night in Miami, as I was transiting through, went on the internet and got a good deal for one night at this hotel. I was tired from a day of long travel, so I basically just grabbed the hotel shuttle from the airport, checked in at the front desk reception (exceedingly friendly), ordered a pizza, and went to bed. Didn't get time to really look around the hotel, although everything I experienced was very satisfactory, nice and clean. I did notice when I walked in, certain parts of my room looked a bit worn..but very minor..overall nice and comfy. As many of you know, when traveling on business and staying at an airport hotel for one night, the MOST important thing to us is a comfortable, luxorious bed. On a scale of 1 to 10, I would rate the bed about a 7. Very Good. Slept well, and caught the 5:30am hotel shuttle to the airport the next morning. Keep in mind the shuttle leaves precisely every 30 minutes, so it may be good to be 5 - 7 minutes early if catching the shuttle. Again, good experience at Sofitel Miami and a very friendly front desk staff! Any further questions, just write me... ccharles2321@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Roach Motel!”
Reviews.Author: Messa_Mel
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely appalled that this hotel received 4 out of 5 points on Trip Advisor and am unsure if I will trust the reviews I read here again. I have nothing bad to say about the management or the staff at this hotel, they handled all of my concerns immediately, and acted as a staff at what I assumed was a quality hotel should act. However, the quality of this hotel was awful. From the moment we arrived: I was shocked that you had to pay for parking when all the hotels in the area do not require this, the carpet and furniture appear to have not been updated since the 80's, and a very stupid design of the door-stop being directly center of the closet made it hard for me to walk on my first day of vacation. Not to mention the fact that we found, not one, but TWO COCKROACHES in our suite. If you need to stay near the airport check out the Hilton Homewood Suites, that's where we stayed the day before, the service was great, the furniture and amenities were all updated, there was free parking AND it was cheaper than the Sofitel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good all round”
Reviews.Author: Nonhairybiker
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night pre cruise. Mainly because we were tired, but also because the airport courtesy phone (only to this hotel) was out of order, we took a ten minute $14 taxi ride. The hotel, despite being in an office block commercial area is quite impressive with a nice lobby and the general areas, particularly the bar, where we had a decent snack and the restaurant where we breakfasted were very nice. Pool area was also well kept with an unusual waterfall feature. All of the staff we met were pleasant and very helpful, the concierge arranged a cruiseport shuttle bus for us at $10 per head, but be aware a cab should only be $24 anyway. The corridors and rooms were disappointing. Everywhere was very clean but with obvious signs of wear and tear. Airport noise was just loud enough to be annoying even although our room was on the opposite side. View of the lagoon was nice but a new building was going up next door. There is nowhere else within walking distance to eat, but there is a small shopping centre about four blocks away. I would'nt discourage anyone to stay here but I expect there is better to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Bed from Heaven!”
Reviews.Author: Piolina
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and hip hotel and it's close to the airport, which has its advantages and disadvantages. The rooms are spacious and well appointed, everything is clean and the maid service really pays attention to details (such as replenishing toilettries and decorating the tissue box). The swimming pool area is well-kept and the waterfall is a definite plus. The bar has great cocktails, always served with a smile and a variety of snacks, which is a nice touch. But the highlight of my stay was the bed, probably the most comfortable I have ever seen. The combination of down comforter, pillows and featherbed was just heavenly. I highly recommend the hotel for anyone who needs to stay near the airport. It is not convenient for the beach area though. Other minuses were the fact that you can hear the airplanes land and take off (yes, the windows will vibrate), and the lack of free wireless internet although they have computers next to the bar that you can use at no charge. They also charge for parking but if you don't have a car they offer a free shuttle to/from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Averbuch
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe, friendly staff, very good location for shopping (easy access to main roads on the way to the best malls and even in the neighborhood), good parking. If you don't need to go to downtown it's a very good place to stay. The only problem was with the tap of the tub which was not working well and I had to ask three times to be fixed and finally get to use the shower comfortably. The price was excellent, considering the category of the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jackiecroft
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel ideal for the airport, being fairly close by shuttle service. The room was spacious and very clean and although typically furnished, it is quiet which is very important especially so close to an airport. Breakfast was good and hot and served quickly as we has an early fllight to catch. Check-in was very effecient with a porter bring up our luggage. I did feel that the bar was slightly overpriced, but being a captive audience, I suppose you expect this sort of thing. For an overnight stay to catch an early flight, I would definitly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good Airpirt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WWHITE1967
Reviews.Content: One of the better Airport hotels Enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cadigirl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently spent one night here & it is a beautiful hotel. We were in Miami the night before we left for a cruise. The hotel is 5-10 min from the airport and they run a shuttle from airport to hotel, which was very convenient. The concierge set us up with a shuttle from the hotel to the cruise ship pier which worked out very well. The property is beautiful and the staff was extremely nice & helpful. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, good rooms, good choice”
Reviews.Author: Lucas5915
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Hotels.com and got a $85 rate. We arrived at 1 am (after missing a flight), and the clerck was very helpful: he gave us a topfloor suite, an extra late check-out (2 pm!) without charges. The beds were probably the best I've ever slept in! What a great night after a horrible day of travelling. WiFi was not free, but there are 3 or 4 computers in the lobby. Free to use and with a working printer. In-house Starbucks is great, so is the guarded parking in front of the hotel and the free shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: mac7899
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, having just flown into Miami and before driving to the Keys the next day. The staff were helpful, friendly and efficient and we were given a free upgrade. Our suite was clean and nicely decorated. The bed and specially the pillows were so comfy that we wished we could have stayed longer! Breakfast was very nice and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: jesmorgan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sofitel Miami on 8/3/08 after returning from Costa Rica. I had booked a standard room through Expedia and paid about $120. I arrived after midnight and was picked up by the hotel shuttle. The driver was friendly and the hotel was just a short drive away. Upon check in, I was greeted and my reservation was accurate. I was worried with my late arrival that they may not hold the room, but not only was my room ready, they upgraded me to a suite! Having waked at 5am to visit a volcano, I was totally exhausted and the upgrade was a very nice treat. I took a long shower and used all of the spa products in the room (robe, slippers, loofa). The room itself was lovely and I wish I had more than just 10 hours to enjoy it. Most important, it was spotlessly clean. The suite had a living room, dining room (seating for 8) and kitchen. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have found in a hotel. It had a feather bed with many feather pillows and down comforter. The bath products were of good quality. Overall, the room was perfect. There is nothing I can think of that I would change. The next morning I had breakfast in the hotelâ€™s French restaurant. The omelet and potatoes were good, not excellent. The staff were very friendly and attentive. The prices were a few dollars more than one would expect to pay, but not unreasonable. The concierge was very willing to help me print my boarding pass, although something was wrong with the website. He was professional and friendly and very apologetic that he could not print the pass. The bus driver who took me back to the airport was pleasant and assisted me with my baggage. Overall, it was a wonderful stay, albeit a short one. I would definitely recommend the Sofitel Miami to anyone. Book it through Expedia to get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Rangzen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night. The hotel is very nice; staff were very friendly and helpful. The bedrooms are very nice and one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in. Starbucks in the Lobby was handy for Jet Lag recovery. There is a complementary shuttle to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Not all that”
Reviews.Author: LisaFromTO
Reviews.Content: I know this review is a bit late, but thought I'd give my two cents anyways. My sister booked 3 rooms at the Sofitel via Priceline. Reading the reviews/pictures, the hotel looked nice. We got the price of $120/night for each room. We were on a family cruise and the Sofitel was our post cruise hotel. It was a convenient location, free shuttle to the airport. the next morning for our flight back home. We got off the cruise ship and headed to the hotel in our rental car. The first thing we noticed was that you had to pay for parking! I did not think that was necessary in a hotel where there wasn't much around anyways, mostly office buildings and parking did not look like it was at a premium. We were early checking in and wanted to drop our bags off first because we were planning on spending our day at Sawgrass Outlet Mall (which is amazing!). It was around 12 and no rooms were available so we put all of our luggage/bags on one cart and asked the bellhop to store our stuff and when our room was ready, just to put all of the luggage/bags into one room and we would deal with it when we got back. We did tip him and he did put all of our stuff in one room which was great. We shopped all day and by the time we got back at the hotel after dinner, it was late. We decided to return the rental car instead and that way we did not have to pay for the parking. We were all so tired by the end of this and we still had to pack/re-arrange our luggage to make room for our purchases from Sawgrass. When I walked into the room, what a surprise. The room looked very old/worn, nothing like the pictures! The red door to our room looked like it was from the beginning of time! The carpet looked gross and dirty, the walls needed a paint job, the washroom did not even look that clean! There was actually a used q-tip on the floor under the sink! My brother took a shower and he said there was no water pressure and it was not draining properly, he was in 3inches of water while showering! I did not bother to even shower. We had 2 queen beds that looked very nice, presentation wise. I was looking so forward to just getting some sleep but it was the worst bed I have ever slept in! It must have been 20 years old! I was afraid to pull the beds sheets off the bed just to look at the mattress. It was so soft/un-supporting that I just sunk in. I woke-up with a sore back of course. I would not recommend this hotel, I think you would be better off at the Hampton Inn where you even get breakfast included with your stay. I was on the 9th floor, first room on the right - so if you get that room, try and switch!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best we've been to....!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hillary1Connecticut
Reviews.Content: We were so overwhelmed by how good this hotel was that we are still talking about it. Great room with a fabulous bed we did not want to leave. We never saw a maid or cart in the hall, yet all was always perfect and clean. The staff above all were superlative. Each and every one was more than friendly and helpful. And the food, for fussy world travelers, was really delicious and beautifully presented. This hotel is way superior to most Miami Beach hotels and if you have a car the 15 minute ride to the beach is not bad. Besides, there is a fun pool at the hotel with a gigantic waterfall so you always hear the wooosh of water.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Brooke36
Reviews.Content: We were only here for one night on our way back from Costa Rica and REALLY wanted some authentic Cuban food. The staff was great and gave us directions to the greatest Cuban place and then directions from there to South Beach. They even highlighted the route on a map for us. Sounds like a little thing to do, but it seems hard to get anyone to do anything for hotel guests anymore. The room was very nice and the bed was so soft (especially compared to the ones we had been sleeping in during our Costa Rica trip). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you want to be close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: henryglynn
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel with a nice bar area, free internet access, lovely pool and friendly staff. Only issue is that it is quiet a distance from south beach and the main tourist areas (30 dollars in a taxi). But overall this is a good airport hotel and would defo reccomend it

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant staff and very nice”
Reviews.Author: Petalpalz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are very pleased with this lovely hotel. We were greeted warmly, even though we booked through a discount travel agency. Our room is large, king size bed and non smoking. The hotel has all the amenities we could want. (does not have a fridge, but we didn't need one, nor want one). I suppose a person could find minor flaws in the rooms, but really, they are minor!! Our room is immaculately clean. The bed is comfortable and cozy. The onsite restaurant is expensive and there isn't much within walking distance (so far I haven't found anything, but I'm still looking). We'll probably have dinner here. There is a lovely lagoon behind the hotel which can be seen from some of the rooms, I'm sure, but we have a "front of the hotel" view. The pool is really pretty and convenient. Exercise room is around the corner from the pool. Starbucks (mini) on site. They don't have the skinny latte's, which I generally get, but you can still order non fat latte's. (same thing without the SF syrups) We are staying one night at the end of a cruise with NCL. and paid $12 each for a shuttle from the port to the hotel door. Parking is an additional fee, I believe $8 if you have an auto. For the price we paid, ($119, $138 after taxes and resort fees) we think we got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ERetreats
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel. They added a lot of nice touches, such as the paintings on the walls and sculptures in the lobby. The pool was nice and clean, as well. You could tell in some places that the hotel had been renovated, but they did a good job. The only problem I found was with the cleanliness. The first room we stayed in was leaking water in the ceiling. It was raining in Miami. The toilet in that room was also not clean. The good thing is, before we could call the front desk to complain, the bellman had already told the front desk what happened and they called me and offered us an upgrade. That was good. In the new room, one of the beds had crumbs in it. When I called housekeeping to ask them to change the bed, they never showed up. We were late for dinner, so we left and came back later that night. When we got back, I called housekeeping again and the night shift was great! They came right away and changed the bed and even redid the bathroom and touched up the entire room. They were also very nice about it. I'm a travel agent and I got a good deal on the room at $199 a night. All in all, it was nice for a night and the staff were very nice and hardworking, except the day housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not as appears”
Reviews.Author: mbe62
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel would be convenient to the airport and looked exceptionally nice. We were kind of surprised to find that it was a longer drive than expected to the airport.
