It was situated near a runway however, and we heard planes landing all night long! Also, the photos on the site made it look MUCH nicer than the rooms actually were. Some have been fixed up and some have not. We got a "have not" room and it was pretty bad. There were hairs on the bathroom floors, beat up tiles, chipping counter tops, dirty carpets, etc. Yet it was $250 a night! What a rip-off. I would have left if we hadn't checked in so late. We complained in the morning and they immediately gave us $50 off room price. It was as if they are used to the complaints and have a policy in place to discount your room price by $50. I would not stay here again, no matter how close to the airport!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: QueenMimi
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through Trip Advisor and booked it through Travelocity. It is very difficult to get a hotel in the Miami area at this time of year for just one night. We were leaving on a cruise on the next day. A hotel shuttle circles through the Miami airport every half hour. you just go out and wave it down. There is no charge for this service. While you are close to the airport, the rooms are very quiet. We got in early enough to use the pool area (where you sometimes did hear jets). Check in was quite easy, however I had to tell the receptionist that I was a Sofitel preferred guest. She did not see this on the reservation, even though I had specifically called the hotel with my guest number. She asked me for my number, which I happened to have on me. While I was getting it out, she found it on the original reservation. This entitled us to a free drink at the bar (quite delicious in a very nice setting). She also gave us a cork to use for a free glass of wine with a food order. We did have lunch in the restaurant. It was rather pricey, but it was convenient and quite good. The room was nice, much like the pictures on the website. The bed was quite comfortable. However, in a few areas, the wallpaper was beginning to peel away from the wall. The bathroom was very clean. Toiletries were from France. We took a cab from the hotel into South Beach. It was rather expensive. I think it was about $40 or $50, one way. The concierge told us that a shuttle to the port was available on the hour in the morning. he put our name of the list. Cost was $10 per person. It was there promptly at 12:00 p.m. Check out was easy and the bill was accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf”
Reviews.Author: DanCalgaryAB.
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel for one night pre cruise. This hotel is first class all the way. We were picked up at the airport by the hotel shuttle (that serves you cold bottled water) from a pleasant and helpful driver. The check in was quick and courteous from classy uniformed staff. The room was very comfortable, probably the best sleep ever. None of us wanted to get out of bed. The bar / common lounge allowed the entire family to sit and enjoy a drink and some appies prior to the excellent dinner we enjoyed. It would be nice if the pool was heated, but this wasn't a big deal. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and good value”
Reviews.Author: Bergkamp9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night as it's very close to the airport and we had an early departure. It's only a 5 min drive from the airport but you don't hear much plane noise. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The room was a good size although the bathroom was slightly smaller than expected. The main point is that everything is spotlessly clean and very comfortable. A couple of things were missing though - no safe and minibar which I expect as standard in this class of hotel. We arrived quite late and didn't wander around the area but there is a tiny shop in the lobby for small items such as bottled water and crisps/chips. No complaints about the food as both room service and breakfast was good and reasonable value too. Strongly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Below Sofitel Standards, but Still Good”
Reviews.Author: mahme
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel Miami is located just 5 minutes by car from the Miami Airport. Half the rooms offer a nice view of the lagoon. The rooms are very spacious and feature the usual Sofitel bed (my favorite). The bathrrom were OK, but felt more like those you'd expect from a Hilton or a Marriott. Those driving will find the parking lot in front of the hotel very convenient. You do howeever need to pay before exiting (like in any parking lot). The room service food I had was excellent and prepared on time. I enjoyed the outdoor pool as the gym is also convenient. The shortcomings of the hotel were the lack of minibars in the room, the Marriott/Hilton style bathrroms and the fact that ice cream (in room-service) was only available in pints (Ben & Jerry's). Also, I wanted a pair of slippers (not already in the room) to go to the swimming pool but getting the message across to the spanish-speaking maids proved VERY difficult. The staff was very friendly and helpful during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alifetimeofwaiting
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Miami for one night pre-cruise, and for one day (day room use) post cruise. I loved this hotel. On arrival at the hotel, we were checked in and in a lift up to our room literally within 5 minutes of walking through the front door! The check in agent was friendly and helpful, and the whole process trouble free. The room was lovely. There were two double beds, with really comfy matress toppers and lovely fluffy pillows. The TV had loads of channels, and there was a massive wardrobe with plenty of coathangers (although I didn't use this as only overnight). There was also a chez longe (no, I have no idea how to spell that), and a large desk and chair, with stationery. The bathroom was really clean, and quite luxurious. The water pressure and temperature was perfect for showering, and there were lovely toiletries and shoe shines. The rooms were nice and quiet, and I heard no traffic or airport noise. The bar was well stocked, and the bar staff friendly. In the bar area there were 5 (I think) computers with internet access, totally free to use. These kept the kids occupied while we had a drink. There is an outside pool, although I would never have gone in it because it was quite cold, the kids, who don't feel the cold, were in like a shot! There were tables and chairs, and sun loungers around the pool, and pool towels provided. The hotel has a free shuttle bus between the airport and hotel. Stand outside airport arrivals, and when you see a bus with Sofitel Miami on it, hail it down and jump in. The transfer took us about 10 minutes. When you want to get back to the airport, just wait outside the lobby and jump in the next bus. It's all very easy, and free. Overall, I loved this hotel, and if I ever need an overnight at Miami airport again, I will definately choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stopover”
Reviews.Author: chip1784
Reviews.Content: Having one night stopover in miami between flights it could not of worked better. Arrived at miami airport with no hotel booked and rang the sofitel from an ad at airport .The hotel told us to get on the sofitel bus which leave regulary from airport which turned up virtually straight away. The lobby and bar areas look fantastic with a stunning swimming pool directly outside. The beds were extremely comfortable and rooms a nice size with a great lake view. This is a 4 star hotel and a good one at that. Probably not a holiday hotel as it is not to close to beaches but very good value for what we paid i would definately stay here again in simular circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Found a great deal at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Links13
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for one night before our cruise departed the Miami port for the Bahamas. I found a deal online through hotels.com for $100/night. We had a corner room that was very quiet. The bedding was sublime! We were very pleased with the room layout and cleanliness. We both also liked the art deco look of the hotel. Our luggage was delayed so we made terrific use of the free shuttle to and from the airport to pick up our bags once they arrived. The concierge was very helpful and helped us book a shuttle to the port for the next day. I made use of the gym facilities which were adequate with the bonus of fresh fruit (apples/bananas) available for free. We also spent time in the pool. In truth, the pool could have been cleaner and the "waterfall" looked as though it hadn't run for a very long time, but we enjoyed the view from the pool to the ocean. The most memorable moment would have to be breakfast poolside. The kitchen was kind enough to deliver it to us as we swam. We enjoyed a variety of fresh fruits, croissants, and juices while soaking up the Miami sunshine. It was divine and their willingness to serve was appreciated! All in all, we had a terrific stay and enjoyed the superior service, the spacious and clean room, the hotel facilities, and the very affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you get it at a discount”
Reviews.Author: Mary Lykes
Reviews.Content: I had signed up for the Sofitel Priviledge program hoping that it would be the start of a beautiful relationship, but such was not the case. Arrived at 1:30 in the morning, which meant that I had missed the last airport shuttle and had to pay $15 for a cab. My request for reimbursement was met with a Gallic shrug. There was no indication that my room had been upgraded and no so-called welcoming gift. The sour faced bartender tried to cheat me by charging half price for the guaranteed free glass of wine. There were a few things that I liked: the free internet in the lobby, the quietness considering its proximity to the airport, the comfortable bed, the $10 per person shuttle to the Port of Miami and the relatively easy walk to nearby shopping, pharmacy, restaurants and manicure/pedicure. All in all, it was not too bad an experience and I would probably stay at this hotel again, but only if I got a steeply discounted rate through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: jockSansepolcroItaly
Reviews.Content: Sofitel is 5 minutes from the airport and we used it as a stop over prior to our flight home after a cruise. The hotel is clean and tidy and good value for money, the restaurant is pricy but the food was off a high standard The rooms wer large but basic, no fridge, tea making . The area around the hotel has no facilities so if you require food or drinks etc you are tied to the hotel which has a Starbucks but this is only open at certain times. The shuttle service is free and is very good.Would stay here again if i only needed to sleep and it was one night

Reviews.Title: “Can recommend the Sofitel Airport Miami”
Reviews.Author: skeelan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel from speedy check-in onwards. Only 5-10 minutes walk to local shops including Publix (open Sunday), restaurants and RC church. Rooms were clean ,comfortable and quiet, breakfast buffet good, staff helpful, pool area clean and uncrowded with lovely view of the lagoon. We didn't find the 24 hour hotel cafe until the following morning - not realising you have to walk through the restaurant to get there. Maybe it should be signposted? My only other adverse comment would be that the airport shuttle bus filled very quickly on Sat evening - we were lucky, but others at the second terminal were left behind. Still, at the price we paid on Hotwire I'd be more than happy to take a cab. I'd stay here again and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “So-So At the Sofitel Miami”
Reviews.Author: Tashatart
Reviews.Content: Not exactly what you would expect from the Sofitel brand. Two strange things: there was no sheet under the bed cover and our Christmas presents were unwrapped by housekeeping! They didn't take anything, but you could clearly tell that they tried to re-wrap it but they did such a poor job that it was obvious! I don't know about you, but I leave my luggage in the room with the belief that they will be safe - not rummaged through! The staff, other than the peeking into gifts, were very nice - the concierge was especially helpful and nice (I called three times for directions and he was more than helpful, he even offered to stay on the phone to help me find the exit). Other than that, I was disappointed. The hotel was dull, there were cobwebs (with spiders) in the walkway to the room, it was quite shabby on the outside and there was no coffeepot in the room. It was, however, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are old”
Reviews.Author: singletrvl
Reviews.Content: Just got back from early Dec Stay. The pool was nice. Rooms are old and carpet had stains... Not 4 star... The walls are paper thin and did not sleep well at night. Bed were just OK for me.

Reviews.Title: “A fab hotel. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: PussUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel is bright and the decor very modern. It was extremely clean and the beds were really comfortable. It has excellent food and the staff are really helpful and attentive. Although It's close to the airport you couldn't hear it during the night. I thoroughly recommend this one for either holidays or just a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel noy up to standards”
Reviews.Author: KEITH TRAVEL AGENT
Reviews.Content: As you may see in my previous reviews, I am not a moaner and all of my hotel stays have been good to perfect, but I must admit that this one is a NO NO!!We stayed at the Sofitel in Miami because we thought that "Sofitel" was a luxurious brand name. What a mistake concerning Miami. It is run down and needs a BIG renovation. Our room (502) on the fifth floor had views of the restaurant extractors which made a lot of noise during the night. (more than the planes opposite taking off and arriving at the airport!!). The rooms are describes as French chic (I live in France) Ours was cheap looking with stained carpet. They have NO safe, NO tea & coffee, NO minibar, NO fridge. The dirty windows looked on to a small balcony which was closed as there were 2 rusty unused air conditioning machines (or some sort of machines) lying on the floor in abandon. The drapes didn't close properly, and the toilet dripped all night long. All this for a "chic" hotel. I would have prefered to stay in a cheaper hotel nearer the city center or even next door at one of the other airport hotels. There is also NO valet service for the car park. I will not go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a Valued Guest”
Reviews.Author: JulieQUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sofitel Miami airport pre cruise 3rd Nov 2007 this was recommened to us by our travel agent. From being picked up at the airport Saturday afternoon to checking out Sunday lunch time staff could not do enough for us to make our stay feel special. On arrival they apologised our room was not ready so they gave us a drinks voucher for the bar and looked after our luggage. We did not make it to the bar before a staff member advised us the room was ready and our luggage was on its way. Later in the evening we went down to the bar to use our drinks vouchers. Even though there was a wedding party in the bar area the bar tender acknowledged us and we were served very quickly. Another staff member found us a seat in the bar area and took our food order. I know it was only burger , fries cheesecake and coffee. But either it was the long flight from the UK or one of the best bar meals we have ever had,service was 1st class. Our room was very quiet and the bed was just heaven in the morning we had breakfast really good value. Hotel arranged for transport to the cruise port checkout smooth and they wished us a happy cruise. We will use this hotel next time we are in Miami and recommend it to our friends on cruise critic web site.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Sofitel.......hated the inflated prices for food”
Reviews.Author: LizzieBenet
Reviews.Content: November 9, 2007 We stayed at the Sofitel for one night prior to our cruise. Things started off rocky when we waited for over 20 minutes for the complimentary shuttle to the hotel. Why it took over 20 minutes for the shuttle seemed ridiculous since the hotel is approximately 1.5 miles from the airport. I thought the hotel was very nice and everyone we encountered was very nice and helpful. We had a room with two beds since there were three of us. I thought the room was very nice and the beds and bedding were wonderful. I will say that the bathroom could use a little sprucing up.......the white ceramic tile has seen better days. I did however like the complimentary toiletries. With the exception of some fast food places there aren't many places to eat that don't require a minimum taxi ride of $15 each way. We did walk to Walgreens to pick up some last minute items for the cruise. My biggest gripe was that the prices to eat at the hotel were outrageous...............$8 for a bowl of french onion soup, entrees at the restaurant were $25 and above. We ended up ordering room service for dinner which cost approximately $35 since by the time we took a taxi ride for $30 and then you add dinner on top of that. The food was good though. We also ate at the hotel for breakfast for convenience and the bill came to $55 for three people. I had a bowl of oatmeal that was $7and my husband and son had the all you can eat breakfast buffet. I think you can do the math. I

Reviews.Title: “Simply....... WOW”
Reviews.Author: EMTSupergirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply beautiful. When we arrived, my husband was like, "WOW this is our hotel????" and thought I paid much more than I actually did. The service was great, every one was very friendly and kind. Unfortunately we didn't get there until like 9:30pm or so, and were unable to enjoy some of the things the hotel has to offer, but still enjoyed our stay. The room was beautiful and very comfortable. I am in LOVE with the down comforter they have. We had a king room booked I believe, but they were out so they gave us a 2 queen with a lagoon view, so that was fine with me. The only thing that was not up to standards was the pool water was very cold. I don't know if it was because it was late and it had been storming the past few days, or if they keep it that cold. We couldn't really enjoy the pool too much. The breakfast was very expensive; I had expected the restraunts to be that way but wow! I absolutely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again; I just wouldn't eat there :)

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: JadepearlToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for a business meeting. It was a very nice stay, very close to airport, food was good, nice room, but appeared a little dated, nice restaurant and meeting rooms. Shuttle bus available for Dolphin Mall for only $5 return which was a great deal vs taxi of $25 each way. Concierge very helpful in choosing restaurants, securing taxi and also giving me bottles of water. Fitness centre equipment was excellent and well maintained although not air conditioned which was uncomfortable. The pool also nice with a good view. Only complaint, was that one break period, lots of ants over our food. But it seemed to be solved for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Good - But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: af847
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, lobby and check-in pretty good and bed was very comfy. Pleasant surroundings overall. However - the walls are very thin. I could hear everything in the hallway. When soors slammed, my bed shook. And yes, you are at the airport. So you will hear the occasional plane rumbling nearby. The location is pretty good. I'd give this place about a B.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jesterinoz
Reviews.Content: Travelling to Miami for work, practicality usually wins over and I end up staying near in the Airport vicinity. However, the Sofitel makes up for this in leaps and bounds. It is in a standalone building with a large carpark and easy access. The rooms are very nicely furnised. Service is excellent with good amenities. On my last stay in mid August it was about 10pm and my TV wasn't working. They called out the Maitenance manager who gave it a quick look then said it would be easier to move to a room two doors down, if I would like. He arranged everything and had the new keys delivered and wiped the cost of the room service dinner I had had to cover the inconvience. Top marks!!!! I also had the pleasure of spending some time in the pool which was very enjoyable and the bartender (during the day) in the downstairs bar was a great assett to the hotel. Again top marks. No complaints and would recommend this hotel. The rates were very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “New favorite!”
Reviews.Author: sn0w_white
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time this year to stay at this hotel. It is our new favorite for sure. We used to stay in SoBe all the time but now prefer to stay here. The bed! OMG the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Check is in easy. Rooms are spacious and very clean. We had room service every morning (continental breakfast. Yum) and the staff were so nice. Housekeeping was invisible. We never saw them yet our room was spotless when we returned every afternoon. We never dined in the restaurant as we prefered to cab it across to the restaurants in South Beach for dinner. It doesn't cost a thing to sign up with the hotel group (accor) and become a member. For that you get some perks which include early check in and late check out, and free cocktails on arrival. Maybe even an upgrade to a one bedroom suite (we got that once!). Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 night stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: dtherese83
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay. Our room was clean and neat as you can see from the photos. The pool was lovely and the work out center was acceptional, even had TV's on the treadmills. The decor was beautiful, the lobby bar was pleasant, and the restraunt was excellent for breakfast---great eggs benedict. We arrived after 8 PM and left the next afternoon for a week in the Keys...overall it was uneventful, pleasant, and I would def go back. it was only 180 a night during high season.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: beegeeLondon
Reviews.Content: As we booked an airport hotel we were not expecting a lot. But after taking the shuttle bus to the hotel and painless checking in, I was very surprised with the size of the room. Our rooms were a lot nicer than we expected them to be for what we were paying. There was plently of space in the rooms to leave luggage lying around, an extra bed and a cot without much trouble. In comparison with other 4 star hotels this was therefore a bonus. Although there was no fridge in our rooms, when we asked for it ( for medical reasons and for storing babyfood) a minifridge was delivered without any questions asked. The kids loved the pool and it was very pleasant to sit by the pool for the adults too. The hotel did get busy with airline staff and cruisers at some point, but neverfelt overcrowded. Free internet access for guests in the lobby was very useful and the computers were usually available. Even when sitting outside, I can't remember that we were bothered by the noise of airplanes, so I guess that only some rooms have problems with their windows. Mind you, we do live in London and are therefore used to airplane noise living under numerous flightpaths. I agree with the other guests that the hotel restaurant is expensive but since we only stayed there for two nights, we didn't get the chance to really find out whatelse was around. If you can, find out where to go instead of the hotel restaurant before your arrival. Overall, very nice rooms and good hotel with adequate facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel I have ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: charliedds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Florida for our honeymoon and we were going to be in Miami for 3 days so this hotel met our needs in terms of price, location and quality. I absolutely loved it. It had, BY FAR, the most comfortable bed and quilt I have ever experienced in my life, both at home and travelling. The room was so nice, I would want to replicate it at home. The room was very clean, had all the basics plus some extras. The only 2 things that happened were that when we first checked in there was pee in the toilet. That was kind of gross. And at about 8:30 in the morning housekeeping just walked right in. Or at least tried to. I had chained the door that night, so we were woken to the sound of the door being caught by the chain. It's lucky I had chained it otherwise it would have been just a wee bit embarassing. But even with that happening, the quality of the room was just amazing. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Droogy
Reviews.Content: 1. Dirty over all! the carpet in my room was from 1978 when it used to be called a holiday inn, I felt like I got dirty just closing the drapes (which were old school thick plastic daylight killers from an all night roadside motel) 2. Noisy! not only did they put me next to elevator and ice machine, but my window was on airport side and not sealed so I felt like I was in the air traffic control tower 3. Rate! They charged me over two times the rate at which I booked, which is now in dispute with the credit card company. To further the point they claim a "paperless" check in and you never sign a rate card and paperless check out so I wouldn't have seen the bill without asking 4. No amenities! No mini bar, no store in lobby, no coffee in lobby, no morning newspaper in room, small weird wash cloths, only 2 towels total, tiny crappy shampoo, smallest & worst TV seemingly purchased second hand from closing Holiday Inn in Bulgaria (with only 20 channels), no magazines in room, dirty iron that soiled my shirt, no bible, no pen, no writing paper 5. No Sheets!! 20,000 room nights in that bed before me and no sheets to cover the mattress????? Agghhhh!!!! 6. Other. clicker didn't work, door lock questionable, I could hear people walking to elevator and getting ice from the 1 inch gap at base of door, total pain parking with the gate and tickets (I had about 10 tickets in my car console by end of 3 days and it took 10 min to get out each time), above ground backyard pool, no place to jog

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Lass79
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sofitel pre cruise. After an exhausting flight from Dublin (via Heathrow), we arrived in Miami International Airport. We'd no idea how to get to the hotel and we were prepered to call a taxi but with help from a baggage handler we contacted the Sofitel to tell them that we had arrived and we would be looking for transport from the airport to the hotel. The hotel staff member I was talking to was very friendly and helpful and instructed me to wait outside the concourse and the hotel's shuttle bus would be there in 10 mins to pick us up. About 15 mins later the shuttle bus arrived and the driver was very friendly and helpful and loaded our luggage into the bus. We arrived at the hotel and were quickly checked into our room. A concierge (sp?) brought our luggage to the room. We were on the 5th floor. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The only negative thing I would say is that the noise from departing and arriving planes could be heard - so there's no sound proofing on the windows. We were shattered anyway so this didn't bother us and had no difficulty sleeping. In the morning we went down to breakfast which was buffet style and was quite nice. The freshly squeezed orange juice is to die for and we must have drank 3 glasses each just at breakfast! We checked out early, but we weren't due to leave for the ship for another hour. Even though it was completely busy in the reception area with loads of cruise travellers checking out and waiting for shuttlebuses, the staff were still extremely helpful and cheerful and even took our luggage and stored them away for us so that we could have a snack. Even though we were only there for one night, we were very pleased with the Sofitel. We have booked another cruise for next year and have requested the Sofitel again for 2 nights this time before the cruise. My 2 tips are, if you haven't booked a shuttle bus to take you to your ship - make sure you book early as all the shuttle buses were completely booked out by the next morning. Bring ear plugs if plane noises bother you :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but restaurant way overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: jrberton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night after coming back from a cruise. We pulled into port at 8:am Friday morning but checkin wasn't until 3:00pm. We took a chance and arrived at the hotel around 11:00am. Our room wasn't ready but the clerk offered to upgrade us to a business suite at no extra charge! I thought I already got a great deal for a regular room at $145/night but now I got a business suite worth $325. The staff was very accomodating and very helpful. The beds are very very comfortable. The pool with it's waterfall is really cool. The airport is only five minutes away and they provide free shuttle service. Since we didn't have a rental car, they provided a driver to drive us to a local restaurant at no charge. The one downside about the hotel that I can mention is the menu prices. I checked the restaurant menu and the entree's were very pricey, all $20+. So we ordered room service for a light meal. Two panini bread sandwichs with fries and a liter bottle of water: $42.00! By the pool we had two strawberry daquiris: $21.00! This did not include tips. But overall, I had a great stay and if I'm ever there again I'll use their shuttle service to a local restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: floridabeach1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after being married & prior to cruising the next day for our honeymoon. It did result in a funny story to tell & all worked out well. When we arrived they checked us in, but upon getting to our room, found a half naked man just out of the shower! We went back to the front desk & explained, the man showed up & basically he had asked for a late check out at 2pm and they had cleaned the room thinking he had left, but he never did! Funny start to our newly married life, but not their fault. They were very accomodating and gave us a much larger suite, many extra towels when we asked and a $100 certificate to the restaurant. We found the bed to be wonderfully relaxing & comfortable, the shower pressure was great, the meal in the restaurant was very upscale & delicious. No sounds from being near the airport at all! Overall, a great stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlunR
Reviews.Content: We flew in to Miami prior to a conference at another venue and spent two nights here. I was impressed with the hotel and found the room large. The bar area had a strange atmosphere but was friendly enough and the bar tender was excellent. Bar meals were also excellent value. The breakfast tried to be very upmarket and was of good quality. I'm glad that I wasn't paying for it as I found the cost of over $25 to be a little steep. The location was excellent for a late arrival or in need of an early departure but then again most airport hotels are! The check-in was friendly but none of our rooms were ready (I was travelling with two other business partners) - a bit odd considering we arrived at 8:30 in the evening! All in all, I would certainly recommend this hotel for air travellers as the standard is good.

Reviews.Title: “Will NOT Return”
Reviews.Author: KEWLBEANS
Reviews.Content: We pre-paid for the trip through AAA. I called the hotel the day before our trip to confirm and everything was fine. When we arrived to the hotel after a very long day of travel we had to deal with an incredibly nasty front desk manager who insisted we provide proof of the pre-payment (she demanded a bank statement from 6 months ago!). We spent our first hour calling our travel agent & credit card co in an effort to have a fax sent of the confirmation. I found the rooms to be OK - not great. Bathroom VERY small. Not enough bath towels. Although we did meet a few nice employees(the shutte driver was wonderful)- overall we felt that the service had quite the attitude. I would never return here and would not recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: macleodProvidence
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very nice at check-in. The lobby area is beautiful at first glance. We had problems getting a top sheet for our bed. I never heard of using a blanket instead of a sheet. Never got one when I asked. Also, they are stingy in the towel situation. We got 2 bath towels and one hand towel. So, if you wanted to take a shower in the morning, you were out of luck if you didn't hang your towel. Also, there was broken glass by the pool and a child got hurt during our stay. It may be impossible to prevent this but they really need someone to do a clean sweep of the pool area every morning. Plus, they had no immediate first aid available. It was uncomfortable to witness. We ate in the dining room for dinner. Very overpriced and not a very good value for the money. After spending $279.00 for four, I was quite disappointed. Plus, I shared an entree with another person in my party!!!!!!! It's not all it's cracked up to be. I did get a letter of apology from the manager so I guess they are paying attention to reviews. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed & great value”
Reviews.Author: morningdew4
Reviews.Content: I was fairly impressed with the look and feeling of the hotel upon entering the lobby. The check-in process went smoothly, and the staff were great. My room was on the 9th floor, looking out toward the runway/airport (there was very little noise from the planes). The decor and furnishings were very classy and bed was plush & comfortable. Because I had visited the hotel's website, I had slightly higher expectations about the degree of luxury and grandness.... the room was very nice but not as amazing as the website represented. Overall, I'd give the hotel 4 out of 5 stars, and would likely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facility, Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: jerrycAZ
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, large clean rooms, very nice pool and spa. We also enjoyed breakfest in the hotel resturant. Proximity to airport and free and frequent shuttle service made it very convienient for our travel stopover. On arrival, our flight was delayed 4 hours, and the staff made a special effort to feed us after the resturant had closed. The morning we checked out, they also did a rush order breakfest for us so we could get to the airport and catch our international flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For A Night”
Reviews.Author: margarita2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after arriving at Miami airport quite late from a flight from the UK. We arrived at this hotel at about 10 oclock at night and were greeted by a door man. I had booked a standard double room on a website and when we checked in, a friendly man told us that he given us a room with a nice king bed. This was a pleasant surprise, and the room was great. It was spacious with a surprisingly large and very clean bathroom. The bed was gorgeous, so soft, it was just what we needed. The view from the window is of the Lagoon and airport run way. We slept very well and did not get disturbed by the planes at all. There is a restaurant and bar in the hotel, we had a quick look, but it looked a bit fancy for what we needed after our flight. So we drove out to Coral Gables area and grabbed a bite at Dennys. After a great sleep we checked out first thing in the morning, but we would definately stay again. It is a great place for a good night sleep after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Com si, com ca”
Reviews.Author: Franto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Sofital Miami when we were on our way to South America. We arrived from the West Coast and stayed overnight continuing our trip the next evening. We arrived in Miami International Airport at about 10PM, we called the hotel for the shuttle but it never showed up. Another hotels shuttle took us there. We tipped the driver generously. Hotel was pretty good, my wife ordered room service that evening and it was way overpriced. Breakfast was good the next morning. The hotel was nice enough to let us stay until 6PM with no charge as our flight was not leaving until late that night. Overall good. But convenient only if you wish to catch a flight at MIA because it is not conveniently located close to anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nycruises
Reviews.Content: Nice room check in was a breeze but not to much to do near there if you don't have a rental car so felt a bit stranded for the better part of the day i spent there. Did take a walk to a local supermarket to buy some water and snacks. Food was good for the most part but the same as you would find in any hotel. Bar pricing was a bit high for a glass of wine with tip $16 bit over priced. Would stay there again one nice thing i did find out is that they have a suttle service to the port of miami for $10 per person one way. Better than the $35 taxi fare that they charge

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay but they charge extra for car parking”
Reviews.Author: BeardedMonk
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night. The hotel was very clean and had an upscale feel to it. The room was nice, comfortable, and quiet. The only thing I didn't like was that they charged extra for parking my rental car. I guess other hotels in that area do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: MarieMontreal
Reviews.Content: Good points: Good location and has comfortable beds. Excellent value, we paid 125$ directly through their website per night. Would stay here again. Property well kept and extremely clean. No so good points: Had supper on New Year's Eve at their restaurant, quite pricey for selection which was offered. Kitchen seemed unorganized, several tables were complaining. Maitre D seemed overwhelmed, and offered free bottle of Champagne to almost all tables to compensate for mediocre food and service. Vending machines were defective and would not accept paper denomination, when asking the front desk for change, no one was of any help. Pool was cold, would be great if it were heated.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: oneviking
Reviews.Content: High class hotel. Overall great staff and fast, friendly service. Not so impressed with the restaurant. Food was way overpriced compared to the quality. Our waiter was terrible. Dinner took over 2 hours with lots of idle time. Rooms and especially the beds were wonderful. Great rates on Sofitel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Haileysmommy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline for $80 and had not heard of it before, so we were a little skeptical. This is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed at. The shuttle was a bit slow (but what shuttle isnt at a busy airport), but the driver was very friendly, offered cold bottled water and displayed the utmost professionalism when we reached the hotel as he brought our bags in for us. Check in was smooth, reception and conceige very friendly and smiling. The room was gorgeous. We had a great room overlooking the runway of Miami airport, and of the lagoon. The noise was very minimal considering we were so close to the runway. The bathroom was exceptional with beautiful marble tops, and was nice and bright. The bed....well, the bed was something I wish we could have packed up and brought home with us. Fluffy, comfortable and made you want to stay in it all day long, it was so comfortable. The duvet and pillowtop mattress was like a huge fluffy cloud. Can you tell we loved it? The poolside was beautiful and we enjoyed the well stocked and clean gym room. This is a highly recommended hotel and we cant wait to go back! Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: Chrisandlynne
Reviews.Content: We arrived from the UK early pm after an eight hour flight and 'phoned the Sofitel to make arrangements for the airport shuttle. Unfortunately, it was not a good start as 2 shuttles drove straight past us without the drivers even glancing towards the waiting area - despite us waiving maniacally. Another call to the hotel produced the promise of a return pick-up and indeed we were whisked away on the comfy shuttle but only after a total of 55 minutes wait. Yes, in hindsight we should have simply got a cab. Thereafter, we enjoyed a restful stay. The staff were obliging and helpful. The rooms were a good size with fine queen beds, excellent shower and good general amenities. The bar area and restaurant were light and airy but the air conditioning in the restaurant was (shall we say) overzealous. Brrrrr. The food was very good and the service likewise. We thought the prices were pretty steep and maybe the bar snacks would have offered better value - but we were on holiday. There's are small shopping mall about 10-15 minutes walk away that has a liquor store, pharmacy, supermarket, fast food and restaurant if you need. All in all, the Sofitel provided a good, clean comfortable overnight stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing ambience despite airport proximity”
Reviews.Author: Jane_C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights between a flight from the UK and a cruise. 2 days because we slipped in a visit to see the Dolphins play! When we arrived at the airport we got a taxi rather than wait for the shuttle - we were tired and also there are 4 of us. It was only a few minutes away anyway. Arriving at the property was initially a little disappointing - the hotel have made (in my opinion) a mistake by having a little shop right inside the entrance which serves to rob the hotel of an impressive atrium entrance that I like in these sort of hotels. There was a further disappointment - we had two rooms. When we arrived in one there was a sink full of recent ice and empty beer bottles in the bathroom so we had to move and ended up on different floors (7 and 9)! I also found the planning of the light switches in the room to be odd - we arrived in the dark and spent several minutes feeling the walls looking for non-existent switches - they are all on the wall and floor lights. Also, as someone else said, there is only one robe in each wardrobe? Please do read on because, after a slighty faltering start, it just got better and better. Good points - The public rooms are truly lovely - classy, art-deco style. The pool area is great - plentiful towels and never busy. The view from the rooms over the lagoon is lovely and restful even though the airplanes are landing just behind it. In fact we quite enjoyed watching the planes - you could just hear them but it was not a problem. The beds were absolutely gorgeous - featherbeds to lie on and top-quality linen. The concierge was very helpful - as we left for the football he handed us four bottles of ice-cold water telling us to take care in the heat. I thought the restaurant was very good indeed. Others have said that it was expensive - maybe by US standards but by European, not so much so. Besides, it was worth it. The room was a very stylish white with touches of red glassware and the like. You might need to cover shoulders - the air-conditioning was pretty 'full on'. The breakfast in particular was lovely - I had a continental which consisted of a basket of lovely bread and pastries made by the resident French chef. My family had cooked plates that were also great. We were also presented with complimentary strawberry smoothies. We ate two breakfasts and a dinner there and everything was good - I would have preferred my apple pie served hot however. There was also a little cafe situated behing the restaurant - many people bought breakfast there and then walked back through the restaurant to the bar / lounge situated overlooking the pool area. The hotel runs a port shuttle for $10 per person. This hotel should not just be considered an airport hotel. Although you are away from the busy areas, everything is a (relatively) short taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: smercury
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Sofitel. I arrived very early in the morning, and the staff was able to accomodate me for a very early check-in. The room was very clean, with nice decorating accents throughout. The towels were very large and soft, and the robe was a nice luxurious touch. The pillow-top bed was also very comfortable. The view of the pool and lagoon was very refreshing. There was surprisingly very little airplane noise, seeing as I had a very up-close view of the runways as well. For the price I paid on Priceline ($77), it more than worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ValterNF
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very near to the airport. Near to the main highways. Great service. Excellent lounge. Fresh and new. Would recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near airport -comfy beds, but Hot! Beautiful bathroom - Relaxing pool”
Reviews.Author: K_love_GW!
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a night prior to us returning home. We didnâ€™t have any problems checking in. The rooms were nicely decorated and clean. The bathroom was beautiful with the granite countertops. The bed was heavenly. The bed has a featherbed and feather comforter. The only thing I did not like about the bed is that there were no sheets and all that down made it HOT! Donâ€™t they realize that the hotel is in Miami! The hotel is really close to the airport. You can see it from the room. The pool area was nice. The hotel has a restaurant, but like most restaurants in Miami, it was quite expensiveâ€¦â€¦but good! There is a little pastry / coffee shop in the back of the restaurant. The prices were very reasonable. You could get yummy pastries, small sandwiches and good, olâ€™ Starbucks coffee. A lot of guests might miss this little gem because you have to walk through the hotel restaurant to get to it. I only wish it stayed open all day and did not close at 2:00PM. The only problem I had was when I left my sunglasses at the front check-in desk. I went back to see if they were still there and the girl told me she would check and see if they were in lost and found. She came back and said she did not see them and told me to give her my room number just in case they found them. I checked back with the front desk later on that day and the same girl said they found it and that they put them in my room for me. I went up to my room and did not see them. I went back down the stairs to ask the girl about it and she said she would check into it and call me up in the room. I waited and waited and finally I got a call. My husband answered and the girl told him that there was a mix up and that they think they may have returned the sunglasses to someone elseâ€™s room. Then, she later said that they never found a pair of sunglasses to begin with and apologized for the confusion. My husband said that she sounded really flustered and didnâ€™t really have her facts straight. If they made a mistake, I can understand that, but I rather them just whole-heartedly admit it, rather than beating around the bush. I never had a noise problem in my room. Elevators worked fine for me, although my husband had a problem with the elevator not working right a couple times. I paid $95 a night, which I thought was a good value for the money in Miami. Parking was $7. Most other hotels in Miami charge a lot more, so I didnâ€™t mind paying only $7. Other than the whole sunglasses incident, everything was fine at the hotel. I would recommend it to people staying in Miami for a couple days. It is a nice hotel and for the most part, service was good.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: rebecca2u
Reviews.Content: So I booked the room directly with the hotel online. I decided to go for the room that was the cheapest of $95 if you prepay. I gave my credit card details and received the confirmation etc. Then a day later I received an email from the General Manager apologising as they'd lost my credit card details but confirmed that they still had my reservation. So as to avoid giving my details again and chance them losing it I said I would pay when I got there which he agreed. Now I secretly hoped that for the cock up that they would maybe upgrade me or at least offer me something. Nope! I ended up getting a cab because I waited so long at the airport for the shuttle that I didn't think the shuttle was going to turn up. When I got out of the cab there wasn't any bellman, just an elderly security guard who ended up having to bring my bags in for me. I felt awful as this man shouldn't have been lifting heavy bags (but he was sweet and insisted) I think the bellman turned up slightly later when I had finished checking in. Checking in wasn't great. I gave the girl my credit card and asked if it was going through as I'd been having problems on my holiday with the card going through sometimes and then other times not. She said it was fine and then five minutes later she asked me to pay in cash and pay extra cash if I thought I was going to charge anything to the room. When I enquired again about my card she just replied "oh yeah that hasn't gone through so will you pay in cash now". It's stupid but that really annoyed me. I had other cards to give her and I specifically asked her and explained the problem. It also didn't help that another girl came out from the room behind laughing and then then the two of them decided to have a conversation and giggle and laugh in front of me as if I suddenly wasn't there. Not really what I expected from a decent hotel. Anyway, going to the room I thought that the coridors felt really grotty and old. It felt as if I was walking through a 1 or 2 star hotel and I expected to see bit padlocks on the doors. The room was nice but it was old. Everything felt just a bit grotty although I couldn't specifically point out one thing. I felt nervous as well there for some reason and double locked the room. I had a flight in the morning and had asked for wake up call and fortunately I woke up early with a headache as I never received the wake up call. Good thing I was up as I could have easily missed my flight. You would think that an airport hotel would make wake up calls a priority point for them as their main customers are people who stay whilst in transit. I felt disappointed with this hotel. I think I would have got the exactly same standard of room and service (actually I think I would have got better service) if I'd stayed in a cheaper hotel like the Hampton Inn or Embassy Suites etc. Next time I think I'll do that. This hotel just wasn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy room !”
Reviews.Author: jfb95
Reviews.Content: The rooms has comunicate gate, without a good isolation system, and it is possible to hear clearly people speaking or TV in the other room... Impossible to sleep after a 9 hours fligh... Be aware to this type of rooms if you want to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel for one night”
Reviews.Author: RyryE
Reviews.Content: The Sofitel was a very nice airport hotel to stay in for one night. The room was very large and comfortable. We had a bit of a problem with the air conditioning during the night... couldn't get it adjusted so it was either too hot or too cold. The staff was all very professional and friendly. Our only complaint was that the airport shuttle (to be picked up from the airport) was very, very slow. It took 50 minutes for us to be picked up (after calling the hotel three times, too... they said 5-10 minutes each time). All-in-all, though, it was worth it for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for One Night”
Reviews.Author: sampagirl
Reviews.Content: After a horrible day in and out of airplanes the airline sent us to the Sofitel. Their shuttle runs between the airport and hotel every hour (what kept us waiting for a loooong time at the airport) but the hotel is very nice. Even though the rooms are small, they have clean and very comfortable beds, clean bathrooms w/plenty of towels and nice amenities. They also have a kind and accommodating staff. However, if youâ€™re staying at this Sofitel, try to ask for a room far from the ice machine because it can be very noisy. Breakfast at their restaurant was good enough. Even though the hotel is very near the airport you can hardly hear the airplanes so I imagine they have some kind of sound insulation (or I simply passed out and did not hear any noise at all...). The only setback was that at first we were given a room which was already taken by someone else because when we entered the room we found bags and glasses over the beds. So I imagine that youâ€™d better be careful with your belongings but in fact I believe this can happen to anyone.... All in all I think it was a nice stay and I believe it is a good hotel for those who want to be near the airport, but of course there are hotels in Miami that are much nicer than this Sofitel. Donâ€™t get your expectations too high and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Average Rooms - Beware of Biting Ants!!!”
Reviews.Author: prere
Reviews.Content: I stayed here. The rooms are average but I had a horrible experience. My clothes in the room became infested with ants that ended up biting me all over and leaving painful red welts. I shudder every time I think about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not comparable to others in the Sofitel chain”
Reviews.Author: coolkat1
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Sofitel on May 27th. We were very much looking forward to this stay having stayed at a Sofitel in Athens Greece and Philadelphia, what a let down if you are comparing apples to apples. Our stay was average, not the level you would expect from the Sofitel chain - the workers very nice and accomodating, the room was little "plain" in comparison. Our only big complaint was that the pool was very dirty and the guests partying around the pool were very offensive and used very offensive language, I was appalled that management did not address this, we had our young son with us so we did not spend much time around the pool because of this. Upon check out the next morning we realized there were some "rap musicians" staying there as well, these were obviously the guests that were at the pool the evening prior. I would not stay at this Sofitel again I would consider the Marriott or Hilton next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel wished we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: Sheryll
Reviews.Content: We only booked this hotel for one night as were flying out to LA the next day and wanted a hotel close to the Airport. We had stayed a few days earlier at The Hyatt Maimi (my review on this was poor) before heading down to Key West for a few nights then back to Miaimi. We wished we had stayed in this hotel for the earlier nights. Whilst not centrally located, its only about 10-15 minutes drive to downtown Maimi, we would recommend it. Check in was great - we also got upgraded to a suite, the suite was wonderful, very large separate bathroom, huge separate lounge area and quite a spacious bathrom. The bar area looked pleasant and we took drinks out by the pool and relaxed for an hour or so which was pleasant. This hotel that night had a lot of English people staying in it before leaving for Caribean Cruises so a lot of cheeful conversation with other guests which added to the ambience. . We had dinner in their main restaurant which was superb, the service was very good and the food was excellent. We decided to have coffee in the bar area and this is where it all fell apart. The Bar area is quite large and people were also eating snacks. After about 10 minutes of trying to get a waiters attention my husband gave up and went and found one. He was quite rude and we explained we only wanted coffee and a liquor told us we would have a big wait as they were more concerned about serving the food people. We then left immediately. Fortunately for us the Manager of the Restaurant was passing as we left and could see we were not happy, he took us back into his Restaurant and organised our coffee straight away. ( It was not complimentary ) but he did at least seemed concerned re our plight. Would recommend this restaurant for business travellers or couples and tourists if you dont mind staying near the airport. But a much better hotel than the Hyatt Miaimi which was more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night”
Reviews.Author: Ed05
Reviews.Content: Got a really good deal of about $100 through Hotwire for one night in transit from UK to Jamaica Hotel shuttle bus was waiting when I left terminal building. Check in smooth. Given a room on 4th floor which overlooked the cooling fans on one side and the car park on the other. But for that price and at 8pm at night I wasnt too disappointed. Ordered room service,-and this is my only complaint- when it was delivered I noticed the cheeck had been lft blank for a tip even though it says quite clearly on the menu a 19%( where did that figure come from?) gratuity and a $2.50 delivery charge would be added automatically to the bill. I pointed this out to the delivery person who said ' we only get half of that - that's why its left opened'. If this is true , surely a company like Sofitel needs to get its act together. They wouldnt get away with this in their European Hotels. I should have queried this further at the timebut tiredness put a stop to that Anyway, food was very good. Had a great sleep in a very comfortable bed. Easy check out with free coffe in reception at 0600hrs and shuttle bus waiting. All in all great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for a one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: MrsTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our way to the Caribbean and one night on our way back the first week of April '06. We paid $65/night for each stay, thanks to Priceline. The Sofitel has a free shuttle to/from the airport. It leaves the hotel every half-hour on the hour. We landed in Miami around 11pm (our flight was delayed). We didn't feel like waiting for the shuttle (we had our 4-year-old with us and it had been a long day), so we took a taxi. Cost: $16 (not including tip). There was one gentleman at the front desk and no line. He was on the phone with what sounded to me like a hotel customer. He said he'd help me in a bit. Meantime, another couple arrived and the concierge said she would check them in. I internally debated whether I should say we were here first but decided to just let it go. I believe that because I chose not to make a big deal about it and said it was okay when the guy apologized for the delay, he upgraded us to a suite on the 5th floor, King bed and non-smoking. He really didn't have to do that and I certainly was not expecting him to, so that was a really nice surprise. We've stayed in a standard room at this hotel in the past and the suite was definitely an improvement, although at the end of the day this is still just an airport hotel. The suite has a sitting room with 2 sofas, table, tv, desk and 2 chairs. The bedroom was a bit on the small side. The bathroom is what you'd find in any standard room. The suite looked a bit worn. The carpet and sofas had a few stains. The wooden furniture had a few dings to it. We ordered room service before going to bed: buffalo wings and a grilled turkey breast sandwich. Our food was really good, or maybe we just were really hungry?? :-) Those 2 meals with a bottled water came to $50 (19% gratuity included). We ordered room service for breakfast as well. 2 American breakfasts (scrambled eggs, bacon, 2 juices), 1 bottled water and another juice totaled $33 (19% gratuity included). On the way back from the Caribbean, we got a standard room. We asked for a King bed and non-smoking. We got that no problem. The bed in that room was AWFUL. Both my husband and I did not sleep well and our backs hurt in the morning. Also in this room, there was no separate sheet to cover ourselves, just a heavy comforter and we'd get hot after a while. Why would they not have a cover sheet is beyond me. We think it's an okay hotel for a one-night stay and on a Priceline win. I wouldn't pay regular price to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: meulen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the hotel later in the evening after travelling all day and we wanted a cool drink and snack before going to bed. The lounge is lovely to look at but very few of the tables had been bussed. As we sat there the manager walked through, had an arguement with the busser in front of us which then spread through the bar staff. We wanted to change our table as we were near a large group of noisey men but the tables were dirty. The hotel itself was very clean, the room was average, no minibar or water. Our experience was not what we wanted and we won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Will go again”
Reviews.Author: JuliaLondon
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for one night before returning back to the UK. It was located five minutes from the airport but the rooms were so well insulated you barely heard the planes taking off next door.My 4 year old thought it was fantastic having an airport next door. The staff were very helpful especially when I said I was disappointed with the first room they showed me. Immediately I was upgraded to a suite and moved several floors up to get a better view of the lagoon. We spent the day lounging by the pool (which was a bit cold!) and they also extended check in to 2.00pm so we could change ready for our flight in comfort. The food was great, albeit by US standards a bit pricey. I would not hesitate staying here again and my friends who dropped us at the hotel are also considering a stay. The staff were friendly and helpful. I recommend this hotel to anyone with time to kill who doesn't want to hang about at the airport. the shuttle bus was every half hour and took no more than 10 minutes to get to the terminal. Well done to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: VacaBird
Reviews.Content: The very attentive and helpful staff is this hotel's best asset. Every employee seemed well-versed in good customer service. The hotel shuttle to/from the airport runs every half hour. It would have been nice for the hotel website to mention that this runs regularly to avoid having to call on arrival. The Miami airport can be a zoo in the pickup/dropoff zone and it is helpful to know exactly where you should be (up on the 2nd level where the "Departures" come, NOT on the ground level for "Pick-up") and when to expect a shuttle. The staff was very helpful in locating the shuttle and providing an ETA when I called, though. The hotel public areas are lovely. The rooms seemed a bit more average, but very clean. The VERY fluffy down bed things are wonderful. Rooms have internet connections (wired, about $10 per day), and I believe I heard someone say there was wireless capability in at least some areas of the hotel (though the colleagues who said this were not having success in making this work, so unsure what the details are). Clearly heard the TV in the room next door (seemingly through the closed connecting door). No coffee in room. USA Today available in lobby. Late check-out was available on the date I was there with Sofitel guest membership (free, sign-up online). The restaurant on site is also lovely and food is prepared in a reasonable amount of time. Menu is not extensive, but seemd to include a decent variety. Approximate prices=sandwiches/hamburger around $12-14 with fries or salad, entrees more around $20, soups/salads around $8-10. More wines on the menu than food. Would be willing to stay here again for business if needed. Would definitely not be my first choice for a comfortable family vacation - making it nicer probably for those of you who would like to avoid comfortable familes on vacation! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Post cruise stay at the Sofitel”
Reviews.Author: BettyB2
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of research on Hotels for our pre and post cruise stays while in Miami and decided on the Sofitel for our post cruise night due to its proximity to the airport and the free shuttle. I had booked the hotel around 3 months in advance of our trip and was able to get it for $122 per night by booking thru their website. It was more than I wanted to pay, but was very happy with the hotel. It is too depressing for me to get off of a cruise ship (the most comfortable bed and pillows EVER) and end our vacation, so I know must stay one night post cruise. Little did I know that this hotel would make me feel like I was still on the ship!! We debarked around noon and we were to the hotel by 12:30 and checked in. The lobby was beautiful and the doorman/bellman very helpful. The room was gorgeous and shockingly, the bed was just as comfortable as the one we had just left on the ship. There is a telephone in the bathroom and the sound from the television is piped into the bathroom so you dont miss a moment of your favorite show, news or music. .You can hook up to the internet at the desk in room for $9.95. Being outside on the deck by the pool and the water was heaven as I sipped on a Mojito ($8)....I didnt even have sealegs as my body was still on ship time. Felt like I was still on vacation. Views very nice outside and there is also a garden-patio area. A couple of guys were fixing the "crocodile fence" on the other side of the pool near the ocean. Apparently part of the fence had come down during one of the hurricanes and they were closing it up the day we were there to keep the crocs out! We did not see any nearby or anywhere. Menu prices were high for food, but they had huge servings. They serve you a medley of olives and little baked cheese type crackers that are baked on premises. Grounds are very nice; hotel inside and outside is just stunning and pleasing to they eye. Staff friendly and helpful and they treat you sooo good. Only downside is that there is not anything nearby that you can walk to (like Bayside) but overall, it was a very pleasant stay. I may stay there again someday, but next time will look for a hotel that is closer to some action (restaurants, beaches etc) as I found $13 for a bagel, salmon and red onion a little too high priced for breakfast!! They do have a nice menu and although not on it, I heard the bartender take orders for chicken fingers and burgers (not on menu). My Mojito was made from scratch and was the best I have ever had....maybe not worth $8, but must have been good since I had ALMOST 2 1/2 drinks!! Our morning pot of coffee was almost $15 delivered to our room !! Granted it was beautifully presented, but worth that much?? It included gratuity, but we still gave the girl $2. So total was $17!!! (NOTE- I have tried unsucessfully to upload pictures to this site. I have some very nice ones of the rooms, lobby and grounds)

Reviews.Title: “Contradiction”
Reviews.Author: kikaan
Reviews.Content: How can it be explained that hotels charging double the rate of others offer much less services and are even inventive in finding items to put on your bill? We stayed in another airport hotel offering a nice pool area,free coffee,internet access,local calls,parking and breakfast??? The Sofitel Miami's rate was double and offers none of these niceties,a smallish pool, and charges heftily for all the above plus 7$ to allow guests to park on their own open air parking. Room,bathroom were O.K. Too long waits at the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay !!!!”
Reviews.Author: RAAP
Reviews.Content: Great service. The only thing I can recall is the need to heat the pool, it is too cold. Unforgetable stay!!!. Thanks Sofitel Miami.
